Quote: You only need one man to love you. But him to love you free like a wildfire, crazy like the moon, always like tomorrow, sudden like an inhale and overcoming like the tides. Only one man and all of this.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.

Author: Harsha Bhogle
Quote: In sports teams, apart from talk of sporting prowess and the imparting of inspirational thought, an extraordinary amount of time is spent discussing, and flaunting, material possessions.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.

Author: Malala Yousafzai
Quote: Benazir Bhutto was an inspirational leader and an inspirational woman.

Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People
Quote: Don't be afraid of enemies who attack you. Be afraid of the friends who flatter you.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: Why do they always teach us that it's easy and evil to do what we want and that we need discipline to restrain ourselves? It's the hardest thing in the world--to do what we want. And it takes the greatest kind of courage. I mean, what we really want.

Author: Tina Brown
Quote: It's as if inside the White House the belief in Obama's inspirational charisma is still such that every time the ugliness of brute politics intrudes, it's a startling revelation.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for.

Author: Christine Teigen
Quote: I'm not an inspirational quote kind of person.

Author: Tupac Shakur
Quote: Death is not the greatest loss in life. The greatest loss is what dies inside while still alive. Never surrender.

Author: Paloma Picasso
Quote: I think, aesthetically, car design is so interesting - the dashboards, the steering wheels, and the beauty of the mechanics. I don't know how any of it works, I don't want to know, but it's inspirational.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: The damage was permanent; there would always be scars. But even the angriest scars faded over time until it was difficult to see them written on the skin at all, and the only thing that remained was the memory of how painful it had been.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned

Author: Roma Downey
Quote: This CD became something of a personal journey for me. The tone of the whole CD is uplifting and inspirational. It's an upper. We have enough downers in the world.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire
Quote: Aim higher in case you fall short.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song
Quote: In the end you should always do the right thing even if it's hard.

Author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta
Quote: Everybody is special. Everybody. Everybody is a hero, a lover, a fool, a villain. Everybody. Everybody has their story to tell.

Author: Susan Sontag
Quote: Do stuff. be clenched, curious. Not waiting for inspiration's shove or society's kiss on your forehead. Pay attention. It's all about paying attention. attention is vitality. It connects you with others. It makes you eager. stay eager.

Author: Taylor Dayne
Quote: My tastes and inspirational artists were always rather eclectic and diverse.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent
Quote: One ChoiceOne Choice, decided your friends.One Choice, defines your beliefs.One Choice, determines your loyalties - Forever.ONCE CHOICE CAN TRANSFORM YOU

Author: Lou Holtz
Quote: When all is said and done, more is said than done.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The only person who can pull me down is myself, and I'm not going to let myself pull me down anymore.

Author: David Chipperfield
Quote: If you look at a building by Mies van der Rohe, it might look very simple, but up close, the sheer quality of construction, materials and thought are inspirational.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: Music has always been a matter of Energy to me, a question of Fuel. Sentimental people call it Inspiration, but what they really mean is Fuel. I have always needed Fuel. I am a serious consumer. On some nights I still believe that a car with the gas needle on empty can run about fifty more miles if you have the right music very loud on the radio.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Rilke's Book of Hours: Love Poems to God
Quote: I live my life in widening circles that reach out across the world.

Author: Conor Maynard
Quote: I would probably work with Drake as he is massively inspirational to me as a writer as well as an artist. If not him, then Susan Boyle!

Author: مصطفى محمود,  أكل عيش
Quote: أريد لحظة انفعال...لحظة حب...لحظة دهشة..لحظة اكتشاف...لحظة معرفة...أريد لحظة تجعل لحياتى معنى..إن حياتى من أجل أكل العيش لا معنى لها لأنها مجرد إستمرار

Author: Anaïs Nin,  Henry And June
Quote: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.

Author: Bobby Keys
Quote: I pull a lot of the stuff that I play off the rhythm tracks - and Keith Richards has been one of the main contributors to my inspirational playing.

Author: Steven Bauer
Quote: I'm very fond of the British cinema. I'm a big fan of Martin Campbell and Daniel Craig. I actually find Daniel very inspirational, especially on the physical side of things. He really inspired me to get back into shape when I started to add on a few pounds. I think he's a great role model.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Thus Spoke Zarathustra
Quote: The higher we soar the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.

Author: Donnie Yen
Quote: Better to be called something positive and inspirational than something negative.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: Dumbledore will only leave from Hogwarts when there are none loyal to him!

Author: Neill Blomkamp
Quote: A lot of America is kind of done. People have been making films about it for 100 years. Everything to me feels used up. But Jo-Burg feels unbelievably inspirational to me.

Author: Antony Gormley
Quote: I believe in the city as a natural human environment, but we must humanize it. It's art that will re-define public space in the 21st Century. We can make our cities diverse, inspirational places by putting art, dance and performance in all its forms into the matrix of street life.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Last night I lost the world, and gained the universe.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.

Author: Cesare Pavese
Quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.

Author: George Carlin
Quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.

Author: Hermann Hesse
Quote: I have always believed, and I still believe, that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.

Author: Marilynne Robinson,  Home
Quote: There's so much to be grateful for, words are poor things.

Author: Earl Nightingale
Quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.

Author: Thomas A. Edison
Quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

Author: Elbert Hubbard,  The Roycroft Dictionary Concocted by Ali Baba and the Bunch on Rainy Days
Quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Excellence is never an accident. It is always the result of high intention, sincere effort, and intelligent execution; it represents the wise choice of many alternatives - choice, not chance, determines your destiny.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I think that we are like stars. Something happens to burst us open; but when we burst open and think we are dying; we’re actually turning into a supernova. And then when we look at ourselves again, we see that we’re suddenly more beautiful than we ever were before!

Author: Phillips Brooks
Quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.

Author: Mary Kay Ash
Quote: Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Return of the King
Quote: For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince
Quote: People where you live,"the little prince said, "grow five thousand roses in one garden... yet they don't find what they're looking for...They don't find it,"I answered.And yet what they're looking for could be found in a single rose, or a little water..."Of course,"I answered.And the little prince added, "But eyes are blind. You have to look with the heart.

Author: Ken Hensley
Quote: I know why I am here and my only real focused goal is to live each day to the fullest and to try and honor God and be an encouragement to others. What the future holds is firmly in God's hands, and I am very happy about that!

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: We meet no ordinary people in our lives.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: Around here, however, we don't look backwards for very long. We keep moving forward, opening up new doors and doing new things, because we're curious...and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: For me, I am driven by two main philosophies: know more today about the world than I knew yesterday and lessen the suffering of others. You'd be surprised how far that gets you.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Change the way you look at things and the things you look at change.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Make the most of yourself....for that is all there is of you.

Author: Theodore Roethke
Quote: What we need is more people who specialize in the impossible.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: Just be yourself, there is no one better.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.

Author: Anaïs Nin,  The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 7: 1966-1974
Quote: We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living, It's a way of looking at life through the wrong end of a telescope. Which is what I do, And that enables you to laugh at life's realities.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: I'd rather learn from one bird how to sing than teach ten thousand stars how not to dance

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Diary
Quote: All the effort in the world won't matter if you're not inspired.

Author: Sylvester Stallone
Quote: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: The best things in life make you sweaty.

Author: Henry Rollins
Quote: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: Music melts all the separate parts of our bodies together.

Author: David Richo
Quote: Our wounds are often the openings into the best and most beautiful part of us.

Author: Michelangelo
Quote: Lord, grant that I may always desire more than I can accomplish.

Author: Anaïs Nin,  Henry And June
Quote: There are two ways to reach me: by way of kisses or by way of the imagination. But there is a hierarchy: the kisses alone don't work.

Author: Ella Baker
Quote: Give light and people will find the way.

Author: John Cheever
Quote: Fiction is art and art is the triumph over chaos… to celebrate a world that lies spread out around us like a bewildering and stupendous dream.

Author: Gene Stratton-Porter,  A Girl of the Limberlost
Quote: If you are lazy, and accept your lot, you may live in it. If you are willing to work, you can write your name anywhere you choose.

Author: Johannes Brahms
Quote: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.

Author: William Ellery Channing
Quote: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: People have to forgive. We don't have to like them, we don't have to be friends with them, we don't have to send them hearts in text messages, but we have to forgive them, to overlook, to forget. Because if we don't we are tying rocks to our feet, too much for our wings to carry!

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When in a relationship, a real man doesn't make his woman jealous of others, he makes others jealous of his woman.

Author: Nisargadatta Maharaj
Quote: It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates.

Author: Rachel Carson,  Silent Spring
Quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts. There is something infinitely healing in the repeated refrains of nature -- the assurance that dawn comes after night, and spring after winter.

Author: Christopher Morley
Quote: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.

Author: James Dean
Quote: Dream as if you will live forever; Live as if you will die today.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay,  The Selected Poetry
Quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make,And better friends I'll not be knowing,Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take,No matter where it's going.

Author: Laurence Sterne
Quote: What a large volume of adventures may be grasped within the span of his little life by him who interests his heart in everything.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings.

Author: e. e. cummings
Quote: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.

Author: Christopher Paolini
Quote: Without fear there cannot be courage.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: There is no dishonor in losing the race. There is only dishonor in not racing because you are afraid to lose.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Mark of Athena
Quote: It's okay,” he said. “We're together.” He didn't say you're okay, or we're alive. After all they'd been through over the last year, he knew that the most important thing was that they were together. She loved him for saying that.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Eleven Minutes
Quote: No one loses anyone, because no one owns anyone. That is the true experience of freedom: having the most important thing in the world without owning it

Author: Lucy Larcom
Quote: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.

Author: John Wooden
Quote: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: There is the great lesson of 'Beauty and the Beast,' that a thing must be loved before it is lovable.

Author: John Maynard Keynes
Quote: Ideas shape the course of history.

Author: Andrew Wyeth
Quote: It's a moment that I'm after, a fleeting moment, but not a frozen moment.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: Be empty of worrying.Think of who created thought!Why do you stay in prisonWhen the door is so wide open?

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, They have to take you in.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: There is nothing more rare, nor more beautiful, than a woman being unapologetically herself; comfortable in her perfect imperfection. To me, that is the true essence of beauty.

Author: William Faulkner
Quote: Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.

Author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon
Quote: When deeds speak, words are nothing.

Author: Lou Holtz
Quote: You'll never get ahead of anyone as long as you try to get even with him.

Author: Seneca
Quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future, not to amuse ourselves with either hopes or fears but to rest satisfied with what we have, which is sufficient, for he that is so wants nothing. The greatest blessings of mankind are within us and within our reach. A wise man is content with his lot, whatever it may be, without wishing for what he has not.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: I said to my soul, be still and wait without hope, for hope would be hope for the wrong thing; wait without love, for love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, but the faith and the love are all in the waiting. Wait without thought, for you are not ready for thought: So the darkness shall be the light, and the stillness the dancing.

Author: Friedrich Schiller
Quote: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.

Author: Rick Warren,  The Purpose Driven Life: What on Earth Am I Here for?
Quote: We are products of our past, but we don't have to be prisoners of it.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.

Author: William Allen White
Quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!

Author: Marc Wambolt,  Poems from the Heart
Quote: I may not always be with you But when we're far apartRemember you will be with meRight inside my heart

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I never made one of my discoveries through the process of rational thinking

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live.

Author: Emmet Fox
Quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas
Quote: I believe there is another world waiting for us. A better world. And I'll be waiting for you there.

Author: J.M. Barrie
Quote: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.

Author: Terry Pratchett
Quote: I'd rather be a rising ape than a falling angel.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Quote: What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Demian: Die Geschichte von Emil Sinclairs Jugend
Quote: I have been and still am a seeker, but I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.

Author: Amos Bronson Alcott
Quote: Our ideals are our better selves.

Author: Carlos Castaneda
Quote: We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: Whether you live to be 50 or 100 makes no difference, if you made no difference in the world.

Author: Brené Brown
Quote: Owning our story can be hard but not nearly as difficult as spending our lives running from it. Embracing our vulnerabilities is risky but not nearly as dangerous as giving up on love and belonging and joy—the experiences that make us the most vulnerable. Only when we are brave enough to explore the darkness will we discover the infinite power of our light.

Author: Marlee Matlin
Quote: Silence is the last thing the world will ever hear from me.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  The Truth About Forever
Quote: What you have to decide... is how you want your life to be. If your forever was ending tomorrow, would this be how you'd want to have spent it? Listen, the truth is, nothing is guaranteed. You know that more than anybody. So dont be afraid. Be alive.

Author: William Bartram
Quote: On the recollection of so many and great favours and blessings, I now, with a high sense of gratitude, presume to offer up my sincere thanks to the Almighty, the Creator and Preserver.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: The great thing to remember is that though our feelings come and go God's love for us does not.

Author: Han Suyin
Quote: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.

Author: Kevyn Aucoin
Quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.

Author: Ella Fitzgerald
Quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.

Author: David Mitchell,  Cloud Atlas
Quote: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: There's more to life than dating the boy on the football team.

Author: C. S. Lewis
Quote: Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: Those who do not weep, do not see.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: We all make mistakes, have struggles, and even regret things in our past. But you are not your mistakes, you are not your struggles, and you are here NOW with the power to shape your day and your future.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: A mathematical formula for happiness:Reality divided by Expectations.There were two ways to be happy:improve your reality or lower your expectations.

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.

Author: Veronica Roth
Quote: Since I was young, I have always known this: Life damages us, every one. We can’t escape that damage. But now, I am also learning this: We can be mended. We mend each other

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win;Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.

Author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You’ll Go!
Quote: Oh the places you'll go! There is fun to be done! There are points to be scored. There are games to be won. And the magical things you can do with that ball will make you the winning-est winner of all.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.

Author: أنيس منصور
Quote: الإكتشاف ليس أن تجد أرضاً جديدة .. وإنما أن ترى بعيون جديدة

Author: Blaise Pascal
Quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.

Author: Dylan Thomas,  Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night
Quote: Do not go gentle into that good night,Old age should burn and rave at close of day;Rage, rage against the dying of the light.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Battle of the Labyrinth
Quote: Getting something and having the wits to use it...those are two different things.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.

Author: Jarod Kintz
Quote: If I saw you hitchhiking, I’d smile and return your thumb’s up, just for you doing such a great job of being a positive roadside influence.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: What's the world's greatest lie?... It's this: that at a certain point in our lives, we lose control of what's happening to us, and our lives become controlled by fate.

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try"to do things. You simply "must"do things.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner
Quote: There is a way to be good again...

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe
Quote: It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity
Quote: And out of that hopeless attempt has come nearly all that we call human history—money, poverty, ambition, war, prostitution, classes, empires, slavery—the long terrible story of man trying to find something other than God which will make him happy.

Author: Carrie-Anne Moss
Quote: People tell you the world looks a certain way. Parents tell you how to think. Schools tell you how to think. TV. Religion. And then at a certain point, if you're lucky, you realize you can make up your own mind. Nobody sets the rules but you. You can design your own life.

Author: Mae West
Quote: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Be like the sun for grace and mercy. Be like the night to cover others' faults. Be like running water for generosity. Be like death for rage and anger. Be like the Earth for modesty. Appear as you are. Be as you appear.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Hobbit
Quote: So comes snow after fire, and even dragons have their endings.

Author: Pope Paul VI
Quote: Of all human activities, man's listening to God is the supreme act of his reasoning and will.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.

Author: Ben Okri
Quote: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Make a pact with yourself today to not be defined by your past. Sometimes the greatest thing to come out of all your hard work isn't what you get for it, but what you become for it. Shake things up today! Be You...Be Free...Share.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: If you're going to be crazy, you have to get paid for it or else you're going to be locked up.

Author: André Gide
Quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: If I am to be fallen into love, I will. And if as a result I will appear to be stupid, disillusioned, and of poor judgment, I will. And I would be damned if I cared what other people think. For I would rather be thought of as all of these things, than not love. If in loving, I become the naked woman on the horse, I will ride that horse with my head held high. This is my spirit. I am unbreakable.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Avonlea
Quote: After all,"Anne had said to Marilla once, "I believe the nicest and sweetest days are not those on which anything very splendid or wonderful or exciting happens but just those that bring simple little pleasures, following one another softly, like pearls slipping off a string.

Author: Zane Grey
Quote: I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: The love that moves the sun and the other stars.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I'm not in search of sanctity, sacredness, purity; these things are found after this life, not in this life; but in this life I search to be completely human: to feel, to give, to take, to laugh, to get lost, to be found, to dance, to love and to lust, to be so human.

Author: Unknown
Quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and then hoping it will kill your enemies.

Author: Suzanne Weyn,  Mr. Magorium's Wonder Emporium
Quote: Your life is an occasion. Rise to it.

Author: Max Ehrmann,  Desiderata: A Poem for a Way of Life
Quote: With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams,it is still a beautiful world.Be cheerful.Strive to be happy.

Author: Tyra Banks
Quote: Never dull your shine for somebody else.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.

Author: Georgia O'Keeffe
Quote: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Don't ever take a fence down until you know why it was put up.

Author: George Eliot
Quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  A Stroke of Midnight
Quote: My father had taught me to be nice first, because you can always be mean later, but once you've been mean to someone, they won't believe the nice anymore. So be nice, be nice, until it's time to stop being nice, then destroy them.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: When each day is the same as the next, it’s because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises.

Author: Francis Quarles
Quote: My mind's my kingdom.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.

Author: John Locke
Quote: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.

Author: Matthew Prior
Quote: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt,  The Autobiography of Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure. You have no security unless you can live bravely, excitingly, imaginatively; unless you can choose a challenge instead of competence.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am my own biggest critic. Before anyone else has criticized me, I have already criticized myself. But for the rest of my life, I am going to be with me and I don't want to spend my life with someone who is always critical. So I am going to stop being my own critic. It's high time that I accept all the great things about me.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful.

Author: William James
Quote: Belief creates the actual fact.

Author: Rumi
Quote: We come spinning out of nothingness, scattering stars like dust.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be.

Author: Madonna
Quote: No matter who you are, no matter what you did, no matter where you've come from, you can always change, become a better version of yourself.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: Bottom line is, even if you see 'em coming, you're not ready for the big moments. No one asks for their life to change, not really. But it does. So what are we, helpless? Puppets? No. The big moments are gonna come. You can't help that. It's what you do afterwards that counts. That's when you find out who you are.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: We convince by our presence.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I will not try to convince you to love me, to respect me, to commit to me. I deserve better than that; I AM BETTER THAN THAT...Goodbye.

Author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
Quote: Light tomorrow with today!

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  The Letters of Charlotte Brontë
Quote: But life is a battle: may we all be enabled to fight it well!

Author: Donald J. Trump
Quote: Get going. Move forward. Aim High. Plan a takeoff. Don't just sit on the runway and hope someone will come along and push the airplane. It simply won't happen. Change your attitude and gain some altitude. Believe me, you'll love it up here.

Author: Lou Holtz
Quote: You're never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you're never as bad as they say when you lose.

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.

Author: Rick Yancey,  The 5th Wave
Quote: We’re here, and then we’re gone, and it’s not about the time we’re here, but what we do with the time.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ...

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  I Have A Dream
Quote: I have a dream that one day little black boys and girls will be holding hands with little white boys and girls.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: If a problem is fixable, if a situation is such that you can do something about it, then there is no need to worry. If it's not fixable, then there is no help in worrying. There is no benefit in worrying whatsoever.

Author: Roman Payne,  The Wanderess
Quote: She was free in her wildness. She was a wanderess, a drop of free water. She belonged to no man and to no city

Author: Nikos Kazantzakis
Quote: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.

Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of Anne Frank
Quote: In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.

Author: Walt Disney Company,  Cinderella: A Little Golden Book
Quote: A dream is a wish your heart makes, when you're fast asleep.

Author: Harlan Ellison,  Paingod and Other Delusions
Quote: I know that pain is the most important thing in the universes. Greater than survival, greater than love, greater even than the beauty it brings about. For without pain, there can be no pleasure. Without sadness, there can be no happiness. Without misery there can be no beauty. And without these, life is endless, hopeless, doomed and damned. Adult. You have become adult.

Author: Christa McAuliffe
Quote: Reach for the stars.

Author: Steven Moffat
Quote: The universe is big, its vast and complicated, and ridiculous. And sometimes, very rarely, impossible things just happen and we call them miracles. And that's the theory. Nine hundred years, never seen one yet, but this would do me.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Imagination is the highest form of research.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: If you're horrible to me, I'm going to write a song about it, and you won't like it. That's how I operate.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Renew, release, let go. Yesterday’s gone. There’s nothing you can do to bring it back. You can’t “should’ve” done something. You can only DO something. Renew yourself. Release that attachment. Today is a new day!

Author: Confucius
Quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay
Quote: Fake it 'till you make it.

Author: Paul Klee
Quote: A single day is enough to make us a little larger or, another time, a little smaller.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book
Quote: If you dare nothing, then when the day is over, nothing is all you will have gained.

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: People don't realize how a man's whole life can be changed by one book.

Author: Ella Fitzgerald
Quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.

Author: Ernst F. Schumacher
Quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius — and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson,  Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Quote: In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity.

Author: أحلام مستغانمي
Quote: عجيبة هي الحياة بمنطقها المعاكس. أنت تركض خلف الأشياء لاهثاً، فتهرب الأشياء منك. وما تكاد تجلس وتقنع نفسك بأنها لا تستحق كل هذا الركض، حتى تأتيك هي لاهثة. وعندها لا تدري أيجب أن تدير لها ظهرك أم تفتح لها ذراعيك، وتتلقى هذه الهبة التي رمتها السماء إليك، والتي قد تكون فيها سعادتك، أو هلاكك؟

Author: George Lucas,  The Star Wars Trilogy
Quote: No! Try not. Do, or do not. There is no try.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You walked away from gossip and verbal defamation? Let today be the day…You speak only the good you know of other people and encourage others to do the same.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: The rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened.

Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft
Quote: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Don't think about making life better for other people who don't even deserve you, rather, focus on making your life the best, for yourself and those who love you.

Author: Howard Thurman
Quote: Don’t ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and go do it. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,  A Little Princess
Quote: Whatever comes,"she said, "cannot alter one thing. If I am a princess in rags and tatters, I can be a princess inside. It would be easy to be a princess if I were dressed in cloth of gold, but it is a great deal more of a triumph to be one all the time when no one knows it.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Battle of the Labyrinth
Quote: But remember, boy, that a kind act can sometimes be as powerful as a sword.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I'm unpredictable, I never know where I'm going until I get there, I'm so random, I'm always growing, learning, changing, I'm never the same person twice. But one thing you can be sure of about me; is I will always do exactly what I want to do.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: People take different roads seeking fulfillment and happiness. Just because they’re not on your road doesn’t mean they’ve gotten lost.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: All The Woulda-Coulda-ShouldasLayin' In The Sun,Talkin' 'Bout The ThingsThey Woulda-Coulda-Shoulda Done...But All Those Woulda-Coulda-ShouldasAll Ran Away And HidFrom One Little Did.

Author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
Quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.

Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
Quote: Remember that everyone you meet is afraid of something, loves something and has lost something.

Author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah
Quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.Listen to it carefully.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: You are, after all, what you think. Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: Just because you fall once, doesn't mean you're fall at everything. Keep trying, hold on, and always trust yourself, because if you don't then who will??

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: The things that we love tell us what we are.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: The power of finding beauty in the humblest things makes home happy and life lovely.

Author: Morgan Matson,  Amy and Roger's Epic Detour
Quote: The best discoveries always happened to the people who weren't looking for them.

Author: Napoleon Hill,  Think and Grow Rich: A Black Choice
Quote: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: I am a happy camper so I guess I’m doing something right. Happiness is like a butterfly; the more you chase it, the more it will elude you, but if you turn your attention to other things, it will come and sit softly on your shoulder.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: The easiest thing to be in the world is you. The most difficult thing to be is what other people want you to be. Don't let them put you in that position.

Author: Warren Buffett
Quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I'd invented it, because it is very true.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: My Life is My Message

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!

Author: Wayne Dyer
Quote: The essential lesson I've learned in life is to just be yourself. Treasure the magnificent being that you are and recognize first and foremost you're not here as a human being only. You're a spiritual being having a human experience.

Author: Charlie Chaplin
Quote: Nothing is permanent in this wicked world, not even our troubles.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: I sustain myself with the love of family.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: If you dont have any shadows you're not in the light

Author: Sam Levenson
Quote: Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, it's at the end of your arm, as you get older, remember you have another hand: The first is to help yourself, the second is to help others.

Author: John Wayne
Quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.

Author: Zayn Malik
Quote: Life is funny. Things change, people change, but you will always be you, so stay true to yourself and never sacrifice who you are for anyone.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: With self-discipline most anything is possible.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when, whatever be the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: I've come to believe that each of us has a personal calling that's as unique as a fingerprint - and that the best way to succeed is to discover what you love and then find a way to offer it to others in the form of service, working hard, and also allowing the energy of the universe to lead you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Live your truth. Express your love. Share your enthusiasm. Take action towards your dreams. Walk your talk. Dance and sing to your music. Embrace your blessings. Make today worth remembering.

Author: George Lucas
Quote: Always remember, your focus determines your reality.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Though the road's been rocky it sure feels good to me.

Author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi
Quote: You must take life the way it comes at you and make the best of it.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent
Quote: Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up. I've seen it. It's fascinating."He releases me but doesn't pull away, his hand grazing my jaw, my neck. "Sometimes I just...want to see it again. Want to see you awake.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.

Author: Meg Cabot,  All-American Girl
Quote: Being brave is when you have to do something because you know it is right, but at the same time, you are afraid to do it, because it might hurt or whatever. But you do it anyway.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: No life is a waste,"the Blue Man said. "The only time we waste is the time we spend thinking we're alone.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: Be melting snow.Wash yourself of yourself.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: If you hang out with chickens, you're going to cluck and if you hang out with eagles, you're going to fly.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: We all need to be mocked from time to time, lest we take ourselves too seriously.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Fight Club
Quote: You buy furniture. You tell yourself, this is the last sofa I will ever need in my life. Buy the sofa, then for a couple years you're satisfied that no matter what goes wrong, at least you've got your sofa issue handled. Then the right set of dishes. Then the perfect bed. The drapes. The rug. Then you're trapped in your lovely nest, and the things you used to own, now they own you.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: We are like sculptors, constantly carving out of others the image we long for, need, love or desire, often against reality, against their benefit, and always, in the end, a disappointment, because it does not fit them.

Author: Anais Nin
Quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Forget yesterday - it has already forgotten you. Don't sweat tomorrow - you haven't even met. Instead, open your eyes and your heart to a truly precious gift - today.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  A Thousand Splendid Suns
Quote: Behind every trial and sorrow that He makes us shoulder, God has a reason.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is brave five minutes longer.

Author: Mary Oliver,  Wild Geese
Quote: You must not ever stop being whimsical. And you must not, ever, give anyone else the responsibility for your life.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Shallow men believe in luck or in circumstance. Strong men believe in cause and effect.

Author: John Wesley
Quote: Do all the good you can. By all the means you can. In all the ways you can. In all the places you can. At all the times you can. To all the people you can. As long as ever you can.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: I trust that everything happens for a reason, even if we are not wise enough to see it.

Author: Marcus Aurelius
Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Evangeline: A Tale of Acadie
Quote: Silently, one by one, in the infinite meadows of heaven,Blossomed the lovely stars, the forget-me-nots of the angels.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,  This Side of Paradise
Quote: It was always the becoming he dreamed of, never the being.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Last Battle
Quote: I have come home at last! This is my real country! I belong here. This is the land I have been looking for all my life, though I never knew it till now...Come further up, come further in!

Author: Dee Lestari,  Filosofi Kopi: Kumpulan Cerita dan Prosa Satu Dekade
Quote: Seindah apa pun huruf terukir, dapatkah ia bermakna apabila tak ada jeda? Dapatkan ia dimengerti jika tak ada spasi? Bukankah kita baru bisa bergerak jika ada jarak? Dan saling menyayang bila ada ruang?

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.

Author: Andy Rooney
Quote: Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.

Author: Hosea Ballou
Quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: All I can be is me- whoever that is.

Author: Frank Warren
Quote: It's the children the world almost breaks who grow up to save it.

Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
Quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!

Author: Sophie Kinsella,  Shopaholic & Baby
Quote: In the end, you have to choose whether or not to trust someone.

Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
Quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Only those who attempt the absurd can achieve the impossible.

Author: Ally Carter
Quote: Not knowing you can't do something, is sometimes all it takes to do it.

Author: Elizabeth Scott,  Perfect You
Quote: Things end. People leave. And you know what? Life goes on. Besides, if bad things didn't happen, how would you be able to feel the good ones?

Author: Joseph Conrad,  Lord Jim
Quote: My task, which I am trying to achieve is, by the power of the written word, to make you hear, to make you feel--it is, before all, to make you see.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I think that the best thing we can do for our children is to allow them to do things for themselves, allow them to be strong, allow them to experience life on their own terms, allow them to take the subway... let them be better people, let them believe more in themselves.

Author: Ben Okri
Quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

Author: Homer,  The Odyssey
Quote: Of all creatures that breathe and move upon the earth, nothing is bred that is weaker than man.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.

Author: Emmet Fox
Quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.

Author: توفيق الحكيم,  عصفور من الشرق
Quote: الخيال.. هو ليل الحياة الجميلهو حصننا وملاذنا من قسوة النهار الطويل!إن عالم “الواقع” لا يكفى وحده لحياة البشر إنه أضيق من أن يتسع لحياة إنسانية كاملة

Author: e. e. cummings
Quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.

Author: Bill Wilson
Quote: To the world you may be one person but to one person you may be the world.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  The Kite Runner
Quote: People say that eyes are windows to the soul.

Author: Gayle Forman,  Where She Went
Quote: But still, I find the need to remind myself of the temporariness of a day, to reassure myself that I got through yesterday, I'll get through today.

Author: Alice Sebold
Quote: You save yourself or you remain unsaved.

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: I do not care so much what I am to others as I care what I am to myself.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: Write it. Shoot it. Publish it. Crochet it, sauté it, whatever. MAKE.

Author: Tupac Shakur
Quote: I'm not saying I'm gonna change the world, but I guarantee that I will spark the brain that will change the world.

Author: Max Lucado,  Cure for the Common Life: Living in Your Sweet Spot
Quote: You are the only you God made... God made you and broke the mold.

Author: George Eliot
Quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: What does it mean to be the best? It means you have to be better than the number two guy. But what gratification is there in that? He's a loser—that’s why he's number two.

Author: جلال الدين الرومي
Quote: ما تبحث عنه يبحث عنك

Author: Og Mandino
Quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.

Author: Ally Condie,  Crossed
Quote: In the end you can't always choose what to keep. You can only choose how you let it go.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: The dog is a gentleman; I hope to go to his heaven not man's.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Start a huge, foolish project, like Noah…it makes absolutely no difference what people think of you.

Author: Margaret Mitchell,  Gone with the Wind
Quote: I'll think of it tomorrow, at Tara. I can stand it then. Tomorrow, I'll think of some way to get him back. After all, tomorrow is another day.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: As my sufferings mounted I soon realized that there were two ways in which I could respond to my situation -- either to react with bitterness or seek to transform the suffering into a creative force. I decided to follow the latter course.

Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild
Quote: I read somewhere... how important it is in life not necessarily to be strong, but to feel strong... to measure yourself at least once.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.

Author: Walter Scott,  Marmion
Quote: Oh, what a tangled web we weave...when first we practice to deceive.

Author: Woody Allen
Quote: If you're not failing every now and again, it's a sign you're not doing anything very innovative.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: When we give cheerfully and accept gratefully, everyone is blessed.

Author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
Quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.

Author: Aesop
Quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: Weekends don't count unless you spend them doing something completely pointless.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

Author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture
Quote: No matter how bad things are, you can always make things worse.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: You will never be able to escape from your heart. So it's better to listen to what it has to say.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.

Author: Bill Copeland
Quote: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Art is the proper task of life.

Author: Roald Dahl
Quote: If you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: When you go through a hard period,When everything seems to oppose you,... When you feel you cannot even bear one more minute,NEVER GIVE UP!Because it is the time and place that the course will divert!

Author: Carol Burnett
Quote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.

Author: Tony Robbins
Quote: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.

Author: Thomas A. Edison
Quote: Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: He is free to evade reality, he is free to unfocus his mind and stumble blindly down any road he pleases, but not free to avoid the abyss he refuses to see.

Author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah
Quote: You're never given a dream without also being given the power to make it true.

Author: Jack London
Quote: Don't loaf and invite inspiration; light out after it with a club.

Author: Lily Tomlin
Quote: When I was growing up I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.

Author: Lenny Bruce
Quote: There are never enough 'I love you's.

Author: Rosa Parks
Quote: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Duino Elegies
Quote: For beauty is nothing but the beginning of terrorwhich we are barely able to endure, and it amazes us so,because it serenely disdains to destroy us.Every angel is terrible.

Author: Bob Marley,  Bob Marley - Legend
Quote: Get up, stand up, Stand up for your rights. Get up, stand up, Don't give up the fight.

Author: Arthur O'Shaughnessy,  Poems of Arthur O'Shaughnessy
Quote: We are the music-makers,And we are the dreamers of dreams,Wandering by lone sea-breakers,And sitting by desolate streams.World-losers and world-forsakers,Upon whom the pale moon gleams;Yet we are the movers and shakers,Of the world forever, it seems.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.

Author: William Shakespeare,  The Merchant of Venice
Quote: How far that little candle throws his beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.

Author: Erin Hanson
Quote: There is freedom waiting for you,On the breezes of the sky,And you ask "What if I fall?"Oh but my darling,What if you fly?

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings
Quote: Life before Death.Strength before Weakness.Journey before Destination.

Author: Chris Colfer
Quote: There's nothing wrong with you. There's a lot wrong with the world you live in. And definitely get out of high school and make everyone sorry.

Author: Veronica Roth,  Divergent
Quote: We've all started to put down the virtues of the other factions in the process of bolstering our own. I don't want to do that. I want to be brave, and selfless, and smart, and kind, and honest."He clears his throat. "I continually struggle with kindness.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You stopped allowing other people to dilute or poison your day with their words or opinions? Let today be the day…You stand strong in the truth of your beauty and journey through your day without attachment to the validation of others

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it.

Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
Quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.

Author: Tricia Cunningham
Quote: The individual who says it is not possible should move out of the way of those doing it.

Author: Vince Lombardi
Quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.

Author: Mark A. Cooper,  Edelweiss Pirates ‘Operation Einstein'
Quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!

Author: Rumi
Quote: That which God said to the rose, and caused it to laugh in full-blown beauty, He said to my heart, and made it a hundred times more beautiful.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The strength of a woman is not measured by the impact that all her hardships in life have had on her; but the strength of a woman is measured by the extent of her refusal to allow those hardships to dictate her and who she becomes.

Author: Susan Polis Schutz
Quote: This life is yours. Take the power to choose what you want to do and do it well. Take the power to love what you want in life and love it honestly. Take the power to walk in the forest and be a part of nature. Take the power to control your own life. No one else can do it for you. Take the power to make your life happy.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: You’re not obligated to win. You’re obligated to keep trying. To the best you can do everyday.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: I just hope I remember to tell my kids that they are as happy as I look in my old photographs. And I hope that they believe me.

Author: Gloria Steinem
Quote: Without leaps of imagination or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all is a form of planning.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: A Woman in harmony with her spirit is like a river flowing.She goes where she will without pretense and arrives at her destination prepared to be herself and only herself

Author: Thomas Szasz
Quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.

Author: Brian Selznick,  The Invention of Hugo Cabret
Quote: I like to imagine that the world is one big machine. You know, machines never have any extra parts. They have the exact number and type of parts they need. So I figure if the entire world is a big machine, I have to be here for some reason. And that means you have to be here for some reason, too.

Author: Ovid
Quote: Dripping water hollows out stone, not through force but through persistence.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Even if things don't unfold the way you expected, don't be disheartened or give up. One who continues to advance will win in the end.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Well done is better than well said.

Author: Paul Bryant
Quote: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.

Author: William Wilberforce
Quote: You may choose to look the other way but you can never say again that you did not know.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: You must find the place inside yourself where nothing is impossible.

Author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture
Quote: It's not about how to achieve your dreams, it's about how to lead your life, ... If you lead your life the right way, the karma will take care of itself, the dreams will come to you.

Author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values
Quote: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands, and then work outward from there.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: Things do not change; we change.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: If you start by promising what you don't even have yet, you'll lose your desire to work towards getting it.

Author: Buddha
Quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  The Graveyard Book
Quote: You're alive, Bod. That means you have infinite potential. You can do anything, make anything, dream anything. If you can change the world, the world will change. Potential. Once you're dead, it's gone. Over. You've made what you've made, dreamed your dream, written your name. You may be buried here, you may even walk. But that potential is finished.

Author: Confucius
Quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When you hold a grudge, you want someone else’s sorrow to reflect your level of hurt but the two rarely meet.

Author: Kathryn Stockett,  The Help
Quote: Wasn't that the point of the book? For women to realize, We are just two people. Not that much separates us. Not nearly as much as I'd thought.

Author: Jeanne d'Arc
Quote: One life is all we have and we live it as we believe in living it. But to sacrifice what you are and to live without belief, that is a fate more terrible than dying.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.

Author: Christine Feehan,  Night Game
Quote: Life gives us choices. You either grab on with both hands and just go for it, or you sit on the sidelines.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I want to live my life in such a way that when I get out of bed in the morning, the devil says, "aw shit, he's up!

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper
Quote: See, as much as you want to hold on to the bitter sore memory that someone has left this world, you are still in it

Author: Confucius
Quote: When you see a good person, think of becoming like her/him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: If we ever forget that we're one nation under God, then we will be one nation gone under.

Author: Sabaa Tahir,  An Ember in the Ashes
Quote: Life is made of so many moments that mean nothing. Then one day, a single moment comes along to define every second that comes after. Such moments are tests of courage, of strength.

Author: Henry James
Quote: It's time to start living the life you've imagined.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Amor Fati – “Love Your Fate”, which is in fact your life.

Author: Wilma Rudolph
Quote: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Don't confuse poor decision-making with destiny. Own your mistakes. It’s ok; we all make them. Learn from them so they can empower you!

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: Being happy doesn't mean that everything is perfect. It means that you've decided to look beyond the imperfections.

Author: Jennifer Niven,  All the Bright Places
Quote: The problem with people is they forget that most of the time it's the small things that count.

Author: Sophie Kinsella
Quote: Darling, when things go wrong in life, you lift your chin, put on a ravishing smile, mix yourself a little cocktail...

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: the time is always right to do the right thing

Author: Jim Rohn
Quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.

Author: Mitch Albom,  The Five People You Meet in Heaven - Meniti Bianglala
Quote: Heaven can be found in the most unlikely corners.

Author: Louis C.K.
Quote: I’m bored’ is a useless thing to say. I mean, you live in a great, big, vast world that you’ve seen none percent of. Even the inside of your own mind is endless; it goes on forever, inwardly, do you understand? The fact that you’re alive is amazing, so you don’t get to say ‘I’m bored.

Author: Ayn Rand,  Anthem
Quote: My happiness is not the means to any end. It is the end. It is its own goal. It is its own purpose.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
Quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.

Author: Jack Kerouac,  The Dharma Bums
Quote: Down on the lake rosy reflections of celestial vapor appeared, and I said, "God, I love you"and looked to the sky and really meant it. "I have fallen in love with you, God. Take care of us all, one way or the other."To the children and the innocent it's all the same.

Author: Libba Bray
Quote: I know because I read...Your mind is not a cage. It's a garden. And it requires cultivating.

Author: Nicholas Sparks
Quote: It is the possibility that keeps me going, and though you may call me a dreamer or a fool or any other thing, I believe that anything is possible.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss
Quote: The truth is that the world is full of dragons, and none of us are as powerful or cool as we’d like to be. And that sucks. But when you’re confronted with that fact, you can either crawl into a hole and quit, or you can get out there, take off your shoes, and Bilbo it up.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: When you look for a man- what you want to look for is a man with the heart of a poor boy and the mind of a conqueror.

Author: Andrea Hirata,  Sang Pemimpi
Quote: Bermimpilah, karena Tuhan akan memeluk mimpi-mimpi itu.

Author: Kevyn Aucoin
Quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.

Author: Thomas A. Edison
Quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worthwhile are, first, hard work; second, stick-to-itiveness; third, common sense.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: I've been lucky. Opportunities don't often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.

Author: Samuel Beckett,  Waiting for Godot
Quote: The tears of the world are a constant quantity. For each one who begins to weep somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh.

Author: Mary Kay Ash
Quote: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Dalai Lama: A Policy of Kindness: An Anthology of Writings By and About the Dalai Lama
Quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.

Author: Harriet Tubman
Quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: The Reality of The Other Person Lies Not In What He Reveals To You, But What He Cannot Reveal To You.Therefore, If You Would Understand Him, Listen Not To What He Says, But Rather To What He Does Not Say.

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Jane Eyre
Quote: There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Friendship with oneself is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.

Author: Malala Yousafzai
Quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: Think, Believe, Dream, and Dare.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: We are saved by faith alone, but the faith that saves is never alone.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  The Power of Myth
Quote: People say that what we’re all seeking is a meaning for life. I don’t think that’s what we’re really seeking. I think that what we’re seeking is an experience of being alive, so that our life experiences on the purely physical plane will have resonances with our own innermost being and reality, so that we actually feel the rapture of being alive.

Author: Francis of Assisi
Quote: Start by doing what is necessary, then what is possible, and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

Author: Margaret Weis,  Dragons of a Lost Star
Quote: Words can never fully say what we want them to say, for they fumble, stammer, and break the best porcelain. The best one can hope for is to find along the way someone to share the path, content to walk in silence, for the heart communes best when it does not try to speak.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: Life's great happiness is to be convinced we are loved.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: I postpone death by living, by suffering, by error, by risking, by giving, by losing.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood.

Author: Anne Lamott
Quote: Your problem is how you are going to spend this one and precious life you have been issued. Whether you're going to spend it trying to look good and creating the illusion that you have power over circumstances, or whether you are going to taste it, enjoy it and find out the truth about who you are.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: No, this is not the beginning of a new chapter in my life; this is the beginning of a new book! That first book is already closed, ended, and tossed into the seas; this new book is newly opened, has just begun! Look, it is the first page! And it is a beautiful one!

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  A Wrinkle in Time
Quote: Life, with its rules, its obligations, and its freedoms, is like a sonnet: You're given the form, but you have to write the sonnet yourself. - Mrs. Whatsit

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Let today be the day you stop being haunted by the ghost of yesterday. Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Dare to love yourselfas if you were a rainbowwith gold at both ends.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: I offer you peace. I offer you love. I offer you friendship. I see your beauty. I hear your need. I feel your feelings.

Author: Oliver James
Quote: Do your own thing on your own terms and get what you came here for

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: I’ve come to the conclusion that people who wear headphones while they walk, are much happier, more confident, and more beautiful individuals than someone making the solitary drudge to work without acknowledging their own interests and power.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: Adapt what is useful, reject what is useless, and add what is specifically your own.

Author: Woody Guthrie
Quote: Take it easy, but take it.

Author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah
Quote: I do not believe in taking the right decision, I take a decision and make it right.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.

Author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You'll Go!
Quote: Congratulations!Today is your day.You're off to Great Places!You're off and away!

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.

Author: Bob Ong
Quote: Hikayatin mo lahat ng kakilala mo na magkaroon ng kahit isa man lang paboritong libro sa buhay nila. Dahil wala nang mas kawawa pa sa mga taong literado pero hindi nagbabasa.

Author: R.J. Palacio,  Wonder
Quote: The things we do outlast our mortality. The things we do are like monuments that people build to honor heroes after they've died. They're like the pyramids that the Egyptians built to honor the pharaohs. Only instead of being made of stone, they're made out of the memories people have of you.

Author: Jonathan Antin
