Quote: Berhenti bercita-cita adalah tragedi terbesar dalam hidup manusia

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Quote: If you live in a past dream, you don't enjoy what is happening right now because you will always wish it to be different than it is. There is no time to miss anyone or anything because you are alive. Not enjoying what is happening right now is living in the past and being only half alive. This leads to self pity, suffering and tears.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: What's most important in a friendship? Tolerance and loyalty.

Author: Pearl S. Buck
Quote: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration.

Author: Don Roff
Quote: Nothing's a better cure for writer's block than to eat ice cream right out of the carton.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.

Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now
Quote: Living well is an art that can be developed: a love of life and ability to take great pleasure from small offerings and assurance that the world owes you nothing and that every gift is exactly that, a gift.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased.

Author: Jim Henson
Quote: Watch out for each other. Love everyone and forgive everyone, including yourself. Forgive your anger. Forgive your guilt. Your shame. Your sadness. Embrace and open up your love, your joy, your truth, and most especially your heart.

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Penultimate Peril
Quote: Deciding whether or not to trust a person is like deciding whether or not to climb a tree because you might get a wonderful view from the highest branch or you might simply get covered in sap and for this reason many people choose to spend their time alone and indoors where it is harder to get a splinter.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Love is forgiving, accepting, moving on, embracing, and all encompassing. And if you’re not doing that for yourself, you cannot do that with anyone else.

Author: Maya Angelou,  Wouldn't Take Nothing for My Journey Now
Quote: Whining is not only graceless, but can be dangerous. It can alert a brute that a victim is in the neighborhood.

Author: Alan Moore,  V for Vendetta
Quote: The past can't hurt you anymore. Not unless you let it. They made you into a victim, Evey. They made you into a statistic. But, that's not the real you. That's not who you are inside.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: Looking at beauty in the world, is the first step of purifying the mind.

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary.

Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: If the only prayer you say throughout your life is "Thank You,"then that will be enough.

Author: Og Mandino
Quote: Remind thyself, in the darkest moments, that every failure is only a step toward success, every detection of what is false directs you toward what is true, every trial exhausts some tempting form of error, and every adversity will only hide, for a time, your path to peace and fulfillment.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
Quote: Besides, the world isn't split into good people and Death Eaters. We've all got both light and dark inside us. What matters is the part we choose to act on. That's who we really are.

Author: Sigmund Freud,  The Future of an Illusion
Quote: No, our science is no illusion. But an illusion it would be to suppose that what science cannot give us we can get elsewhere.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: Seize the moments of happiness, love and be loved! That is the only reality in the world, all else is folly. It is the one thing we are interested in here.

Author: Johann Sebastian Bach
Quote: Music is an agreeable harmony for the honor of God and the permissible delights of the soul.

Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women
Quote: Have regular hours for work and play; make each day both useful and pleasant, and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will bring few regrets, and life will become a beautiful success.

Author: Rumi,  Words of Paradise: Selected Poems of Rumi
Quote: Give up to grace. The ocean takes care of each wave 'til it gets to shore. You need more help than you know.

Author: John Waters,  Crackpot: The Obsessions of John Waters
Quote: I've had it with being nice, understanding, fair and hopeful. I feel like being negative all day. The chip on my shoulder could sink the QE2. I've got an attitude problem and nobody better get in my way...I'm in a bad mood and the whole stupid little world is gonna pay!

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.

Author: Cecelia Ahern,  P.S. I Love You
Quote: She had been given a wonderful gift: life. Sometimes it was cruelly taken away too soon, but it's what you did with it that counted, not how long it lasted.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: At first, they'll only dislike what you say, but the more correct you start sounding the more they'll dislike you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: When forever becomes a place...when forever ceases to be just a word… when it ceases to be just a measurement of time…but instead becomes a place where soul mates can dance to the song in their hearts... that is a reflection of true love.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world

Author: Robert Browning,  Men and Women and Other Poems
Quote: Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp,Or what's a heaven for?

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and all time.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: The beauty of the world...has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.

Author: John Keats
Quote: A thing of beauty is a joy for ever: Its loveliness increases; it will never Pass into nothingness; but still will keep A bower quiet for us, and a sleep Full of sweet dreams, and health, and quiet breathing.

Author: Chad Sugg
Quote: Love the trees until their leaves fall off, then encourage them to try again next year.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph
Quote: Travel is never a matter of money but of courage

Author: Aristotle
Quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

Author: Dorothy Parker,  You Might as Well Live: The Life and Times of Dorothy Parker
Quote: It serves me right for putting all my eggs in one bastard.

Author: Sam Harris,  The End of Faith: Religion, Terror, and the Future of Reason
Quote: Consider it: every person you have ever met, every person will suffer the loss of his friends and family. All are going to lose everything they love in this world. Why would one want to be anything but kind to them in the meantime?

Author: Jodi Picoult,  The Pact
Quote: You know, the mind is a remarkable thing. Just because you can't see the wound doesn't mean it isn't hurting. It scars all the time, but it heals.

Author: Fernando Pessoa
Quote: The value of things is not the time they last, but the intensity with which they occur. That is why there are unforgettable moments and unique people!

Author: Gustave Flaubert
Quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  Fahrenheit 451
Quote: It doesn't matter what you do...so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away.

Author: Anne Bradstreet,  The Works of Anne Bradstreet
Quote: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant: if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome."[Meditations Divine and Moral]

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: By hook or by crook, I hope that you will possess yourselves of money enough to travel and to idle, to contemplate the future or the past of the world, to dream over books and loiter at street corners and let the line of thought dip deep into the stream

Author: Libba Bray
Quote: To those who will see, the world waits.

Author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
Quote: When your will is God's will, you will have your will.

Author: Konstantin Stanislavski,  My Life In Art
Quote: Love art in yourself, and not yourself in art.

Author: Jean Paul
Quote: Joy descends gently upon us like the evening dew, and does not patter down like a hailstorm.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: If you want to catch beasts you don't see every day,You have to go places quite out of the way,You have to go places no others can get to.You have to get cold and you have too get wet, too.

Author: Thomas S. Monson
Quote: Never let a problem to be solved, become more important than a person to be loved.

Author: Albert Camus
Quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: It's not worth our while to let our imperfections disturb us always.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Quote: I am what I am, an’ I’m not ashamed. 'Never be ashamed,’ my ol’ dad used ter say, ‘there’s some who’ll hold it against you, but they’re not worth botherin’ with.

Author: Plutarch
Quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.

Author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam
Quote: Dream, Dream DreamDreams transform into thoughts And thoughts result in action.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Just an observation: it is impossible to be both grateful and depressed. Those with a grateful mindset tend to see the message in the mess. And even though life may knock them down, the grateful find reasons, if even small ones, to get up.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Be a lamp, or a lifeboat, or a ladder. Help someone's soul heal. Walk out of your house like a shepherd.

Author: Frederick Buechner,  Now and Then: A Memoir of Vocation
Quote: Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery it is. In the boredom and pain of it, no less than in the excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to the holy and hidden heart of it, because in the last analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is grace.

Author: Neale Donald Walsch
Quote: The deepest secret is that life is not a process of discovery, but a process of creation. You are not discovering yourself, but creating yourself anew. Seek therefore, not to find out Who You Are, but seek to determine Who You Want to Be.

Author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés,  Women Who Run With the Wolves: Myths and Stories of the Wild Woman Archetype
Quote: It is worse to stay where one does not belong at all than to wander about lost for a while and looking for the psychic and soulful kinship one requires

Author: Nina LaCour,  Hold Still
Quote: It was the moment I realized what music can do to people, how it can make you hurt and feel so good all at once.

Author: Iain Thomas,  I Wrote This For You
Quote: Be soft. Do not let the world make you hard. Do not let the pain make you hate. Do not let the bitterness steal your sweetness. Take pride that even though the rest of the world may disagree, you still believe it to be a beautiful place

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Quote: Call him Voldemort, Harry. Always use the proper name for things. Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: I’ve gotta get out of the basement. I’ve gotta see the world. I’ve gotta make a difference

Author: Virginia Euwer Wolff
Quote: Rise to the occassion which is life!

Author: Mae West
Quote: I never loved another person the way I loved myself.

Author: محمد حسن علوان,  سقف الكفاية
Quote: لا تحزن الا عن شيئين: فوات هدفك, أو اثناؤك عنه

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Life is painful. It has thorns, like the stem of a rose. Culture and art are the roses that bloom on the stem. The flower is yourself, your humanity. Art is the liberation of the humanity inside yourself.

Author: Carlos Castaneda
Quote: A path is only a path, and there is no affront, to oneself or to others, in dropping it if that is what your heart tells you . . . Look at every path closely and deliberately. Try it as many times as you think necessary. Then ask yourself alone, one question . . . Does this path have a heart? If it does, the path is good; if it doesn't it is of no use.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
Quote: that as long as we are being remembered, we remain alive.

Author: John Lubbock,  The Beauties of Nature and the Wonders of the World We Live in
Quote: What we do see depends mainly on what we look for. ... In the same field the farmer will notice the crop, the geologists the fossils, botanists the flowers, artists the colouring, sportmen the cover for the game. Though we may all look at the same things, it does not all follow that we should see them.

Author: John C. Maxwell
Quote: The greatest day in your life and mine is when we take total responsibility for our attitudes. That's the day we truly grow up.

Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Quote: The only journey is the one within.

Author: Brian Andreas
Quote: Everything changed the day she figured out there was exactly enough time for the important things in her life.

Author: Ann Brashares,  Girls In Pants: The Third Summer of the Sisterhood
Quote: Try, reach, want, and you may fall. But even if you do, you might be okay anyway. If you don't try, you save nothing, because you might as well be dead.

Author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh,  Gift from the Sea
Quote: I do not believe that sheer suffering teaches. If suffering alone taught, all the world would be wise, since everyone suffers. To suffering must be added mourning, understanding, patience, love, openness, and the willingness to remain vulnerable.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Passion is a feeling that tells you: this is the right thing to do. Nothing can stand in my way. It doesn't matter what anyone else says. This feeling is so good that it cannot be ignored. I'm going to follow my bliss and act upon this glorious sensation of joy.

Author: Ian Wallace
Quote: Why are you trying so hard to fit in when you were born to stand out?

Author: Eric Berne
Quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: I stay cool, and dig all jive,That's the way I stay alive.My motto, as I live and learn, isDig and be dugIn return.

Author: Leo Rosten
Quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy—but to matter, to be productive, to be useful, to have it make some difference that you lived at all.

Author: Edmund Burke
Quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: What difference do it make if the thing you scared of is real or not?

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: I believe the simplest explanation is, there is no God. No one created the universe and no one directs our fate. This leads me to a profound realization that there probably is no heaven and no afterlife either. We have this one life to appreciate the grand design of the universe and for that, I am extremely grateful.

Author: RuPaul
Quote: If you don't love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?

Author: Isabel Allende,  The Sum of Our Days: A Memoir
Quote: Fear is inevitable, I have to accept that, but I cannot allow it to paralyze me.

Author: Abraham Joshua Heschel
Quote: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.

Author: J.M. Darhower,  Sempre
Quote: Go for it, while you can. I know you have it in you. And I can't promise you'll get everything you want, but I can promise nothing will change if you don't try.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Free yourself from the complexities and drama of your life. Simplify. Look within. Within ourselves we all have the gifts and talents we need to fulfill the purpose we've been blessed with.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: No DifferenceSmall as a peanut,Big as a giant,We're all the same sizeWhen we turn off the light.Rich as a sultan,Poor as a mite,We're all worth the sameWhen we turn off the light.Red, black or orange,Yellow or white, We all look the sameWhen we turn off the light.So maybe the way, To make everything rightIs for god to just reach outAnd turn off the light!

Author: Mary Anne Radmacher
Quote: Courage does not always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day saying, 'I will try again tomorrow.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding
Quote: True beauty is not related to what color your hair is or what color your eyes are. True beauty is about who you are as a human being, your principles, your moral compass.

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: The adventure of life is to learn. The purpose of life is to grow. The nature of life is to change. The challenge of life is to overcome. The essence of life is to care. The opportunity of like is to serve. The secret of life is to dare. The spice of life is to befriend. The beauty of life is to give.

Author: Marianne Williamson,  A Return to Love: Reflections on the Principles of "A Course in Miracles"
Quote: We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, handsome, talented and fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: When they say the sky's the limit to me that's really true

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: A winner is a dreamer who never gives up

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Veronika Decides to Die
Quote: I want to continue being crazy; living my life the way I dream it, and not the way the other people want it to be.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.

Author: Helen Exley
Quote: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled "This could change your life.

Author: Shannon Hale,  Princess Academy
Quote: I keep thinking about a tale my nurse used to read to me about a bird whose wings are pinned to the ground. In the end, when he finally frees himself, he flies so high he becomes a star. My nurse said the story was about how we all have something that keeps us down.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: There is great change to be experienced once you learn the power of letting go. Stop allowing anyone or anything to control, limit, repress, or discourage you from being your true self! Today is YOURS to shape - own it - break free from people and things that poison or dilute your spirit.

Author: Sheryl Sandberg,  Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead
Quote: Done is better than perfect.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  Three Weeks With My Brother
Quote: When you chase a dream, you learn about yourself. You learn your capabilities and limitations, and the value of hard work and persistence.

Author: Selena Gómez
Quote: Everything happens for a reason and, something better will come along for me!

Author: Paula White
Quote: Champions have the courage to keep turning the pages because they know a better chapter lies ahead.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I consider myself a stained-glass window. And this is how I live my life. Closing no doors and covering no windows; I am the multi-colored glass with light filtering through me, in many different shades. Allowing light to shed and fall into many many hues. My job is not to direct anything, but only to filter into many colors. My answer is destiny and my guide is joy. And there you have me.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: Come friends, it's not too late to seek a newer world.

Author: Ann Brashares,  Girls In Pants: The Third Summer of the Sisterhood
Quote: You couldn't erase the past. You couldn't even change it. But sometimes life offered you the opportunity to put it right.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Never do a single thing in the anticipation to prove something to someone who has hurt you. If someone has hurt or offended you (whoever that person may be), never perform anything or strive for anything in your life with the mind of proving something to that someone/ to those people. May nothing that you do be done with any thought of them in mind. There is nothing that needs to be proven.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: It is only with true love and compassion that we can begin to mend what is broken in the world. It is these two blessed things that can begin to heal all broken hearts.

Author: James Gordon
Quote: It's not that some people have willpower and some don't... It's that some people are ready to change and others are not.

Author: Dr. Seuss
Quote: Everything stinks till it’s finished.

Author: Wallace Stevens
Quote: The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.

Author: عائض القرني
Quote: إذا رأيت الصحراء تمتد وتمتد فاعلم أن وراءها رياضاً خضراء وارفة الظلال

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: Anxiety is the handmaiden of creativity

Author: Neal A. Maxwell,  The Neal A. Maxwell Quote Book
Quote: The laughter of the world is merely loneliness pathetically trying to reassure itself.

Author: Michel Houellebecq
Quote: The absence of the will to live is, alas, not sufficient to make one want to die.

Author: Thomas Bernhard,  Correction
Quote: Instead of committing suicide, people go to work.

Author: Hilary Duff
Quote: Waiting for you is like waiting for rain in this drought. Useless and disappointing."~ Sam (Hilary Duff), A Cinderella Story

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Destiny is real. And she's not mild-mannered. She will come around and hit you in the face and knock you over and before you know what hit you, you're naked- stripped of everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you didn't know- and there you are! A bloody nose, bruises all over you, and naked. And it's the most beautiful thing.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: A beautiful thing happens when we start paying attention to each other. It is by participating more in your relationship that you breathe life into it.

Author: Wally Lamb,  I Know This Much Is True
Quote: I am not a smart man, particularly, but one day, at long last, I stumbled from the dark woods of my own, and my family's, and my country's past, holding in my hands these truths: that love grows from the rich loam of forgiveness; that mongrels make good dogs; that the evidence of God exists in the roundness of things. This much, at least, I've figured out. I know this much is true.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Veronika Decides to Die
Quote: Collective madness is called sanity ..

Author: Philip Pullman
Quote: There's a hunger for stories in all of us, adults too. We need stories so much that we're even willing to read bad books to get them, if the good books won't supply them.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Everything is determined, the beginning as well as the end, by forces over which we have no control. It is determined for the insect, as well as for the star. Human beings, vegetables, or cosmic dust, we all dance to a mysterious tune, intoned in the distance by an invisible piper.

Author: Maya Angelou,  I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
Quote: The caged bird sings with a fearful trill,of things unknown, but longed for still, and his tune is heard on the distant hill, for the caged bird sings of freedom.

Author: Francis of Assisi
Quote: The deeds you do may be the only sermon some persons will hear today

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: In a strong relationship, you should love your companion more than you need them.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: Head up, heart open. To better days!

Author: James Allen
Quote: A man has to learn that he cannot command things, but that he can command himself; that he cannot coerce the wills of others, but that he can mold and master his own will: and things serve him who serves Truth; people seek guidance of him who is master of himself.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt,  You Learn by Living: Eleven Keys for a More Fulfilling Life
Quote: It's your life-but only if you make it so.

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.

Author: Gautama Buddha,  The Dhammapada
Quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.[Verse 223]

Author: Ansel Adams
Quote: Sometimes I arrive just when God's ready to have somone click the shutter.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.

Author: Caroline Kennedy
Quote: Sometimes it takes a while to recognize that someone has a special ability to get us to believe in ourselves, to tie that belief to our highest ideals, and to imagine that together we can do great things.In those rare moments, when such a person comes along, we need to put aside our plans and reach for what we know is possible.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Delirium
Quote: Find the things that matter, and hold on to them, and fight for them, and refuse to let them go.

Author: Charles Dickens,  A Tale of Two Cities
Quote: Before I go,"he said, and paused -- "I may kiss her?"It was remembered afterwards that when he bent down and touched her face with his lips, he murmured some words. The child, who was nearest to him, told them afterwards, and told her grandchildren when she was a handsome old lady, that she heard him say, "A life you love.

Author: David Eddings
Quote: God save us from religion.

Author: Viktor E. Frankl,  Man's Search for Meaning
Quote: Happiness cannot be pursued; it must ensue.

Author: Jandy Nelson,  The Sky Is Everywhere
Quote: That's a misconception, Lennie. The sky is everywhere, it begins at your feet.

Author: Tennessee Williams,  Camino Real
Quote: Make voyages. Attempt them. There's nothing else.

Author: Fred Rogers,  The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember
Quote: Mutual caring relationships require kindness and patience, tolerance, optimism, joy in the other's achievements, confidence in oneself, and the ability to give without undue thought of gain.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am an extremely sincere individual. I am sincere, to a fault. One of the many things that I have come to realize, to learn, is that sincerity must be reserved and given only to those who deserve it. And one must save one's emotions, channeling them only to the people who are worthy of it. One must not throw one's pearls to the pigs.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: Arrange whatever pieces come your way.

Author: Randy Pausch
Quote: Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress. When you're pissed off at someone and you're angry at them, you just haven't given them enough time. Just give them a little more time and they almost always will impress you.

Author: Lynette Mather
Quote: What if the kid you bullied at school, grew up, and turned out to be the only surgeon who could save your life?

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: If you want to build a ship, don’t drum up the men to gather wood, divide the work, and give orders. Instead, teach them to yearn for the vast and endless sea.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity, & stumble from defeat to defeat.

Author: Jack Kornfield
Quote: In the end, just three things matter:How well we have livedHow well we have lovedHow well we have learned to let go

Author: Zora Neale Hurston,  Their Eyes Were Watching God
Quote: Some people could look at a mud puddle and see an ocean with ships.

Author: James Redfield,  The Celestine Prophecy
Quote: We must assume every event has significance and contains a message that pertains to our questions...this especially applies to what we used to call bad things...the challenge is to find the silver lining in every event, no matter how negative.

Author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley
Quote: The trick is to enjoy life. Don't wish away your days, waiting for better ones ahead.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: We forfeit three-fourths of ourselves in order to be like other people.

Author: Ann Brashares,  Sisterhood Everlasting
Quote: Maybe you think you’ll be entitled to more happiness later by forgoing all of it now, but it doesn’t work that way. Happiness takes as much practice as unhappiness does. It’s by living that you live more. By waiting you wait more. Every waiting day makes your life a little less. Every lonely day makes you a little smaller. Every day you put off your life makes you less capable of living it.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: Why do I and everyone I love pick people who treat us like we're nothing"; - "We accept the love we think we deserve,

Author: Amy Carmichael
Quote: Give me the Love that leads the wayThe Faith that nothing can dismayThe Hope no disappointments tireThe Passion that'll burn like fireLet me not sink to be a clodMake me Thy fuel, Flame of God

Author: John Newton
Quote: I am not what I ought to be, I am not what I want to be, I am not what I hope to be in another world; but still I am not what I once used to be, and by the grace of God I am what I am

Author: Bernard M. Baruch
Quote: Millions saw the apple fall, Newton was the only one who asked why?

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Elegance is a glowing inner peace. Grace is an ability to give as well as to receive and be thankful. Mystery is a hidden laugh always ready to surface! Glamour only radiates if there is a sublime courage & bravery within: glamour is like the moon; it only shines because the sun is there.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: To invent your own life's meaning is not easy, but it's still allowed, and I think you'll be happier for the trouble.

Author: Isabel Allende,  The House of the Spirits
Quote: You can't find someone who doesn't want to be found.

Author: Ezra Taft Benson
Quote: Men and women who turn their lives over to God will discover that He can make a lot more out of their lives than they can. He can deepen their joys, expand their vision, quicken their minds, strengthen their muscles, lift their spirits, multiply their blessings, increase their opportunities, comfort their soals, and pour out peace.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.

Author: Nick Vujicic
Quote: It's a lie to think you're not good enough. It's a lie to think you're not worth anything.

Author: E.M. Forster,  What I Believe and Other Essays
Quote: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: In this sad world of ours sorrow comes to all and it often comes with bitter agony. Perfect relief is not possible except with time. You cannot now believe that you will ever feel better. But this is not true. You are sure to be happy again. Knowing this, truly believing it will make you less miserable now. I have had enough experience to make this statement.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Be happy with who you are and what you do, and you can do anything you want.

Author: Tennessee Williams,  The Glass Menagerie
Quote: Yes, I have tricks in my pocket, I have things up my sleeve. But I am the opposite of a stage magician. He gives you illusion that has the appearance of truth. I give you truth in the pleasant disguise of illusion.

Author: Stephen King,  Different Seasons
Quote: Am I weird?""Yeah. But so what? Everybody's weird.

Author: Harry Crews
Quote: There is something beautiful about all scars of whatever nature. A scar means the hurt is over, the wound is closed and healed, done with.

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: I'm starting with the man in the mirror,I'm asking him to change his ways;And no message could have been any clearer,If you wanna make the world a better place,Take a look at yourself, and then make a change!

Author: Mary Oliver
Quote: It is better for the heart to break, than not to break.

Author: Junipero Serra
Quote: I pray God may preserve your health and life many years.

Author: Cesare Pavese
Quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.

Author: Tupac Shakur
Quote: Whatever you see you gotta keep a sense of humor; you gotta be able to smile through all the bullshit.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: ‎"What does it mean if i'm afraid? Does it mean something bad is going to happen?""No, it doesn't mean something bad is going to happen. It just means that you have the chance to be brave.

Author: Tere Liye,  Ayahku (Bukan) Pembohong
Quote: Hidup harus terus berlanjut,tidak peduli seberapa menyakitkan atau membahagiakan, biar waktu yg menjadi obat

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not "This is misfortune,"but "To bear this worthily is good fortune.

Author: Henrik Ibsen
Quote: A thousand words leave not the same deep impression as does a single deed.

Author: C. JoyBell C.,  Saint Paul Trois Chateaux: 1948
Quote: Sometimes the things that are felt the most are expressed between two souls over the distance and over time...where no words abide. And others may speak freely, live with one another freely, express themselves freely– just like everyone else, but then there is you... you have no words for proof of reassurance, no tokens of professed love, but you have something. Something worth keeping.

Author: Cecelia Ahern
Quote: There's no limit to what you can dream. You expect the unexpected, you believe in magic, in fairy tales, and in possibilities. Then you grow older and that innocence is shattered and somewhere along the way the reality of life gets in the way and you're hit by the realization that you can't be all you wanted to be, you just might have to settle for a little bit less.

Author: Mark Hopkins
Quote: The essential elements of giving are power and love - activity and affection - and the consciousness of the race testifies that in the high and appropriate exercise of these is a blessedness greater than any other.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Today is a new day. Don't let your history interfere with your destiny! Let today be the day you stop being a victim of your circumstances and start taking action towards the life you want. You have the power and the time to shape your life. Break free from the poisonous victim mentality and embrace the truth of your greatness. You were not meant for a mundane or mediocre life!

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: Finding one important thing in your life doesn’t mean you have togive up all the other important things.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: To love is easy, to be in a relationship is extremely difficult.

Author: Anaïs Nin,  The Diary of Anaïs Nin, Vol. 4: 1944-1947
Quote: When we blindly adopt a religion, a political system, a literary dogma, we become automatons.

Author: Dean Karnazes
Quote: Run when you can, walk if you have to, crawl if you must; just never give up.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince
Quote: No one is ever satisfied where he is.

Author: Dolly Parton
Quote: I'm not going to limit myself just because people won't accept the fact that I can do something else.

Author: Thomas à Kempis,  The Imitation of Christ
Quote: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.

Author: Suzanne Collins,  Catching Fire
Quote: You could do a lot worse.

Author: Anne Tyler,  The Accidental Tourist
Quote: I'm beginning to think that maybe it's not just how much you love someone. Maybe what matters is who you are when you're with them.

Author: Bob Marley,  Bob Marley Talking
Quote: until the end of the world,all whys will be answered,but now,you can only ask!

Author: Plato
Quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.

Author: John Wooden
Quote: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have the time to do it over?

Author: A.G. Howard,  Splintered
Quote: Tearing down the rest of the world won't make you happy. Look inside yourself. Because finding who you were meant to be? What you were put into this world to do? That's what fills the emptiness. It's the only things that can.

Author: Michael Jordan
Quote: You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.

Author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross,  On Life After Death
Quote: The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  Dream Chaser
Quote: My father used to say that life is what you make it. Today is the first day of the rest of your life. You can’t change the past, but the future isn’t set in stone. You can effect a change there. Move forward not with hatred or love. Move forward with purpose. (Simone)

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: There is a magnificent, beautiful, wonderful painting in front of you! It is intricate, detailed, a painstaking labor of devotion and love! The colors are like no other, they swim and leap, they trickle and embellish! And yet you choose to fixate your eyes on the small fly which has landed on it! Why do you do such a thing?

Author: Sherman Alexie,  The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian
Quote: Do you understand how amazing it is to hear that from an adult? Do you know how amazing it is to hear that from anybody? It's one of the simplest sentences in the world, just four words, but they're the four hugest words in the world when they're put together.You can do it.

Author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch
Quote: But the effect of her being on those around her was incalculably diffusive: for the growing good of the world is partly dependent on unhistoric acts; and that things are not so ill with you and me as they might have been, is half owing to the number who lived faithfully a hidden life, and rest in unvisited tombs.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: Hard times build determination and inner strength. Through them we can also come to appreciate the uselessness of anger. Instead of getting angry nurture a deep caring and respect for troublemakers because by creating such trying circumstances they provide us with invaluable opportunities to practice tolerance and patience.

Author: Chris Colfer,  Struck By Lightning: The Carson Phillips Journal
Quote: You've got to show the world who you are before it tells you. Otherwise you become victim to someone you're not.

Author: Christopher Reeve
Quote: So many of our dreams at first seem impossible, then they seem improbable, and then, when we summon the will, they soon become inevitable.

Author: W. Clement Stone
Quote: Prayer is man's greatest power!

Author: Zayn Malik
Quote: No matter how hard life is, don't lose hope

Author: Martin Luther
Quote: Everything that is done in this world is done by hope.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbour says or does or thinks, but only at what he does himself, to make it just and holy.

Author: Michelle Hodkin,  The Evolution of Mara Dyer
Quote: It doesn’t matter what we are. It matters what we do.

Author: Malala Yousafzai,  I Am Malala: The Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Was Shot by the Taliban
Quote: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: When you say "I"and "my"too much, you lose the capacity to understand the "we"and "our".

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Don't forget your history nor your destiny

Author: Philip Pullman,  The Amber Spyglass
Quote: I have stolen ideas from every book I have ever read.

Author: Ramon Bautista,  Bakit Hindi Ka Crush ng Crush Mo?
Quote: There's more to life than love.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: One must always be prepared for riotous and endless waves of transformation.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken.

Author: Gaddy Bergmann
Quote: Someday is now.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: Argue for your limitations and, sure enough, they're yours.

Author: Nayyirah Waheed
Quote: Just because someone desires you, it does not mean that they value you.Read it over.Again.Let those words resonate in your mind.

Author: Emile Zola
Quote: The truth is on the march and nothing will stop it.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.

Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice
Quote: Do not give way to useless alarm; though it is right to be prepared for the worst, there is no occasion to look on it as certain.

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: Never stop. Never stop fighting. Never stop dreaming.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: She was a beautiful dreamer. The kind of girl, who kept her head in the clouds, loved above the stars and left regret beneath the earth she walked on.

Author: Andrew Clements,  Things Not Seen
Quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't three lefts make a right? Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't two negatives make a positive?

Author: John Bytheway
Quote: It is better to be respected than it is to be popular. Popularity ends on yearbook day, but respect lasts forever.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: If you want to be a doormat you have to lay yourself down first.

Author: Katie Couric
Quote: Be fearless. Have the courage to take risks. Go where there are no guarantees. Get out of your comfort zone even if it means being uncomfortable. The road less traveled is sometimes fraught with barricades bumps and uncharted terrain. But it is on that road where your character is truly tested And have the courage to accept that you’re not perfect nothing is and no one is — and that’s OK.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Sorrow looks back, Worry looks around, Faith looks up

Author: Ayaan Hirsi Ali
Quote: Tolerance of intolerance is cowardice.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: A bridge of silver wings stretches from the dead ashes of an unforgiving nightmareto the jeweled vision of a life started anew.

Author: Alan Bennett,  The Uncommon Reader
Quote: A book is a device to ignite the imagination.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The best love in the world, is the love of a man. The love of a man who came from your womb, the love of your son! I don't have a daughter, but maybe the love of a daughter is the best, too. I am first and foremost me, but right after that, I am a mother. The best thing that I can ever be, is me. But the best gift that I will ever have, is being a mother.

Author: Wendy Mass,  Jeremy Fink and the Meaning of Life
Quote: Maybe some things aren't meant to be known. maybe there just meant to be accepted.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: If people are going to be allowed to say "we love you"and "I love you", they'd better have the backbone to prove it. Love isn't just a word.

Author: Ray Manzarek
Quote: The only thing that ultimately matters is to eat an ice-cream cone, play a slide trombone, plant a small tree, good God, now you're free.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Son of Neptune
Quote: Life is only precious because it ends, kid. Take it from a god. You mortals don't know how lucky you are

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
Quote: In our world,"said Eustace, "a star is a huge ball of flaming gas."Even in your world, my son, that is not what a star is, but only what it is made of.

Author: Neal Stephenson,  Snow Crash
Quote: She's a woman, you're a dude. You're not supposed to understand her. That's not what she's after.... She doesn't want you to understand her. She knows that's impossible. She just wants you to understand yourself. Everything else is negotiable.

Author: Amit Ray,  Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style
Quote: Yoga is not a religion. It is a science, science of well-being, science of youthfulness, science of integrating body, mind and soul.

Author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You'll Go!
Quote: Fame you'll be famous, as famous as can be, with everyone watching you win on TV, Except when they don't because sometimes they won't..

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: If you are not the hero of your own story, then you're missing the whole point of your humanity.

Author: Jeanette Winterson
Quote: They say that every snowflake is different. If that were true, how could the world go on? How could we ever get up off our knees? How could we ever recover from the wonder of it?

Author: Frank Lloyd Wright
Quote: An idea is salvation by imagination

Author: Hlovate,  Contengan Jalanan
Quote: The man that decided to change on the 12th hours died at the 11th.

Author: Sharon Stone
Quote: Women can fake an orgasm, but men can fake an entire relationship.

Author: Emily Dickinson
Quote: I dwell in possibility.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez
Quote: Always tell what you feel. Do what you think...

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow,  Good Poems for Hard Times
Quote: The heights by great men reached and kept were not attained in sudden flight but, they while their companions slept, they were toiling upwards in the night.

Author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,  The Shadow of the Wind
Quote: One of the pitfalls of childhood is that one doesn't have to understand something to feel it. By the time the mind is able to comprehend what has happened, the wounds of the heart are already too deep.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: Complain and remain. Praise and be raised.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: There is no failure except in no longer trying.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you will ever have.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
Quote: The life given us, by nature is short; but the memory of a well-spent life is eternal.

Author: Michael J. Fox
Quote: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.

Author: Arthur Young
Quote: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: My life isn’t theories and formulae. It’s part instinct, part common sense. Logic is as good a word as any, and I’ve absorbed what logic I have from everything and everyone… from my mother, from training as a ballet dancer, from Vogue magazine, from the laws of life and health and nature.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: If people make fun of you, that probably means you're doing something right.

Author: Joseph Smith Jr.
Quote: Happiness is the object and design of our existence; and will be the end thereof, if we pursue the path that leads to it; and this path is virtue, uprightness, faithfulness, holiness, and keeping all the commandments of God.

Author: One Direction
Quote: You don't know, oh, ohYou don't know you're beautiful.

Author: John Boyne,  The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
Quote: ...Despite the mayhem that followed, Bruno found that he was still holding Shmuel's hand in his own and nothing in the world would have persuaded him to let go.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: Don't try to fix me, I'm not broken...

Author: Demi Lovato
Quote: The sky is the limit... for some people aim higher nothing is impossible.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on. Ideas have endurance without death.[Remarks Recorded for the Opening of a USIA Transmitter, February 8 1963]

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Quote: You can have many great ideas in your head, but what makes the difference is the action. Without action upon an idea, there will be no manifestation, no results, and no reward

Author: Robert Elias
Quote: If you can't fight and you can't flee, flow.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Life is a series of surprises and would not be worth taking or keeping if it were not.

Author: Thomas Henry Huxley,  Life and Letters of Thomas Henry Huxley - Volume 1
Quote: Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every preconceived notion, follow humbly wherever and to whatever abysses nature leads, or you shall learn nothing. I have only begun to learn content and peace of mind since I have resolved at all risks to do this.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Tombs of Atuan
Quote: Freedom is a heavy load, a great and strange burden for the spirit to undertake. It is not easy. It is not a gift given, but a choice made, and the choice may be a hard one. The road goes upward towards the light; but the laden traveler may never reach the end of it.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
Quote: All shall be done, but it may be harder than you think.

Author: Bob Ong
Quote: Gamitin ang puso para alagaan ang taong malapit sayo. Gamitin ang utakpara alagaan ang sarili mo.

Author: Joseph Wood Krutch
Quote: It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You approached all relationships with authenticity and honesty? Let today be the day…You dedicate yourself to building relationships on the solid foundation of truth and authenticity.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Your own positive future begins in this moment. All you have is right now. Every goal is possible from here.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: Myth is much more important and true than history. History is just journalism and you know how reliable that is.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The harder you fall, the heavier your heart; the heavier your heart, the stronger you climb; the stronger you climb, the higher your pedestal.

Author: Leslye Walton,  The Strange and Beautiful Sorrows of Ava Lavender
Quote: Children betrayed their parents by becoming their own people.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: To those who are given much, much is expected.

Author: Bohdi Sanders,  The Secrets of Worldly Wisdom: Your Key to Unlocking Success
Quote: Focus on making yourself better, not on thinking that you are better.

Author: Jacqueline Carey,  Kushiel's Chosen
Quote: All paths are present, always... and we can but choose among them.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: There are two things we should always be 1. raw and 2. ready. When you are raw, you are always ready and when you are ready you usually realize that you are raw. Waiting for perfection is not an answer, one cannot say "I will be ready when I am perfect"because then you will never be ready, rather one must say "I am raw and I am ready just like this right now, how and who I am.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: Every problem is a gift - without problems we would not grow.

Author: Lil Wayne
Quote: Love me or hate me, i swear it won't make or break me.

Author: Kristin Hannah,  Firefly Lane
Quote: To make real friends you have to put yourself out there. Sometimes people will let you down, but you can't let that stop you. If you get hurt, you just pick yourself up, dust off your feelings, and try again.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: With our thoughts we make the world.

Author: John C. Maxwell
Quote: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.

Author: Pope Paul VI
Quote: Nothing makes one feel so strong as a call for help.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Good works is giving to the poor and the helpless, but divine works is showing them their worth to the One who matters.

Author: A.W. Tozer
Quote: Sometimes I go to God and say, "God, if Thou dost never answer another prayer while I live on this earth, I will still worship Thee as long as I live and in the ages to come for what Thou hast done already. God’s already put me so far in debt that if I were to live one million millenniums I couldn’t pay Him for what He’s done for me.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Do not become someone else just because you are hurt. Be who you are & smile, it may solve, all problems you have got.

Author: Walter Bagehot
Quote: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

Author: Mark Helprin,  A Soldier of the Great War
Quote: As long as you have life and breath, believe. Believe for those who cannot. Believe even if you have stopped believing. Believe for the sake of the dead, for love, to keep your heart beating, believe. Never give up, never despair, let no mystery confound you into the conclusion that mystery cannot be yours.

Author: Barney Stinson
Quote: When I get sad, I stop being sad and be awesome instead.

Author: Hamka
Quote: Kecantikan yang abadi terletak pada keelokan adab dan ketinggian ilmu seseorang. Bukan terletak pada wajah dan pakaiannya

Author: Frederick Buechner,  The Clown in the Belfry: Writings on Faith and Fiction
Quote: Turn around and believe that the good news that we are loved is better than we ever dared hope, and that to believe in that good news, to live out of it and toward it, to be in love with that good news, is of all glad things in this world the gladdest thing of all. Amen, and come Lord Jesus.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: I cannot compromise my respect for your love. You can keep your love, I will keep my respect.

Author: Jim Henson
Quote: My hope still is to leave the world a bit better than when I got here.

Author: Nicola Yoon,  Everything, Everything
Quote: Everything's a risk. Not doing anything is a risk. It's up to you.

Author: Junot Díaz
Quote: In order to write the book you want to write, in the end you have to become the person you need to become to write that book.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Julius Caesar
Quote: Of all the wonders that I have heard,It seems to me most strange that men should fear;Seeing death, a necessary end,Will come when it will come.(Act II, Scene 2)

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: Do more than belong: participate. Do more than care: help. Do more than believe: practice. Do more than be fair: be kind. Do more than forgive: forget. Do more than dream: work.

Author: Malcolm Gladwell,  Outliers: The Story of Success
Quote: Those three things - autonomy, complexity, and a connection between effort and reward - are, most people will agree, the three qualities that work has to have if it is to be satisfying.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: I don't know, I don't want to talk as much. (...) It's nicer to think dear, pretty thoughts and keep them in one's heart, like treasures. I don't like to have them laughed at or wondered over.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  The Little Prince
Quote: I wonder,” he said, “whether the stars are set alight in heaven so that one day each one of us may find his own again...

Author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah
Quote: If you will practice being fictional for a while, you will understand that fictional characters are sometimes more real than people with bodies and heartbeats.

Author: Andrea Hirata,  Laskar Pelangi
Quote: Hiduplah Untuk Memberi yang Sebanyak-banyaknya, Bukan untuk Menerima yang Sebanyak-banyaknya. (Pak Harfan)

Author: Robert Jordan,  The Dragon Reborn
Quote: Til shade is gone, til water is goneInto the shadow with teeth baredScreaming defiance with the last breathTo spit in Sightblinder’s eye on the Last Day.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.

Author: Renee Carlino,  Sweet Thing
Quote: You have to teach your heart and mind how to sing together... then you'll hear the sound of your soul

Author: Henry Van Dyke
Quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.

Author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
Quote: What we love determines what we seek. What we seek determines what we think and do. What we think and do determines who we are — and who we will become.

Author: Anonymous,  The Bhagavad Gita
Quote: A gift is pure when it is given from the heart to the right person at the right time and at the right place, and when we expect nothing in return

Author: Ram Dass
Quote: The most exquisite paradox… as soon as you give it all up, you can have it all. As long as you want power, you can't have it. The minute you don't want power, you'll have more than you ever dreamed possible.

Author: Goenawan Mohamad
Quote: Kemampuan membaca itu sebuah rahmat. Kegemaran membaca; sebuah kebahagiaan.

Author: John Quincy Adams
Quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.

Author: Mutanat Enemy, Buffy the Vampire Slayer
Quote: Don't give me songs, give me something to sing about!

Author: James Thurber
Quote: All human beings should try to learn before they die what they are running from, and to, and why.

Author: Philip Pullman
Quote: I am a strong believer in the tyranny, the dictatorship, the absolute authority of the writer.

Author: John C. Maxwell
Quote: Talent is a gift, but character is a choice.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph
Quote: What hurts us is what heals us

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: There are scores of people waiting for someone just like us to come along; people who will appreciate our compassion, our encouragement, who will need our unique talents. Someone who will live a happier life merely because we took the time to share what we had to give.

Author: Flannery O'Connor
Quote: Accepting oneself does not preclude an attempt to become better.

Author: Sara Shepard,  Unbelievable
Quote: Its more fun to think of the future than dwell on the past.

Author: Victoria Schwab,  The Archived
Quote: What if I mess up?""Oh, you will. You'll mess up, you'll make mistakes, you'll break things. Some you'll be able to piece together, and others you'll lose. That's all a given. But there's only one thing you have to do for me.""What's that?""Stay alive long enough to mess up again.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: The New King James Version
Quote: And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing.

Author: Zora Neale Hurston,  Their Eyes Were Watching God
Quote: When God had made The Man, he made him out of stuff that sung all the time and glittered all over. Some angels got jealous and chopped him into millions of pieces, but still he glittered and hummed. So they beat him down to nothing but sparks but each little spark had a shine and a song. So they covered each one over with mud. And the lonesomeness in the sparks make them hunt for one another.

Author: Robert Bloch
Quote: Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk.

Author: Craig Thompson,  Blankets
Quote: How satisfying it is to leave a mark on a blank surface. To make a map of my movement - no matter how temporary.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: Smile at strangers and you just might change a life.

Author: Tina Fey,  Bossypants
Quote: Don't waste your energy trying to change opinions ... Do your thing, and don't care if they like it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: It's up to you today to start making healthy choices. Not choices that are just healthy for your body, but healthy for your mind.

Author: Black Elk
Quote: And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: Because I trust in the ever-changing climate of the heart. (At least, today I feel that way.) I think it is necessary to have many experiences for the sake of feeling something; for the sake of being challenged, and for the sake of being expressive, to offer something to someone else, to learn what we are capable of.

Author: Madonna
Quote: I want to be like Gandhi and Martin Luther King and John Lennon but i want to STAY ALIVE.

Author: Emily Dickinson,  Collected Poems of Emily Dickinson
Quote: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph
Quote: Only two things can reveal life's great secrets: suffering and love.

Author: Phil Lester
Quote: Normalness leads to sadness.

Author: Libba Bray,  The Sweet Far Thing
Quote: Reminds us that greatness lies even in the smallest of moments, in the humblest of hearts, and we shall, each of us, be called to greatness. Whether we shall rise to meet it or let it slip away is the challenge put before us all.

Author: Aeschylus
Quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.

Author: Roger Zelazny,  The Guns of Avalon
Quote: Nobody steals books but your friends.

Author: Harvey Milk
Quote: If a bullet should enter my brain, let that bullet destroy every closet door.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The motive behind criticism often determines its validity. Those who care criticize where necessary. Those who envy criticize the moment they think that they have found a weak spot.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Gratitude is a sign of maturity...Where there is appreciation: there is also courtesy and concern for the rights and property of others.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: I know in my heart that man is good, that what is right will always eventually triumph, and there is purpose and worth to each and every life.

Author: Rumi
Quote: The truth was a mirror in the hands of God. It fell, and broke into pieces. Everybody took a piece of it, and they looked at it and thought they had the truth.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: Everything you need to know you have learned through your journey.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Wisdom equals knowledge plus courage. You have to not only know what to do and when to do it, but you have to also be brave enough to follow through.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Mere Christianity
Quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you ‘love’ your neighbor; act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone, you will presently come to love him.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Eena, The Tempter's Snare
Quote: Don't ever give up. Don't ever give in. Don't ever stop trying. Don't ever sell out. And if you find yourself succumbing to one of the above for a brief moment, pick yourself up, brush yourself off, whisper a prayer, and start where you left off.But never, ever, ever give up.

Author: Elie Wiesel
Quote: Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must — at that moment — become the center of the universe.

Author: Ann Brashares,  The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants
Quote: Time is what keeps things from happening all at once.

Author: J.K. Rowling
Quote: Rock bottom became the solid foundation on which I rebuilt my life.

Author: Wendelin Van Draanen,  Flipped
Quote: You can't dwell on what might have been...and it's not fair to condemn him for something he hasn't done.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt,  This is My Story
Quote: Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: Man cannot possess anything as long as he fears death. But to him who does not fear it, everything belongs. If there was no suffering, man would not know his limits, would not know himself.

Author: Marlee Matlin
Quote: The handicap of deafness is not in the ear; it is in the mind.

Author: Abraham Lincoln,  The Gettysburg Address
Quote: Fourscore and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent, a new nation, conceived in Liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Prayer is not an old woman's idle amusement. Properly understood and applied, it is the most potent instrument of action.

Author: Katie Kacvinsky,  Awaken
Quote: Some people try to tell you the things you want in life are out of your grasp, while others lift you up on their shoulders and help you reach them. I may not know a lot, but I prefer to fill my life with people who let me climb on top of their shoulders, not people who try to keep me planted on the ground.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Letters to Various Persons
Quote: It is not enough to be industrious; so are the ants. What are you industrious about?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Her dancing inspires me to move. I used to be like a statue, and now I am more like a mannequin. So much more fashionable, you know?

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Do not wait: the time will never be 'just right'. Start where you stand, and work whatever tools you may have at your command and better tools will be found as you go along.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Politeness is okay, but it gets old and boring. You want to attack life with a passion, not a politeness, you want people to think about you and remember you and say "she is so passionate"you don't want people to think about you and remember you and say "she is so polite,"because, who cares about polite?

Author: Helen Steiner Rice
Quote: When you ask God for a gift, Be thankful if he sends, Not diamonds, pearls or riches, but the love of real true friends.

Author: John Lubbock,  The Use Of Life
Quote: Rest is not idleness, and to lie sometimes on the grass under trees on a summer's day, listening to the murmur of the water, or watching the clouds float across the sky, is by no means a waste of time.

Author: Alexander Graham Bell
Quote: When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: A respectable appearance is sufficient to make people more interested in your soul

Author: Colette
Quote: Hope costs nothing.

Author: Jack Welch
Quote: Face reality as it is, not as it was or as you wish it to be.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Every day we should hear at least one little song, read one good poem, see one exquisite picture, and, if possible, speak a few sensible words.

Author: D.H. Lawrence
Quote: Life is ours to be spent, not tobe saved.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  The Hero's Journey: Joseph Campbell on His Life & Work
Quote: You enter the forestat the darkest point,where there is no path.Where there is a way or path,it is someone else's path.You are not on your own path.If you follow someone else's way,you are not going to realizeyour potential.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: Do not pray for easy lives. Pray to be stronger men.[Quoting Reverend Phillips Brooks, during Remarks at Presidential Prayer Breakfast, February 7 1963]

Author: Kelly Cutrone,  If You Have to Cry, Go Outside: And Other Things Your Mother Never Told You
Quote: After all, you can't truly be happy if you've never known pain. You can't truly feel joy if you've never felt heartbreak. You can't know what it's like to be filled unless you've been empty.

Author: Kerry E. Wagner
Quote: you don't have to worry about burning bridges, if you're building your own

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: The hardest battle you are ever going to have to fight is the battle to be just you.

Author: Brigham Young
Quote: He who takes offense when no offense is intended is a fool, and he who takes offense when offense is intended is a greater fool.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Do not let another day go by where your dedication to other people's opinions is greater than your dedication to your own emotions!

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: If you believe you can, you might. If you know you can, you will.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes
Quote: If we don't change the direction we are headed, we will end up where we are going.

Author: Frank Herbert,  Dune
Quote: Whether a thought is spoken or not it is a real thing and it has power,"Tuek said. "You might find the line between life and death among the Fremen to be too sharp and quick.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings
Quote: In the end, all men die. How you lived will be far more important to the Almighty than what you accomplished.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Self-esteem comes from being able to define the world in your own terms and refusing to abide by the judgments of others.

Author: Stephen R. Covey
Quote: To touch the soul of another human being is to walk on holy ground.

Author: William Faulkner
Quote: A writer must teach himself that the basest of all things is to be afraid.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.

Author: Alphonse de Lamartine
Quote: Music is the literature of the heart; it commences where speech ends.

Author: Henry Rollins
Quote: I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone.

Author: Jack Kerouac,  On the Road
Quote: I was halfway across America, at the dividing line between the East of my youth and the West of my future.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: The function of freedom is to free someone else.

Author: Woodrow Wilson
Quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.

Author: E.E. Cummings
Quote: ...remember one thing only: that it's you-nobody else-who determines your destiny and decides your fate. Nobody else can be alive for you; nor can you be alive for anybody else.

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: Love your life. Because your life is what you have to give.

Author: Charles Caleb Colton
Quote: The firmest friendships have been formed in mutual adversity, as iron is most strongly united by the fiercest flame

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: It is not so much the major events as the small day-to-day decisions that map the course of our living. . . Our lives are, in reality, the sum total of our seemingly unimportant decisions and of our capacity to live by those decisions.

Author: Christian D. Larson
Quote: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.

Author: Sophocles,  Antigone
Quote: A man, though wise, should never be ashamed of learning more, and must unbend his mind.

Author: Muriel Rukeyser
Quote: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone.

Author: Stephen King,  On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft
Quote: To write is human, to edit is divine.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The way I define happiness is being the creator of your experience, choosing to take pleasure in what you have, right now, regardless of the circumstances, while being the best you that you can be.

Author: عصام يوسف,  1/4 جرام
Quote: انت عمرك ما كنت مسئول عن مرضك... بس النهارده انت مسئول عن شفاك.

Author: Shel Silverstein
Quote: If you are a dreamer come in

Author: Neale Donald Walsch
Quote: If you want the best the world has to offer, offer the world your best.

Author: Mitch Albom,  The Time Keeper
Quote: When we are most alone is when we embrace another's loneliness.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past.

Author: Martha Washington
Quote: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances. a

Author: Lewis Black,  Me of Little Faith
Quote: Each of us is full of shit in our own special way. We are all shitty little snowflakes dancing in the universe.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.

Author: Dolly Parton
Quote: If you don’t like the road you’re walking, start paving another one.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: Forgive yourself before you die. Then forgive others.

Author: Kate DiCamillo,  Because of Winn-Dixie
Quote: You can't always judge people by the things they done. You got to judge them by what they are doing now.

Author: James Baldwin
Quote: Know from whence you came. If you know whence you came, there are absolutely no limitations to where you can go.

Author: Donald Miller,  Through Painted Deserts: Light, God, and Beauty on the Open Road
Quote: And if these mountains had eyes, they would wake to find two strangers in their fences, standing in admiration as a breathing red pours its tinge upon earth's shore. These mountains, which have seen untold sunrises, long to thunder praise but stand reverent, silent so that man's weak praise should be given God's attention.

Author: Hiromu Arakawa
Quote: Stand up and walk. Move on. After all, you have perfect legs to stand on.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Love has no culture, boundaries, race and religion. It is pure and beautiful like early morning sunrise falling in lake.

Author: Sharon Swan
Quote: If someone loves you, they should not be envious of you pouring your heart and soul and time and energy into the things that you are passionate about, but instead....they should love you MORE because you are so involved in those things.

Author: Megan McCafferty,  Second Helpings
Quote: I believe that what we get out of life is what we've set ourselves up to get, so there's no such thing as an inconsequential decision. Our destinies are the culmination of all the choices we've made along the way, which is why it's imperative to listen hard to your inner voice when it speaks up. Don't let anyone else's noise drown it out.

Author: Edward O. Wilson
Quote: People would rather believe than know.

Author: Tupac Shakur
Quote: I believe that everything that you do bad comes back to you. So everything that I do that's bad, I'm going to suffer from it. But in my mind, I believe what I'm doing is right. So I feel like I'm going to heaven

Author: Demi Lovato
Quote: Skies are crying,I am watching,Catching teardrops in my hands.Only silence, as it's ending,Like we never had a chance.Do you have to make me feelLike there's nothing left of me?

Author: Swami Vivekananda
Quote: The great secret of true success, of true happiness, is this: the man or woman who asks for no return, the perfectly unselfish person, is the most successful.

Author: Tasaro G.K.,  Muhammad: Lelaki Penggenggam Hujan
Quote: ...mencintai itu, kadang mengumpulkan segala tabiat menyebalkan dari seseorang yang engkau cintai, memakinya, merasa tak sanggup lagi menjadi yang terbaik untuk dirinya, dan berpikir tak ada lagi jalan kembali, tapi tetap saja engkau tak sanggup benar-benar meninggalkannya.

Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.,  Life's Little Instruction Book: 511 Suggestions, Observations, and Reminders on How to Live a Happy and Rewarding Life
Quote: Don't forget, a person's greatest emotional need is to feel appreciated.

Author: P.C. Cast,  Marked
Quote: You are old beyond your years Zoeybird. Believe in yourself and you will find a way. But remember darkness does not always equate to evil just like light does not always bring good.

Author: فؤاد حداد,  الأعمال الكاملة ( على الطريق الرمضانى ) - الجزء الثاني
Quote: و أنا فى الحقيقة ماليش فى الوصف كتير..أنا باحب و باكره

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Your children are not your children. They are the sons and daughters of Life's longing for itself... You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.

Author: Joyce Kilmer,  Trees & Other Poems
Quote: I think that I shall never seeA poem lovely as a tree.A tree whose hungry mouth is pressedAgainst the earth's sweet flowing breast;A tree that looks at God all dayAnd lifts her leafy arms to pray;A tree that may in summer wearA nest of robins in her hair;Upon whose bosom snow has lain;Who intimately lives with rain.Poems are made by fools like me,But only God can make a tree.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter usfrom the support of a cause we believe to be just.

Author: John Ruskin
Quote: Let every dawn be to you as the beginning of life, and every setting sun be to you as its close.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Although time seems to fly, it never travels faster than one day at a time. Each day is a new opportunity to live your life to the fullest. In each waking day, you will find scores of blessings and opportunities for positive change. Do not let your TODAY be stolen by the unchangeable past or the indefinite future! Today is a new day!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: To know a species, look at its fears. To know yourself, look at your fears. Fear in itself is not important, but fear stands there and points you in the direction of things that are important. Don't be afraid of your fears, they're not there to scare you; they're there to let you know that something is worth it.

Author: Morrie Schwartz
Quote: Do the kind of things that come from the heart, When you do, you won't be dissatisfied, you won't be envious, you won't be longing for somebody else's things. On the contrary, you'll be overhelmed with what comes back

Author: Charlotte Brontë,  Villette
