Quote: I believe in some blending of hope and sunshine sweetening the worst lots. I believe that this life is not all; neither the beginning nor the end. I believe while I tremble; I trust while I weep.

Author: Jason Fried,  Rework
Quote: What you do is what matters, not what you think or say or plan.

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Quote: You can only be afraid of what you think you know.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Give your weakness to one who helps.

Author: Jack Canfield,  Chicken Soup for the Teenage Soul II
Quote: And so I wait. I wait for time to heal the pain and raise me to me feet once again - so that I can start a new path, my own path, the one that will make me whole again.

Author: Morgan Matson,  Amy and Roger's Epic Detour
Quote: The best discoveries always happened to the people who weren't looking for it. Columbus and America. Pinzon, who stumbled on Brazil while looking for the West Indies. Stanley happening on Victoria Falls. And you. Amy Curry, when I was least expecting her.-Roger Sullivan

Author: Ashley Smith
Quote: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.

Author: Tere Liye,  Rembulan Tenggelam Di Wajahmu
Quote: Hanya orang-orang dengan hati damailah yang boleh menerima kejadian buruk dengan lega.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage
Quote: As we go through life we gradually discover who we are, but the more we discover, the more we lose ourselves.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.

Author: Roopleen,  Words to inspire the winner in YOU
Quote: Don’t let mental blocks control you. Set yourself free. Confront your fear and turn the mental blocks into building blocks.

Author: Sheryl Sandberg,  Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead
Quote: In the future, there will be no female leaders. There will just be leaders.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  The Last Hero
Quote: Lots of people would be as cowardly as me if they were brave enough.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.

Author: Fred Rogers,  The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember
Quote: We need to help people to discover the true meaning of love. Love is generally confused with dependence. Those of us who have grown in true love know that we can love only in proportion to our capacity for independence.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Write while the heat is in you. The writer who postpones the recording of his thoughts uses an iron which has cooled to burn a hole with. He cannot inflame the minds of his audience.

Author: John Newton,  Amazing Grace
Quote: Although my memory's fading, I remember two things very clearly: I am a great sinner and Christ is a great Savior.

Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.
Quote: The quality of a man's life is in direct proportion to his commitment to excellence, regardless of his chosen field of endeavor.

Author: Henry Norris Russell
Quote: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.

Author: Carrie Ryan,  The Dead-Tossed Waves
Quote: I realize that life is risks. It’s acknowledging the past but looking forward. It’s taking a chance that we willmake mistakes but believing that we all deserve to be forgiven.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Timon of Athens
Quote: Like madness is the glory of this life.

Author: Masashi Kishimoto
Quote: People live their lives bound by what they accept as correct and true. That’s how they define Reality. But what does it mean to be “correct” or “true”? Merely vague concepts… Their Reality may all be a mirage. Can we consider them to simply be living in their own world, shaped by their beliefs?

Author: Dorothy Day
Quote: The greatest challenge of the day is: how to bring about a revolution of the heart, a revolution which has to start with each one of us?

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre,  Existentialism Is a Humanism
Quote: Il n'y a de réalité que dans l'action.(There is no reality except in action.)

Author: Trina Paulus,  Hope for the Flowers
Quote: How does one become a butterfly? They have to want to learn to fly so much that you are willing to give up being a caterpillar.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: It's easy to forget things you don't need anymore.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  The Power of Myth
Quote: We're so engaged in doing things to achieve purposes of outer value that we forget the inner value, the rapture that is associated with being alive, is what it is all about.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: It’s time to care; it’s time to take responsibility; it’s time to lead; it’s time for a change; it’s time to be true to our greatest self; it’s time to stop blaming others.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: People who lack the clarity, courage, or determination to follow their own dreams will often find ways to discourage yours. Live your truth and don't EVER stop!

Author: Simone Elkeles,  Leaving Paradise
Quote: Sometimes you have to steer away from the crowd in order to be a better person. It's not always easy, that's for sure. But it's right. And sometimes doing the right thing feels good, even if it does end up in a trip to the principal's office.

Author: John C. Maxwell,  Be a People Person
Quote: if you don't have peace, it isn't because someone took it from you; you gave it away. You cannot always control what happens to you, but you can control what happens in you.

Author: Toni Morrison,  Song of Solomon
Quote: If you surrendered to the air, you could ride it.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude

Author: Laini Taylor,  Days of Blood & Starlight
Quote: Brimstone once told me that to stay true in the face of evil is a feat of strength.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe
Quote: Wrong will be right, when Aslan comes in sight,At the sound of his roar, sorrows will be no more,When he bares his teeth, winter meets its death,And when he shakes his mane, we shall have spring again.

Author: Ben Carson,  Gifted Hands: The Ben Carson Story
Quote: Successful people don't have fewer problems. They have determined that nothing will stop them from going forward.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  The Scorpio Races
Quote: I am so, so alive.

Author: Immanuel Kant,  Critique of Practical Reason
Quote: Two things fill the mind with ever-increasing wonder and awe, the more often and the more intensely the mind of thought is drawn to them: the starry heavens above me and the moral law within me.

Author: John Eldredge
Quote: The culture of women in the church today is crippled by some very pervasive lies. "To be spiritual is to be busy. To be spiritual is to be disciplined. To be spiritual is to be dutiful."No, to be spiritual is to be in Romance with God. The desire to be romanced lies deep in the heart of every women. It is for such that you were made. Are you ARE romanced, and ever will be.

Author: Joshua Harris,  I Kissed Dating Goodbye: A New Attitude Toward Relationships and Romance
Quote: The world takes us to a silver screen on which flickering images of passion and romance play, and as we watch, the world says, “This is love.” God takes us to the foot of a tree on which a naked and bloodied man hangs and says, “This is love.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: Each star is a mirror reflecting the truth inside you.

Author: Ayn Rand
Quote: Have you ever felt the longing for someone you could admire? For something, not to look down at, but up to?

Author: Helen Keller,  The Open Door
Quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Every moment of light and dark is a miracle.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise

Author: Earl Nightingale
Quote: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: Never let anybody guess that you have a mind of your own. Above all be pure

Author: Rumi,  Hush, Don't Say Anything to God: Passionate Poems of Rumi
Quote: You think of yourselfas a citizen of the universe.You think you belong to this world of dust and matter.Out of this dustyou have created a personal image,and have forgottenabout the essence of your true origin

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: But we never get back our youth… The pulse of joy that beats in us at twenty becomes sluggish. Our limbs fail, our senses rot. We degenerate into hideous puppets, haunted by the memory of the passions of which we were too much afraid, and the exquisite temptations that we had not the courage to yield to.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Miracles
Quote: Miracles do not, in fact, break the laws of nature.

Author: Zoë Marriott,  Shadows on the Moon
Quote: People trust their eyes above all else - but most people see what they wish to see, or what they believe they should see; not what is really there

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: What a lover’s heart knows let no man’s brain dispute.

Author: Jules Renard
Quote: It`s not how old you are, it`s how you are old.

Author: Margaret Thatcher
Quote: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.

Author: Robert Schumann
Quote: I am so fresh in soul and spirit that life gushes and bubbles around me in a thousand springs.

Author: Jillian Michaels
Quote: Get comfortable with being uncomfortable!

Author: J.K. Rowling,  The Casual Vacancy
Quote: The mistake ninety-nine percent of humanity made, as far as Fats could see, was being ashamed of what they were; lying about it, trying to be somebody else.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Try to find pleasure in the speed that you're not used to. Changing the way you do routine things allows a new person to grow inside of you. But when all is said and done, you're the one who must decide how you handle it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Those who have the ability to be grateful are the ones who have the ability to achieve greatness.

Author: Eckhart Tolle,  The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
Quote: As soon as you honor the present moment, all unhappiness and struggle dissolve, and life begins to flow with joy and ease. When you act out the present-moment awareness, whatever you do becomes imbued with a sense of quality, care, and love - even the most simple action.

Author: Ovid,  Metamorphoses
Quote: Happy is the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind, and has given up worrying once and for all.”"Be patient and tough; one day this pain will be useful to you.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: Instead of focusing on how much you can accomplish, focus on how much you can absolutely love what you’re doing.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: Find a purpose to serve, not a lifestyle to live.

Author: Audrey Niffenegger,  Her Fearful Symmetry
Quote: There are several ways to react to being lost. One is to panic: this was usually Valentina's first impulse. Another is to abandon yourself to lostness, to allow the fact that you've misplaced yourself to change the way you experience the world.

Author: Mitch Albom
Quote: You can feel the whole world and still feel lost in it. So many people are in pain-- no matter how smart or accomplished--they cry, they yearn, they hurt. But instead of looking down on things, they look up, which is where I should have been looking, too. Because when the world quiets to the sound of your own breathing, we all want the same things: comfort, love and a peaceful heart.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden, or Life in the Woods
Quote: There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.

Author: Pema Chödrön,  When Things Fall Apart: Heart Advice for Difficult Times
Quote: I used to have a sign pinned up on my wall that read: Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible be found in us...It was all about letting go of everything. p.7

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Horse and His Boy
Quote: When things go wrong, you'll find they usually go on getting worse for some time; but when things once start going right they often go on getting better and better.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: And people who don’t dream, who don’t have any kind of imaginative life, they must… they must go nuts. I can’t imagine that.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: Ignore all hatred and criticism. Live for what you create, and die protecting it.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: We join spokes together in a wheel, but it is the center hole that makes the wagon move.We shape clay into a pot, but it is the emptiness insidethat holds whatever we want.We hammer wood for a house, but it is the inner spacethat makes it livable.We work with being, but non-being is what we use.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: No human should mislead another by promising them something they know to be untrue.

Author: Nora Roberts,  Morrigan's Cross
Quote: know what you want, work to get it, then value it once you have it.

Author: فؤاد حداد,  الأعمال الكاملة ( على الطريق الرمضانى ) - الجزء الثاني
Quote: كلمة أنا ما تحلاش إلا بدفا الجماعة. زى لمّا تخبط على باب الحبايب ويسألوا "مين؟"تقول "أنا"ويعرفوك من حسك

Author: Bill Gates
Quote: Most people overestimate what they can do in one year and underestimate what they can do in ten years.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Manuscript Found in Accra
Quote: Love is only a word, until we decide to let it possess us with all its force.Love is only a word, until someone arrives to give it meaning.Don't give up. Remember, it's always the last key on the key ring that opens the door.

Author: Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky
Quote: Inspiration is a guest that does not willingly visit the lazy.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: ‎Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody else expects of you. Never excuse yourself. Never pity yourself. Be a hard master to yourself-and be lenient to everybody else.

Author: Simone Elkeles,  Leaving Paradise
Quote: being afraid to take chances is scarier than actually doing things that challenge you.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: When I left Queen's my future seemed to stretch out before me like a straight road. I thought I could see along it for many a milestone. Now there is a bend in it. I don't know what lies around the bend, but I'm going to believe that the best does.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: Make today worth remembering.

Author: T.D. Jakes,  Maximize the Moment: God's Action Plan For Your Life
Quote: Each day is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift to Him.

Author: Megan Whalen Turner,  The Queen of Attolia
Quote: If I am the pawn of the gods, it is because they know me so well, not because they make my mind up for me.

Author: Andrew Matthews
Quote: Is it easy? Usually not. But you don't forgive people for their benefit. You do it for your benefit.

Author: Taylor Swift
Quote: If they don't like you for being yourself, be yourself even more.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Love is like a good cake; you never know when it's coming, but you'd better eat it when it does!

Author: Octavia E. Butler,  Bloodchild and Other Stories
Quote: First forget inspiration. Habit is more dependable. Habit will sustain you whether you're inspired or not. Habit will help you finish and polish your stories. Inspiration won't. Habit is persistence in practice.

Author: Suzanne Collins
Quote: Having an eye for beauty isn't the same thing as a weakness...except possibly when it comes to you.

Author: Ally Carter,  Cross My Heart and Hope to Spy
Quote: The whole summer lay ahead of us-time to rest, time to wait. And when the future comes-no matter what comes with it-I'll be smarter. I'll be stronger. I'll be ready.

Author: Mitch Albom,  The Time Keeper
Quote: Ends are for yesterday, not tomorrows.

Author: David Levithan,  Boy Meets Boy
Quote: We pencil-sketch our previous life so we can contrast it to the technicolor of the moment.

Author: Mary Haskell
Quote: Nothing you become will disappoint me; I have no preconception that I'd like to see you be or do. I have no desire to forsee you, only to discover you. You can't disappoint me

Author: Ishmael Beah,  A Long Way Gone: Memoirs of a Boy Soldier
Quote: In the sky there are always answers and explanations for everything: every pain, every suffering, joy and confusion.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
Quote: It turned out this man worked for the Dalai Lama. And she said gently-that they believe when a lot of things start going wrong all at once, it is to protect something big and lovely that is trying to get itself born-and that this something needs for you to be distracted so that it can be born as perfectly as possible.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Maybe we shouldn't be looking for love. Maybe we should be looking for a person. Because maybe you can find love in a person, but not have that person. So if you look for love, what you will find is love. But if you want to belong to someone, and you want someone to belong to you, you should look for a person.

Author: Bill Gates
Quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.

Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones
Quote: My name is Salmon, like the fish; first name, Susie. I was fourteen when I was murdered.

Author: Dom Hubert Van Zeller
Quote: What the soul hardly realizes is that, unbeliever or not, his loneliness is really a homesickness for God.

Author: Fulton J. Sheen
Quote: Show me your hands. Do they have scars from giving? Show me your feet. Are they wounded in service? Show me your heart. Have you left a place for divine love?

Author: King James Gadsden
Quote: Life keeps throwing me lemons because I make the best lemonade...

Author: Philip Pullman,  Clockwork
Quote: If you want something you can have it, but only if you want everything that goes with it, including all the hard work and the despair, and only if you're willing to risk failure.

Author: Adam Young
Quote: I am fallen, flawed and imperfect. Yet drenched in the grace and mercy that is found in Jesus Christ, there is strength

Author: Fred Rogers,  Life's Journeys According to Mister Rogers: Things to Remember Along the Way
Quote: Who we are in the present includes who we were in the past.

Author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You'll Go!
Quote: And will you succeed?Yes! You will, indeed!(98 and 3/4 percent guaranteed.)KID, YOU'LL MOVE MOUNTAINS!So...be your name Buxbaum or Bixby or Brayor Mordecai Ali Van Allen O'Shea,you're off to Great Places!Today is your day!Your mountain is waiting.So...get on your way!

Author: Valencia Mackie
Quote: Never give advice unless you have walked the walk, because anybody can talk the talk.

Author: Toba Beta,  Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza
Quote: Many people pray to be kept out of unexpected problems. Some people pray to be able to confront and overcome them.

Author: Dean Karnazes,  Ultramarathon Man: Confessions of an All-Night Runner
Quote: Struggling and suffering are the essence of a life worth living. If you're not pushing yourself beyond the comfort zone, if you're not demanding more from yourself - expanding and learning as you go - you're choosing a numb existence. You're denying yourself an extraordinary trip.

Author: Henry James,  The Ambassadors
Quote: Live all you can: it's a mistake not to. It doesn't matter what you do in particular, so long as you have had your life. If you haven't had that, what have you had?

Author: Gabrielle Zevin,  Memoirs of a Teenage Amnesiac
Quote: Love stories are written in millimeters and milliseconds with a fast, dull pencil whose marks you can barely see, they are written in miles and eons with a chisel on the side of a mountiantop

Author: Daisaku Ikeda
Quote: Leave behind the passive dreaming of a rose-tinted future. The energy of happiness exists in living today with roots sunk firmly in reality's soil.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Achievement has no color

Author: T.H. White,  The Once and Future King
Quote: If people reach perfection they vanish, you know.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Judging is preventing us from understanding a new truth. Free yourself from the rules of old judgments and create the space for new understanding.

Author: Brian Cox
Quote: We are the cosmos made conscious and life is the means by which the universe understands itself.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: In essence, if we want to direct our lives, we must take control of our consistent actions. It's not what we do once in a while that shapes our lives, but what we do consistently.

Author: Jon Ronson,  The Psychopath Test: A Journey Through the Madness Industry
Quote: There is no evidence that we've been placed on this planet to be especially happy or especially normal. And in fact our unhappiness and our strangeness, our anxieties and compulsions, those least fashionable aspects of our personalities, are quite often what lead us to do rather interesting things.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  What I Talk About When I Talk About Running
Quote: I'm often asked what I think about as I run. Usually the people who ask this have never run long distances themselves. I always ponder the question. What exactly do I think about when I'm running? I don't have a clue.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: You either have to write or you shouldn't be writing. That's all.

Author: Tony Robbins
Quote: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: To all that come to this happy place, welcome. Disneyland is your land. Here age relives fond memories of the past, and here youth may savor the challenge and promise of the future. Disneyland is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created America... with hope that it will be a source of joy and inspiration to all the world.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: Life is very short, and there's no time for fussing and fighting my friends

Author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
Quote: Look not mournfully into the past, it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present, it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Protect your enthusiasm from the negativity and fear of others. Never decide to do nothing just because you can only do little. Do what you can. You would be surprised at what "little"acts have done for our world.

Author: Dean Karnazes,  Ultramarathon Man: Confessions of an All-Night Runner
Quote: I run because if I didn’t, I’d be sluggish and glum and spend too much time on the couch. I run to breathe the fresh air. I run to explore. I run to escape the ordinary. I run…to savor the trip along the way. Life becomes a little more vibrant, a little more intense. I like that.

Author: Demi Lovato
Quote: Do you have to make me feel like there's nothing left of me? You can take everything I have, you can break everything I am, like I am made of glass, like I am made of paper.Go on and try to tear me down I will be rising from the ground like a Skyscraper...

Author: Rumi
Quote: This place is a dream. Only a sleeper considers it real. Then death comes like dawn, and you wake up laughing at what you thought was your grief.

Author: Stephen King,  The Stand
Quote: The Lord is my shepherd. I shall not want for nothing. He makes me lie down in the green pastures. He greases up my head with oil. He gives me kung-fu in the face of my enemies. Amen

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Going Home: Jesus and Buddha as Brothers
Quote: It is said that God has created man in his own image. But it may be that humankind has created God in the image of humankind.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Don't look to the approval of others for your mental stability

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: There are still some wonderful people left in this world! They are diamonds in the rough, but they're around! You'll find them when you fall down– they're the ones who pick you up, who don't judge, and you had to fall down to see them! When you get up again, remember who your true friends are!

Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
Quote: Life doesn't require that we be the best, only that we try our best.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the mext moment

Author: Christopher McCandless
Quote: The very basic core of a man's living spirit is his passion for adventure. The joy of life comes from our encounters with new experiences, and hence there is no greater joy than to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: When you were born you were crying and everyone else was smiling. Live your life so at the end, your're the one who is smiling and everyone else is crying.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Argue not concerning God,…re-examine all that you have been told at church or school or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your soul…

Author: Arthur Conan Doyle,  The Adventure of the Greek Interpreter
Quote: My dear Watson,"said [Sherlock Holmes], "I cannot agree with those who rank modesty among the virtues. To the logician all things should be seen exactly as they are, and to underestimate one's self is as much a departure from truth as to exaggerate one's own powers.

Author: Octavia E. Butler
Quote: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.

Author: Gayle Forman,  If I Stay
Quote: Life might take you down different roads. But each of you gets to decide which one to take.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Scandal in Spring
Quote: Most lives are not distinguished by great achievements. They are measured by an infinite number of small ones. Each time you do a kindness for someone or bring a smile to his face, it gives your life meaning. Never doubt your value, little friend. The world would be a dismal place without you in it. (tweaked version of a passage from Scandal in Spring)

Author: Justin Bieber
Quote: I close my eyes  and I can see a better day.  I close my eyes  and pray

Author: Robert Jordan
Quote: Time to toss the dice

Author: Anne Lamott,  Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith
Quote: Help"is a prayer that is always answered. It doesn't matter how you pray--with your head bowed in silence, or crying out in grief, or dancing. Churches are good for prayer, but so are garages and cars and mountains and showers and dance floors. Years ago I wrote an essay that began, "Some people think that God is in the details, but I have come to believe that God is in the bathroom.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Accept yourself, your strengths, your weaknesses, your truths, and know what tools you have to fulfill your purpose.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: A photographer is like a cod, which produces a million eggs in order that one may reach maturity.

Author: Richard Bach,  One
Quote: A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: We are what we believe we are!

Author: أنيس منصور
Quote: الإنسان يجب أن يدق الباب .. فسوف يجد أحداً يفتح .. عن رغبة أو رهبة أو ضيق .. ولكن لابد أن ينفتح الباب .. ومن وراءه باب ثاني وثالث

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: How can I be substantial if I do not cast a shadow? I must have a dark side also If I am to be whole

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Your greatest self has been waiting your whole life; don't make it wait any longer.

Author: Maimonides,  The Guide for the Perplexed
Quote: Truth does not become more true by virtue of the fact that the entire world agrees with it, nor less so even if the whole world disagrees with it.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: Status quo, you know, is Latin for 'the mess we're in'.

Author: Anne Frank
Quote: If we bear all this suffering and if there are still Jews left, when it is over, then Jews, instead of being doomed, will be held up as an example.

Author: Joyce Meyer
Quote: Is there any real purpose in being alive if all we are going to do is get up every day and live only for ourselves?Live your life to help others. Give & live selflessly.

Author: Dee Marie,  Sons of Avalon: Merlin's Prophecy
Quote: Chase your dreams until you catch them...and then dream, catch, and dream again!

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The life you have left is a gift. Cherish it. Enjoy it now, to the fullest. Do what matters, now.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged by Damnation
Quote: A complete stranger has the capacity to alter the life of another irrevocably. This domino effect has the capacity to change the course of an entire world. That is what life is; a chain reaction of individuals colliding with others and influencing their lives without realizing it. A decision that seems miniscule to you, may be monumental to the fate of the world.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: ... it’s a blessed thing to love and feel loved in return.

Author: William Blake
Quote: A man can't soar too high, when he flies with his own wings.

Author: Bob Dylan,  Chronicles, Vol. 1
Quote: Even if you don't have all the things you want, be grateful for the things you don't have that you don't want (Bob Dylan's dad)

Author: A.A. Milne,  The House at Pooh Corner
Quote: And by and by Christopher Robin came to the end of things, and he was silent, and he sat there, looking out over the world, just wishing it wouldn't stop.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Don't blow off another's candle for it won't make yours shine brighter.

Author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
Quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: That is the hardest thing of all. It is much harder to judge yourself than to judge others. If you succeed in judging yourself, it's because you're truly a wise man.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: I believe in the hands that work, in the brains that think, and in the hearts that love...I believe in sunshine, fresh air, friendship, calm sleep, beautiful thoughts.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: Most people die with their music still locked up inside them.

Author: Sarah Caldwell
Quote: Learn everything you can, anytime you can, from anyone you can, there will always come a time when you will be grateful you did.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: It is harder to crack prejudice than an atom.

Author: Donny Dhirgantoro,  5 cm
Quote: Kemudian yang kamu perlukan hanyalah kaki yang akan melangkah lebih jauh, tangan yang akan berbuat lebih banyak, mata yang akan melihat lebih lama, leher yang akan lebih sering mendongak, tekad yang setebal baja, dan hati yang akan bekerja lebih keras serta mulut yang selalu berdoa.

Author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
Quote: it takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeded.

Author: Katsura Hoshino
Quote: When you lost sight of your path, listen for the destination in your heart (Allen Walker, D-gray Man)

Author: David Levithan,  How They Met, and Other Stories
Quote: Love doesn’t have to be on Valentine’s Day. It doesn’t have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn’t have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn’t have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.It just has to be. In time. In place. In spirt.It just has to be.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: At the moment of commitment the entire universe conspires to assist you.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: The best way to become acquainted with a subject is to write about it.

Author: Frances E. Willard
Quote: The world is wide, and I will not waste my life in friction when it could be turned into momentum.

Author: Jack Canfield
Quote: Everything you want is on the other side of fear.

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: To be kind, honest and have positive thoughts; to forgive those who harm us and treat everyone as a friend; to help those who are suffering and never to consider ourselves superior to anyone else: even if this advice seems rather simplistic, make the effort of seeing whether by following it you can find greater happiness.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: You can run away from yourself so often, and so much, just because the broken pieces of you cut your feet too deeply if you stay around for too long. But then what if someone were to come along and pick up those pieces for you? Then you wouldn't have to run away from yourself anymore. You could stop running. If someone sees you as something worth staying with— maybe you'll stay with yourself, too.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.

Author: Frank Serafini
Quote: There is no such thing as a child who hates to read; there are only children who have not found the right book.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: If one makes a mistake, then an apology is usually sufficient to get things back on an even keel. However-and this is a big ‘however’- most people do not ever know why their apology did not seem to have any effect. It is simply that they did not make a mistake; they made a choice…and never understood the difference between the two.

Author: Norman Vincent Peale
Quote: What the mind can conceive and believe, and the heart desire, you can achieve.

Author: Brennan Manning,  The Ragamuffin Gospel: Good News for the Bedraggled, Beat-Up, and Burnt Out
Quote: The temptation of the age is to look good without being good.

Author: John Wesley
Quote: Unless God has raised you up for this very thing, you will be worn out by the opposition of men and devils. But if God be for you, who can be against you? Are all of them together stronger than God? O be not weary of well doing!

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: There is really nothing more to say-except why. But since why is difficult to handle, one must take refuge in how.

Author: Sherman Alexie,  Flight
Quote: What kind of life can you have in a house without books?

Author: Philip Pullman,  His Dark Materials
Quote: As for what it's against - the story is against those who pervert and misuse religion, or any other kind of doctrine with a holy book and a priesthood and an apparatus of power that wields unchallengeable authority, in order to dominate and suppress human freedoms.

Author: Amit Ray,  Om Chanting and Meditation
Quote: You are a cosmic flower. Om chanting is the process of opening the psychic petals of that flower.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees:
Quote: I realized it for the first time in my life: there is nothing but mystery in the world, how it hides behind the fabric of our poor, browbeat days, shining brightly, and we don't even know it.

Author: Patañjali,  The Yoga Sutras of Patanjali
Quote: Undisturbed calmness of mind is attained by cultivating friendliness toward the happy, compassion for the unhappy, delight in the virtuous, and indifference toward the wicked.

Author: Jonathan Swift
Quote: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another.

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: Everything you'll ever need to know is within you; the secrets of the universe are imprinted on the cells of your body.

Author: Rumi
Quote: The ground's generosity takes in our compost and grows beauty! Try to be more like the ground.

Author: Viggo Mortensen
Quote: You don't have to make something that people call art. Living is an artistic activity, there is an art to getting through the day.

Author: Chad Sugg
Quote: Something amazing happens when you're in love and don't give a damn about what day it is anymore.

Author: Agatha Christie,  The Clocks
Quote: To every problem, there is a most simple solution.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: Can't stand all these poisonous creatures, all these snakes and insects and fish and things. Wretched things, biting everybody. And then people expect me to tell them what to do about it. I'll tell them what to do. Don't get bitten in the first place. (quoting Dr. Struan Sutherland)

Author: Les Brown
Quote: you don't have to be great to get started, but you have to get started to be great.

Author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer
Quote: Action springs not from thought, but from a readiness for responsibility.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings
Quote: Somebody has to start. Somebody has to step forward and do what is right, because it is right.

Author: John Waters
Quote: Collect books, even if you don't plan on reading them right away. Nothing is more important than an unread library.

Author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips,  Match Me If You Can
Quote: sometimes knowing when to give up is the real test of character...-annabelle granger

Author: Jimmy Dean
Quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.

Author: Warren Ellis
Quote: I want a tattoo over my heart that reads TRY HARDER YOU LAZY PARAMEDIC SHITBAG OR I WILL HAUNT YOUR BEDROOM FOREVER

Author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam,  Ignited Minds: Unleashing the Power Within India
Quote: For great men, religion is a way of making friends; small people make religion a fighting tool.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Do what you love, think what you feel and live the way you want.

Author: Warren Buffett
Quote: If you’re in the luckiest one per cent of humanity, you owe it to the rest of humanity to think about the other 99 per cent.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: It takes guts to love with gusto. Most people love as if they wish they were invisible, and then they wonder why their affections go unnoticed.

Author: Fred Rogers,  The World According to Mister Rogers: Important Things to Remember
Quote: It's very dramatic when two people come together to work something out. It's easy to take a gun and annihilate your opposition, but what is really exciting to me is to see people with differing views come together and finally respect each other.

Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
Quote: Every person has a right to risk their own life for the preservation of it.

Author: Diana Wynne Jones,  Castle in the Air
Quote: Nobody gets praised for the right reasons.

Author: Salvador Dalí
Quote: The difference between false memories and true ones is thesame as for jewels: it is always the false ones that look themost real, the most brilliant.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
Quote: When you are used to the kind of life -of never getting anything you want- you stop knowing what it is you want.

Author: Miley Cyrus
Quote: People are always telling me that i'm not like other girls...that i dont dress like other girls...that i dont act like other girls. But i'm my OWN person...i go to the beat of my own drum.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Live simply so that others may simply live.

Author: Karen Horney,  Neurosis and Human Growth: The Struggle Towards Self-Realization
Quote: If you want to be proud of yourself, then do things in which you can take pride

Author: Claudia Gray
Quote: Everyone is lonely, we have to remember that life is to be lived one day at a time. You cannot worry about the past or future. Happiness is in the now.

Author: Jonathan Larson,  Rent: The Complete Book and Lyrics of the Broadway Musical
Quote: The heart may freeze, or it can burn. The pain will ease and I can learn. There is no future, there is no past. I live this moment as, my last.

Author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Haunted
Quote: Yes, terrible things happen, but sometimes those terrible things- they save you.

Author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code
Quote: Forgiveness is God's greatest gift

Author: Richard Dawkins,  The Selfish Gene
Quote: Let us try to teach generosity and altruism, because we are born selfish. Let us understand what our own selfish genes are up to, because we may then at least have the chance to upset their designs, something that no other species has ever aspired to do.

Author: Dee Lestari
Quote: kenangan itu cuma hantu di sudut pikir. selama kita diam dan ngga berbuat apa-apa, selamanya dia tetap jadi hantu, ngga akan pernah jadi kenyataan.

Author: Alice Sebold,  The Lovely Bones
Quote: Heaven is comfort, but it's still not living.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings
Quote: We follow the codes not because they bring gain, but because we loathe the people we would otherwise become.

Author: John Paul Warren
Quote: Faith moves mountains, love transforms hearts.

Author: P.L. Deshpande
Quote: आयुष्यात मला भावलेलं एक गुज सांगतो. उपजिविकेसाठीआवश्यक असणाऱ्या विषयाचं शिक्षण जरुर घ्या. पोटापाण्याचा उद्योग जिद्दीनं करा, पण एवढ्यावरच थांबू नका. साहित्य, चित्र, संगीत, नाट्य, शिल्प, खेळ ह्यांतल्या एखाद्या तरी कलेशी मैत्री जमवा. पोटापाण्याचा उद्योग तुम्हाला जगवील, पण कलेशी जमलेली मैत्री तुम्ही का जगायचं हे सांगून जाईल.- पु. ल.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Never compromise your values.

Author: Will Smith
Quote: We spend money that we do not have, on things we do not need, to impress people who do not care.

Author: Oswald Chambers
Quote: We have to pray with our eyes on God, not on the difficulties.

Author: محمد حسن علوان,  سقف الكفاية
Quote: قد أسعى لمحو أحزاني، و لكني لن اجرؤ على استبدالها بحزنِ مجهول، لن أقامر على طاولة الحياة،وحشة هذا الحزن المجهول أشد علىّ من من حزن قديم أليف.

Author: Darren E. Laws
Quote: If you are still breathing maybe it is not such a bad day after all...

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: I am an optimist... I choose to be. There is a lot of darkness in our world, there is a lot of pain and you can choose to see that or you can choose to see the joy. If you try to respond positively to the world, you will spend your time better.

Author: Sidney Sheldon
Quote: Libraries store the energy that fuels the imagination. They open up windows to the world and inspire us to explore and achieve, and contribute to improving our quality of life. Libraries change lives for the better.

Author: Yvonne Wood,  Dead Beautiful
Quote: ... In love, everyone does things that hurt the other person, so there really is no "Right"and "Wrong". You just have to decide what you're willing to forgive

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: Because I don't live in either my past or my future.I'm interested only in the present".

Author: Fulton J. Sheen
Quote: Unless there is a Good Friday in your life, there can be no Easter Sunday.

Author: Francis of Assisi
Quote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  Why We Can't Wait
Quote: Quietly endure, silently suffer and patiently wait.

Author: Joyce Carol Oates
Quote: A daydreamer is prepared for most things.

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: be it peace or happinesslet it enfold you

Author: Robert E. Lee
Quote: I cannot trust a man to control others who cannot control himself.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: There is force in the universe, which, if we permit it, will flow through us and produce miraculous results.

Author: Christopher Moore,  Island of the Sequined Love Nun
Quote: Boredom can be a lethal thing on a small island.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  A Stroke of Midnight
Quote: No name-calling truly bites deep unless, in some dark part of us, we believe it. If we are confident enough then it is just noise.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to others.

Author: Georgia O'Keeffe
Quote: I have already settled it for myself so flattery and criticism go down the same drain and I am quite free.

Author: Tyra Banks,  Tyra's Beauty Inside & Out
Quote: Love me or hate me I promise that it will never make or break me...<3

Author: Ralph Ellison,  Invisible Man
Quote: I was never more hated than when I tried to be honest. Or when, even as just now I've tried to articulate exactly what I felt to be the truth. No one was satisfied

Author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam,  Wings of Fire: An Autobiography
Quote: Dreams are not those which comes while we are sleeping, but dreams are those when u don't sleep before fulfilling them.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The wise do not buy into other people’s perceptions of who they are and what they are capable of. Instead, they bypass a person’s public persona and see who they are in their highest expression. When you see actions taken with integrity, instead of words only, you will then know a soul’s worth.

Author: Jack Welch
Quote: Control Your Own Destiny or Someone Else Will

Author: P.C. Cast
Quote: Give me strength, not to be better than my enemies, but to defeat my greatest enemy, the doubts within myself. Give me strength for a straight back and clear eyes, so when life fades, as the setting sun, my spirit may come to you without shame.

Author: T. Rafael Cimino,  Table 21
Quote: Most don't deserve your tears... and the ones that do will never make you cry.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Time Enough for Love
Quote: Be wary of strong drink, it can make you shoot at the tax collector...and miss.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Although I am a typical loner in my daily life, my awareness of belonging to the invisible community of those who strive for truth, beauty, and justice has prevented me from feelings of isolation.

Author: Hunter S. Thompson
Quote: Faster, Faster, until the thrill of speed overcomes the fear of death.

Author: John Updike,  Rabbit, Run
Quote: If you have the guts to be yourself, other people'll pay your price.

Author: James Patterson,  Suzanne's Diary for Nicholas
Quote: But what is life if you don't live it?

Author: Max Ehrmann,  Desiderata: A Poem for a Way of Life
Quote: Avoid loud and aggressive persons,they are vexations to the spirit.

Author: Maria Robinson
Quote: Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending.

Author: Carl Sagan
Quote: If it can be destroyed by the truth, it deserves to be destroyed by the truth.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: We may have all come on different ships, but we're in the same boat now.

Author: Jhumpa Lahiri,  The Namesake
Quote: Try to remember it always,"he said once Gogol had reached him, leading him slowly back across the breakwater, to where his mother and Sonia stood waiting. "Remember that you and I made this journey together to a place where there was nowhere left to go.

Author: Eberhard Arnold
Quote: Only those who look with the eyes of children can lose themselves in the object of their wonder.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.

Author: Lady Gaga
Quote: It doesn't matter who you are, or where you come from, or how much money you've got in your pocket. You have your own destiny and your own life ahead of you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Sometimes letting go is simply changing the labels you place on an event. Looking at the same event with fresh eyes.

Author: Will Smith
Quote: Don't chase people. Be yourself, do your own thing and work hard. The right people - the ones who really belong in your life - will come to your. And stay.

Author: Susanna Kaysen,  Girl, Interrupted
Quote: Every window in Alcatraz has a view of San Francisco.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  Finnikin of the Rock
Quote: It’s against the rules of humanity to believe there is nothing we can do.

Author: Ben Carson
Quote: God has given us more than fourteen billion cells and connections in our brain. Why would God give us such a complex organ system unless he expects us to use it?

Author: Melissa Marr,  Ink Exchange
Quote: We are what we are, neither a good or as bad as others paint us. And what we are doesn't change how truly we feel, only how free we are to follow those feelings.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.

Author: William Blake,  The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
Quote: Improvement makes strait roads, but the crooked roads without Improvement, are roads of Genius.

Author: Og Mandino
Quote: Count your blessings. Once you realize how valuable you are and how much you have going for you, the smiles will return, the sun will break out, the music will play, and you will finally be able to move forward the life that God intended for you with grace, strength, courage, and confidence.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: I believe that God is in me as the sun is in the colour and fragrance of a flower - the Light in my darkness, the Voice in my silence.

Author: Ally Carter,  I'd Tell You I Love You, But Then I'd Have to Kill You
Quote: You shouldn't judge someone until you've walk a mile through an underground tunnel in her uncomfortable shoes

Author: Robert H. Schuller
Quote: What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?

Author: Demi Lovato
Quote: As the smoke clears,I awaken,And untangle you from me.Would it make you feel betterTo watch me, while I bleed?All my windows still are broken,But I'm standing on my feet.

Author: عائض القرني
Quote: إن النصر مع الصبر .. وإن الفرج مع الكرب .. وإن مع العسر يسرا

Author: Vince Lombardi
Quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.

Author: Mhairi McFarlane,  You Had Me At Hello
Quote: Do nothing, and nothing happens. Life is about decisions. You either make them or they're made for you, but you can't avoid them.

Author: Joan Erickson
Quote: Vital lives are about action. You can't feel warmth unless you create it, can't feel delight until you play, can't know serendipity unless you risk.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Work is love made visible. And if you can't work with love, but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of the people who work with joy

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: [T]he race is long - to finish first, first you must finish.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.

Author: Patrick Swayze,  The Time of My Life
Quote: When those you love die, the best you can do is honor their spirit for as long as you live. You make a commitment that you're going to take whatever lesson that person or animal was trying to teach you, and you make it true in your own life... it's a positive way to keep their spirit alive in the world, by keeping it alive in yourself.

Author: T.H. White,  The Once and Future King
Quote: Education is experience, and the essence of experience is self-reliance.

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Neglected But Undefeated
Quote: You know my name, not my story. You've heard what I've done, but not what I've been through.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert
Quote: If I am truly to become an autonomous woman, then I must take over that role of being my own guardian...I not only have to become my own husband, but I need to be my own father, too.

Author: Stephen Fry,  Moab Is My Washpot
Quote: It is the useless things that make life worth living and that make life dangerous too: wine, love, art, beauty. Without them life is safe, but not worth bothering with.

Author: Andrea Hirata,  Cinta di Dalam Gelas
Quote: Beri aku sesuatu yang paling sulit, aku akan belajar!

Author: Shannon Hale,  Book of a Thousand Days
Quote: I do like the world quite a lot.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers
Quote: The treacherous are ever distrustful.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: There are many people who can do big things, but there are very few people who will do the small things.

Author: Ted Dekker,  White: The Great Pursuit
Quote: Dive deep. Drown willingly

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: There isa time to liveand a time to diebut never to reject the moment.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Sometimes small things can become very large, indeed.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Happy Prince and Other Tales
Quote: Life is one fool thing after another whereas love is two fool things after each other.

Author: William James,  The Will to Believe and Other Essays in Popular Philosophy
Quote: Be not afraid of life. Believe that life is worth living, and your belief will help create the fact.

Author: Malala Yousafzai,  I Am Malala: The Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Was Shot by the Taliban
Quote: Let us pick up our books and our pens, they are the most powerful weapons."Malala Yousafzai, the schoolgirl who was shot in the head by the Taliban for wanting an education and survived, in her keynote speech to the United Nations, 12th July 2013.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Fear can only grow in darkness. Once you face fear with light, you win.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: When I lost her I gained the future, because she was my past, and she freed me to become who I was born to be.

Author: Annie Dillard
Quote: Spend the afternoon, you can't take it with you.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I believe the way to master my destiny is to serve others. If I raise up others, am I not also raised up?

Author: Richard Feynman,  Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!: Adventures of a Curious Character
Quote: All the time you're saying to yourself, 'I could do that, but I won't,' — which is just another way of saying that you can't.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: Meditation is a way for nourishing and blossoming the divinity within you.

Author: Walt Disney Company
Quote: I only hope that we never lose sight of one thing — that it was all started by a mouse.

Author: Hlovate,  Versus
Quote: You'll never reach perfection because there's always room for improvement. Yet get along the way to perfection, you'll learn to get better.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Differences are not intended to separate, to alienate. We are different precisely in order to realize our need of one another.

Author: Maya Angelou,  I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
Quote: Life is going to give you just what you put in it. Put your whole heart in everything you do, and pray, then you can wait.

Author: Margaret Mead
Quote: There is no greater insight into the future than recognizing...when we save our children, we save ourselves

Author: Pittacus Lore,  The Power of Six
Quote: My experiences have taught me that things rarely improve with a simple change of scenery.

Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.
Quote: It's not whether you got knocked down; it's whether you get back up.

Author: Robert Jordan,  Lord of Chaos
Quote: One more dance along the razor's edge finished. Almost dead yesterday, maybe dead tomorrow, but alive, gloriously alive, today.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore.

Author: Wil Wheaton,  Just a Geek: Unflinchingly honest tales of the search for life, love, and fulfillment beyond the Starship Enterprise
Quote: Sometimes we know in our bones what we really need to do, but we're afraid to do it. Taking a chance and stepping beyond the safety of the world we've always known is the only way to grow, though and without risk there is no reward.

Author: Margaret Thatcher
Quote: It used to be about trying to do something. Now it's about trying to be someone.

Author: Zig Ziglar
Quote: There are no traffic jams on the extra mile.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Your heart is the size of an ocean. Go find yourself in its hidden depths.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You have a unique gift to offer this world. Be true to yourself, be kind to yourself, read and learn about everything that interests you and keep away from people who bring you down. When you treat yourself kindly and respect the uniqueness of those around you, you will be giving this world an amazing gift... YOU!

Author: Les Brown
Quote: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.

Author: Dee Lestari
Quote: Berputar menjadi sesuatu yang bukan kita, demi bisa menjadi diri kita lagi.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: Perfect is the enemy of good.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Anansi Boys
Quote: Let's start a new tomorrow, today.

Author: Shane Claiborne,  The Irresistible Revolution: Living as an Ordinary Radical
Quote: And I think that's what our world is desperately in need of - lovers, people who are building deep, genuine relationships with fellow strugglers along the way, and who actually know the faces of the people behind the issues they are concerned about.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Because if you don't stand up for the stuff you don't like, when they come for the stuff you do like, you've already lost.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: I am not worried, Harry,"said Dumbledore, his voice a little stronger despite the freezing water. "I am with you.

Author: Francis Bacon
Quote: Begin doing what you want to do now. We are not living in eternity. We have only this moment, sparkling like a star in our hand--and melting like a snowflake...

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I don't look for love. Love looks for me.""Why?""Because it needs me. Because I'm not afraid of it.

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I haven't measured it, but I'll bet cat purrs vibrate at a healing frequency. Also, a whispered I love you almost certainly resonates with heart and DNA repair.

Author: Vance Havner
Quote: God uses broken things. It takes broken soil to produce a crop, broken clouds to give rain, broken grain to give bread, broken bread to give strength. It is the broken alabaster box that gives forth perfume. It is Peter, weeping bitterly, who returns to greater power than ever.

Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha
Quote: Of course, a sign doesn't mean anything unless you know how to interpret it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Don’t tell me about your god with your words. Show me about your god with your actions.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
Quote: The road to enlightenment is long and difficult, and you should try not to forget snacks and magazines.

Author: Wendell Berry,  Hannah Coulter
Quote: Love is what carries you, for it is always there, even in the dark, or most in the dark, but shining out at times like gold stitches in a piece of embroidery.

Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki,  Rich Dad, Poor Dad
Quote: You’re only poor if you give up. The most important thing is that you did something. Most people only talk and dream of getting rich. You’ve done something.

Author: L.J. Smith,  The Forbidden Game
Quote: Maybe it just means that love can be stronger than fear.

Author: Gerard Way
Quote: The difference we wanna make is number one to let these kids know that they’re not alone, that they’re actually not that messed up and that they can do whatever they want; they can express themselves however they want, without being persecuted or called a faggot or some kind of racist thing. You know, really just to get people to get over their stuff so they can live.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: Whoever you are, or whatever it is that you do, when you really want something, it's because that desire originated in the soul of the universe. It's your mission on earth.

Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.
Quote: The dictionary is the only place that success comes before work. work is the key to success, and hard work can help you accomplish anything.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: If you swim effortlessly in the deep oceans, ride the waves to and from the shore, if you can breathe under water and dine on the deep treasures of the seas; mark my words, those who dwell on the rocks carrying nets will try to reel you into their catch. The last thing they want is for you to thrive in your habitat because they stand in their atmosphere where they beg and gasp for some air.

Author: Judith Orloff
Quote: How you react emotionally is a choice in any situation.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: There are not enough days in forever to allow me to fully express the depth of my love for you.

Author: Francine Rivers,  A Voice in the Wind
Quote: Stand firm in the Lord. Stand firm and let Him fight your battle. Do not try to fight alone.

Author: مكاوي سعيد,  تغريدة البجعة
Quote: وابتعدت.. دون أن أفسـّر حتى لنفسى أسباب هذا الهروب !

Author: bell hooks
Quote: feminism is for everybody

Author: Gayle Forman,  Just One Day
Quote: But what if Shakespeare― and Hamlet― were asking the wrong question? What if the real question is not whether to be, but how to be?

Author: Michael Pollan,  The Omnivore's Dilemma: A Natural History of Four Meals
Quote: The single greatest lesson the garden teaches is that our relationship to the planet need not be zero-sum, and that as long as the sun still shines and people still can plan and plant, think and do, we can, if we bother to try, find ways to provide for ourselves without diminishing the world.

Author: Patricia Briggs,  When Demons Walk
Quote: When life doesn't meet your expectations, it was important to take it with grace.

Author: Meister Eckhart
Quote: Spirituality is not to be learned by flight from the world, or by running away from things, or by turning solitary and going apart from the world. Rather, we must learn an inner solitude wherever or with whomsoever we may be. We must learn to penetrate things and find God there.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: A young outcast will often feel that there is something wrong with himself, but as he gets older, grows more confident in who he is, he will adapt, he will begin to feel that there is something wrong with everyone else.

Author: Hanh Nhat Thich,  Peace Is Every Step: The Path of Mindfulness in Everyday Life
Quote: Peace is present right here and now, in ourselves and in everything we do and see. Every breath we take, every step we take, can be filled with peace, joy, and serenity. The question is whether or not we are in touch with it. We need only to be awake, alive in the present moment.

Author: Karl Marx
Quote: Go on, get out! Last words are for fools who haven't said enough!

Author: Ellen Hopkins
Quote: Can a dream be wrong? Aren't dreams God's way of telling you things?

Author: Wendelin Van Draanen,  Flipped
Quote: Sometimes a little discomfort in the beginning can save a whole lot of pain down the road.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Small is the number of them that see with their own eyes and feel with their own hearts.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Two Towers
Quote: There are some things that it is better to begin than to refuse, even though the end may be dark.

Author: جبران خليل جبران
Quote: إذا كنت لاترى إلا مايظهره النور، ولاتسمع إلا ماتعلنه الأصوات فأنت بالحقيقة لاترى ولاتسمع٠

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: If you walk on sunlight, bathe in moonlight, breathe in a golden air and exhale a Midas' touch; mark my words, those who exist in the shadows will try to pull you into the darkness with them. The last thing that they want is for you to see the wonder of your life because they can't see theirs.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.

Author: Ed Sheeran
Quote: Be a true Heart, not a follower.

Author: Augustine of Hippo,  Homilies on the First Epistle of John
Quote: Once for all, then, a short precept is given thee: Love, and do what thou wilt: whether thou hold thy peace, through love hold thy peace; whether thou cry out, through love cry out; whether thou correct, through love correct; whether thou spare, through love do thou spare: let the root of love be within, of this root can nothing spring but what is good.

Author: Isabelle Eberhardt,  The Nomad: The Diaries of Isabelle Eberhardt
Quote: For those who know the value of and exquisite taste of solitary freedom (for one is only free when alone), the act of leaving is the bravest and most beautiful of all.

Author: Flavia Weedn
Quote: Some people come into our lives and quickly go. Some people move our souls to dance. They awaken us to a new understanding with the passing whisper of their wisdom. Some people make the sky more beautiful to gaze upon. They stay in our lives for awhile, leave footprints on our hearts, and we are never, ever the same.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Yesterday I was sad, today I am happy! Yesterday I had a problem, today I still have the same problem! But today I changed the way I look at it!

Author: L.R. Knost,  Two Thousand Kisses a Day: Gentle Parenting Through the Ages and Stages
Quote: It's not our job to toughen our children up to face a cruel and heartless world. It's our job to raise children who will make the world a little less cruel and heartless.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: No matter what your history has been, your destiny is what you create today. What are you going to create?

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You stopped validating your victim mentality? Let today be the day…You shake off your self-defeating drama and embrace your innate ability to recover and achieve.

Author: Tudor Chirilă,  Exerciţii de echilibru
Quote: In definitiv, cu cat vei ridica un zid mai inalt in jurul tau cu atat va fi mai bun cel care-l va sari.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.

Author: Muhammad Ali
Quote: You lose nothing when fighting for a cause ... In my mind the losers are those who don't have a cause they care about.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: Christ is not valued at all, unless he is valued above all.

Author: Fanny J. Crosby
Quote: God will answer you prayers better than you think. Of course, one will not always get exactly what he has asked for....We all have sorrows and disappointments, but one must never forget that, if commended to God, they will issue in good....His own solution is far better than any we could conceive.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Horse and His Boy
Quote: Onward and Upward! To Narnia and the North!

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Happiness depends more on the inward disposition of mind than on outward circumstances.

Author: Georgia O'Keeffe,  Georgia O'Keeffe
Quote: Nobody sees a flower - really - it is so small it takes time - we haven't time - and to see takes time, like to have a friend takes time.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The only thing that will ever make me fall in love is: if I fall in love.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi
Quote: Life is at its best when everything has fallen out of place, and you decide that you're going to fight to get them right, not when everything is going your way and everyone is praising you.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: A lot of the conflict you have in your life exists simply because you're not living in alignment; you're not be being true to yourself.

Author: Harry S. Truman
Quote: I never did give them hell. I just told the truth, and they thought it was hell.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Do not yearn to be popular; be exquisite. Do not desire to be famous; be loved. Do not take pride in being expected; be palpable, unmistakable.

Author: Alan Moore,  Watchmen
Quote: Nite Owl II: But the country's disintegrating. What's happened to America? What's happened to the American dream?The Comedian: It came true. You're lookin' at it.

Author: Mitch Albom,  For One More Day
Quote: It’s funny. I met a man once who did a lot of mountain climbing. I asked him which was harder, ascending or descending? He said without a doubt descending, because ascending you were so focused on reaching the top, you avoided mistakes.The backside of a mountain is a fight against human nature,” he said. “You have to care as much about yourself on the way down as you did on the way up.

Author: Pope John Paul II
Quote: Do not be afraid. Do not be satisfied with mediocrity. Put out into the deep and let down your nets for a catch.

Author: Justin Cronin,  The Summer Guest
Quote: Real courage is doing the right thing when nobody's looking. Doing the unpopular thing because it's what you believe, and the heck with everybody.

Author: Albert Schweitzer
Quote: In everyone’s life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Men are born to succeed, not to fail.

Author: Swami Sivananda
Quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.

Author: Jeffrey McDaniel
Quote: There's two kinds of women--those you write poems about and those you don't.

Author: Bernard M. Baruch
Quote: Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: Until justice rolls down like water and righteousness like a mighty stream.

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: Let us never negotiate out of fear. But let us never fear to negotiate.[Inaugural Address, January 20 1961]

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Dreamland
Quote: Rogerson,"I asked him sweetly as we sat watching a video in the pool house, "where would I find the pelagic zone?""In the open sea,"he said. "Now shut up and eat your Junior Mints.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: You are doing the best you can, and that best results in good to yourself and to others. Do not nag yourself with a sense of failure. Get on your knees and ask for the blessings of the Lord;then stand on your feet and do what you are asked to do.

Author: Jane Evershed
Quote: To read is to empower,To empower is to write,To write is to influence,To influence is to change,To change is to live".

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Love has no limitations. It cannot be measured. It has no boundaries. Although many have tried, love is indefinable.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: The past has no power to stop youfrom being present now.Only your grievance aboutthe past can do that.What is grievance?The baggage of oldthought and emotion.

Author: Jack Layton
Quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.

Author: Robert Bloch
Quote: Friendship is like peeing on yourself: everyone can see it, but only you get the warm feeling that it brings.

Author: Mary Anne Radmacher
Quote: stand often in the company of dreamers: they tickle your common sense & believe you can achieve things which are impossible.

Author: James Patterson
Quote: It's been said that love finds you when you're ready.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: It's nice to have things to look forward to.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: Live life as though nobody is watching, and express yourself as though everyone is listening.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Four things to learn in life: To think clearly without hurry or confusion; To love everybody sincerely; To act in everything with the highest motives; To trust God unhesitatingly.

Author: Stephen King
Quote: If you don’t have the time to do something right, where are you going to find the time to fix it?

Author: Jeanne d'Arc
Quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.

Author: Yehuda Bauer
Quote: Thou shalt not be a victim, thou shalt not be a perpetrator, but, above all, thou shalt not be a bystander.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The victim mindset dilutes the human potential. By not accepting personal responsibility for our circumstances, we greatly reduce our power to change them.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.

Author: Allan Rufus
Quote: Your inner strength is your outer foundation

Author: Karl A. Menninger
Quote: Love cures people, both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: You are never alone. You are eternally connected with everyone.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: People will always have opinions about your decision because they're not courageous enough to take action on their opinion.

Author: Mia Hamm
Quote: Many people say I'm the best women's soccer player in the world. I don't think so. And because of that, someday I just might be.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Coraline
Quote: Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names.

Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Quote: There is only one day left, always starting over: It is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.

Author: Amit Ray,  World Peace: The Voice of a Mountain Bird
Quote: A bird is safe in its nest - but that is not what its wings are made for.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.

Author: Karen Kingsbury,  Forever
Quote: Real love never fails.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: When people see some things as beautiful,other things become ugly.When people see some things as good,other things become bad.

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Leader Who Had No Title: A Modern Fable on Real Success in Business and in
Quote: What the society thinks is of no interest to me. All that's important is how I see myself. I know who who I am. I know the value of my work.

Author: Jodi Picoult
Quote: Love was that way. You could not render it in black or white. It always came down to the strange, blended shades of grey.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: Don't try to steer the boat. Don't open shop for yourself. Listen. Keep silent. You are not God's mouthpiece. Try to be an ear, And if you do speak, ask for explanations.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Criticism - however valid or intellectually engaging - tends to get in the way of a writer who has anything personal to say. A tightrope walker may require practice, but if he starts a theory of equilibrium he will lose grace (and probably fall off).

Author: Alice Hoffman,  Practical Magic
Quote: Pride is a funny thing; it can make what is truly worthless appear to be a treasure.

Author: George Bernard Shaw
Quote: Life is no brief candle to me. It is a sort of splendid torch which I have got a hold of for the moment, and I want to make it burn as brightly as possible before handing it on to future generations.

Author: Laurie Halse Anderson,  Wintergirls
Quote: Why are you being so mean?""Friends tell friends the truth.""yeah, but not to hurt, to help.

Author: Dolly Parton
Quote: Storms make trees take deeper roots.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: The cause of most of man's unhappiness is sacrificing what he wants most for what he wants now.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
Quote: Hang in there. It is astonishing how short a time it can take for very wonderful things to happen.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: The shell must break before the bird can fly.

Author: Garth Stein,  The Art of Racing in the Rain
Quote: To separate oneself from the burden, the angst, the anguish that we all encounter everyday. To say I am alive, I am wonderful, I am. I am. That is something to aspire to.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  The Magician's Nephew
Quote: You know me better than you think, you know, and you shall know me better yet.

Author: Soe Hok Gie,  Catatan Seorang Demonstran
Quote: Bagiku ada sesuatu yang paling berharga dan hakiki dalam kehidupan: 'dapat mencintai, dapat iba hati, dapat merasai kedukaan'. Tanpa itu semua maka kita tidak lebih dari benda. Berbahagialah orang yang masih mempunyai rasa cinta, yang belum sampai kehilangan benda yang paling bernilai itu. Kalau kita telah kehilangan itu maka absurdlah hidup kita

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Strange is our situation here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit, not knowing why, yet sometimes seeming to divine a purpose. From the standpoint of daily life, however, there is one thing we do know: that man is here for the sake of other men - above all for those upon whose smiles and well-being our own happiness depends.

Author: Bill Bryson,  A Short History of Nearly Everything
Quote: When the poet Paul Valery once asked Albert Einstein if he kept a notebook to record his ideas, Einstein looked at him with mild but genuine surprise. "Oh, that's not necessary,"he replied . "It's so seldom I have one.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Live authentically. Why would you continue to compromise something that's beautiful to create something that is fake?

Author: Ben Carson
Quote: If you hear how wonderful you are often enough, you begin to believe it, no matter how you try to resist it.

Author: Shannon Hale
Quote: What she had long believed was not true, and now the world was wide open to discover what was.It is like all my life I thought the sky was green.

Author: Alex Harris
Quote: We're called to be faithful, to take those first difficult steps--and to leave the results up to God.

Author: Patrick Ness,  The Rest of Us Just Live Here
Quote: Not everyone has to be the Chosen One. Not everyone has to be the guy who saves the world. Most people just have to live their lives the best they can, doing things that are great for them, having great friends, trying to make their lives better, loving people properly. All the while knowing that the world makes no sense but trying to find a way to be happy anyway.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Tomorrow is a new day; begin it well and serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense.

Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women Book Two Book: Good Wives
Quote: Love is the only thing that we can carry with us when we go, and it makes the end so easy.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
