Quote: We're miserable because we think that we are mere individuals, alone with our fears and flaws and resentment and mortality.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: The ‘Muse’ is not an artistic mystery, but a mathematical equation. The gift are those ideas you think of as you drift to sleep. The giver is that one you think of when you first awake.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.

Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon
Quote: A child may not know how to feed itself, or what to eat, yet it knows hunger.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison, was the miracle.

Author: Ahmad Fuadi
Quote: Man jadda wajadaSiapa yang bersungguh - sungguh, akan berhasil

Author: Charlie Chaplin
Quote: In the end, everything is a gag.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Before I Fall
Quote: And it's the funniest thing: as soon as I see it, the whistling in my ears stops and the feeling of terror drains away, and I realize this whole time I haven't been falling at all. I've been floating.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: I will be generous with my love today. I will sprinkle compliments and uplifting words everywhere I go. I will do this knowing that my words are like seeds and when they fall on fertile soil, a reflection of those seeds will grow into something greater.

Author: Benjamin Franklin,  Memoirs of the Life and Writings of Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Were I a Roman Catholic, perhaps I should on this occasion vow to build a chapel to some saint, but as I am not, if I were to vow at all, it should be to build a light-house.[Letter to his wife, 17 July 1757, after narrowly avoiding a shipwreck; often misquoted as "Lighthouses are more helpful than churches."]

Author: Joseph Conrad
Quote: The question is not how to get cured, but how to live.

Author: Lauren Oliver,  Panic
Quote: It was so strange, the way that life moved forward: the twists and the dead ends, the sudden opportunities. She supposed if you could predict or foresee everything that was going to happen, you’d lose the motivation to go through it all. The promise was always in the possibility.

Author: Barack Obama
Quote: What I’ve realized is that life doesn’t count for much unless you’re willing to do your small part to leave our children — all of our children — a better world. Any fool can have a child. That doesn’t make you a father. It’s the courage to raise a child that makes you a father.

Author: Eckhart Tolle,  A New Earth: Awakening to Your Life's Purpose
Quote: Man made God in his own image...

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: You are beautiful. Know this. Anyone who tells you otherwise is simply lying. You are beautiful.

Author: علي بن أبي طالب
Quote: Be like the flower that gives its fragrance to even the hand that crushes it.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: In my deepest wound I saw your glory, and it dazzled me.

Author: Ken Kesey,  One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Quote: The stars up close to the moon were pale; they got brighter and braver the farther they got out of the circle of light ruled by the giant moon

Author: Norman Vincent Peale
Quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: You can't just wish change; you have to live the change in order for it to become a reality.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: To be heroic is to be courageous enough to die for something; to be inspirational is to be crazy enough to live a little.

Author: Warren Ellis
Quote: Dance like you're stamping on a human face forever, love like you've been in a serious car crash that minced the front of your brain, stab like no one can arrest you, and live like there's no such thing as God.

Author: Anthony Horowitz,  Stormbreaker
Quote: Believe me, It would be better if we didn't meet again. Go back to school. Go back to your life. And next time they ask you, say no. Killing is for grown-ups and you're still a child.

Author: Robin Jones Gunn,  Surprise Endings
Quote: If you feel far from God, guess who moved?

Author: Kelly Cutrone,  If You Have to Cry, Go Outside: And Other Things Your Mother Never Told You
Quote: Things will change: you won't feel this way forever. And anyway, sometimes the hardest lessons to learn are the ones your soul needs most.

Author: Jon Krakauer,  Into the Wild
Quote: I understood what he was doing, that he had spent four years fulfilling the absurd and tedious duty of graduating from college and now he was emancipated from that world of abstraction, false security, parents, and material excess.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: We all have same beginning (BIRTH), and we will have same ending (DEATH). So how different can we be?

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Every beginning has an end and every end is a new beginning.

Author: Zoë Marriott,  The Swan Kingdom
Quote: To ugly ducklings everywhere,Don't worry about those fluffy yellow morons:They'll never get to be swans

Author: Libba Bray,  The Sweet Far Thing
Quote: But the past cannot be changed, and we carry our choices with us, forward, into the unknown. We can only move on.

Author: Christopher Brennan
Quote: Were knowledge all, what were our needTo thrill and faint and sweetly bleed?

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Stop giving your life away to other people.

Author: Terry Goodkind,  Stone of Tears
Quote: We all can be only who we are, no more, no less.

Author: John Milton,  Paradise Regained
Quote: Yet he who reigns within himself, and rulesPassions, desires, and fears, is more a king.

Author: Elvis Presley,  Elvis: Ultimate Gospel
Quote: When things go bad, don't go with them.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Don’t worry if people think you’re crazy. You are crazy. You have that kind of intoxicating insanity that lets other people dream outside of the lines and become who they’re destined to be.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Eragon
Quote: Consider non your superior, whatever their rank or station in life. Treat all fairly or they will seek revenge. Be careful with your money. Hold fast to your belief and others will listen."he continued at a slower pace, "of the affairs of love ... my only advice is to be honest. thats your most powerfull too to unlock a heart or gain forgiveness. that is all i have to say"Garrow to Roran p 64

Author: Werner Herzog
Quote: Do you not then hear this horrible scream all around you that people usually call silence.

Author: Thomas Wolfe
Quote: You can't go home again

Author: Lemony Snicket,  The Austere Academy
Quote: Friends can make you feel that the world is smaller and less sneaky than it really is, because you know people who have similar experiences.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Aleph
Quote: God only allows us to see such things when he wants something to change

Author: Buddha
Quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: For some people, “the point of no return” begins at the very moment their souls become aware of each others’ existence.

Author: Marilyn Suttle
Quote: Truth builds trust.

Author: Dan Sofer,  A Love and Beyond
Quote: God helps those who strut their stuff.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Public opinion is a weak tyrant compared with our own private opinion. what a man thinks of himself, that it is which determines, or rather indicates, his fate.

Author: Booker T. Washington
Quote: Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than to be in bad company

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Your life is a print-out of your thoughts.

Author: Augustine of Hippo
Quote: Understanding is the reward of faith. Therefore, seek not to understand that you may believe, but believe that you may understand.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: All paradises, all utopias are designed by who is not there, by the people who are not allowed in.[Conversation with Elizabeth Farnsworth, PBS NewsHour, March 9, 1998]

Author: Charles Bukowski
Quote: When I begin to doubt my ability to work the word, I simply read another writer and know I have nothing to worry about. My contest is only with myself, to do it right, with power, and force, and delight, and gamble.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  The Rime of the Ancient Mariner
Quote: Day after day, day after day,We stuck, nor breath nor motion;As idle as a painted shipUpon a painted ocean.

Author: Geoffrey M. Gluckman
Quote: Feel your emotions,Live true your passions,Keep still your mind.

Author: Jhumpa Lahiri,  The Namesake
Quote: Pet names are a persistant remnant of childhood, a reminder that life is not always so serious, so formal, so complicated. They are a reminder, too, that one is not all things to all people.

Author: Kate Forsyth,  The Witches of Eileanan
Quote: May my heart be kind, my mind fierce, and my spirit brave.

Author: Yogi Berra,  The Yogi Book : I Really Didn't Say Everything I Said
Quote: 90% of the game is half mental.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
Quote: Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also

Author: Swami Vivekananda
Quote: Anything that makes weak - physically, intellectually and spiritually, reject it as poison.

Author: Jim Elliot
Quote: Forgive me for being so ordinary while claiming to know so extraordinary a God.

Author: Julia Quinn,  Minx
Quote: You don't always have to kiss a lot of frogs to recognize a prince when you find one -Henrietta Barett

Author: Paulo Coelho,  By the River Piedra I Sat Down and Wept
Quote: Go and get your things,' he said. 'Dreams mean work.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: It does not matter how long you live, but how well you do it.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Life consists of what man is thinking about all day.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Are you going to allow the world around you to change while you remain stagnant? Make this the time you throw away old habits that have hindered your happiness and success and finally allow your greatest self to flourish.

Author: George S. Patton Jr.
Quote: Pressure makes diamonds

Author: Jim Henson
Quote: I don't know exactly where ideas come from, but when I'm working well ideas just appear. I've heard other people say similar things - so it's one of the ways I know there's help and guidance out there. It's just a matter of our figuring out how to receive the ideas or information that are waiting to be heard.

Author: Washington Allston
Quote: Never judge a work of art by its defects

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Have Space Suit—Will Travel
Quote: Some people insist that 'mediocre' is better than 'best.' They delight in clipping wings because they themselves can't fly. They despise brains because they have none.

Author: Og Mandino
Quote: Realize that true happiness lies within you. Waste no time and effort searching for peace and contentment and joy in the world outside. Remember that there is no happiness in having or in getting, but only in giving. Reach out. Share. Smile. Hug. Happiness is a perfume you cannot pour on others without getting a few drops on yourself.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: When I try, I fail. When I trust, He succeeds.

Author: Chris Heimerdinger,  Gadiantons and the Silver Sword
Quote: There are only two forces at work in this world- black and white. Only people are grey.

Author: Avril Lavigne
Quote: You're not aloneTogether we standI'll be by your side, you know I'll take your handWhen it gets coldAnd it feels like the endThere's no place to goYou know I won't give in

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: It occurred to me by intuition, and music was the driving force behind that intuition. My discovery was the result of musical perception.

Author: Kazuo Ishiguro
Quote: It had never occurred to me that our lives, which had been so closely interwoven, could unravel with such speed.

Author: Albert Schweitzer
Quote: At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us.

Author: Robert Greene,  The 48 Laws of Power
Quote: Strike the shepherd and the sheep will scatter

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.

Author: John Steinbeck,  The Grapes of Wrath
Quote: Muscles aching to work, minds aching to create - this is man.

Author: Iimani David
Quote: Love changes things; hope allows us to endure until the change arrives.

Author: Virginia Woolf,  Orlando
Quote: He who robs us of our dreams robs us of our life.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: Wake up, Shake up, Make up and Break up; life is all about moving like ant in search of sugar not sand.

Author: Obert Skye,  Leven Thumps and the Gateway to Foo
Quote: impossible is not a word

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: The purpose of literature is to turn blood into ink.

Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki,  Rich Dad, Poor Dad
Quote: I’d rather welcome change than cling to the past.

Author: Juan Ramón Jiménez
Quote: If they give you ruled paper, write the other way.

Author: Anis Mojgani
Quote: Will it make me something? Will I be something? Am I something? And the answer comes, already am, always was, and I still have time to be

Author: Yana Toboso
Quote: So what? You're another person, so of course you look different. What do you need to be ashamed for?

Author: Henry James
Quote: Obstacles are those frightening things you see when you take you eyes off your goal.

Author: Sandy Nathan,  Stepping Off the Edge: Learning & Living Spiritual Practice
Quote: Your life is your spiritual path.It's what's right in front of you. You can't live anyone else's life. The task is to live yours and stop trying to copy one you think looks better.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: The true miracle lies in our eagerness to allow, appreciate, and honor the uniqueness, and freedom of each sentient being to sing the song of their heart.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Anything that you learn becomes your wealth, a wealth that cannot be taken away from you; whether you learn it in a building called school or in the school of life. To learn something new is a timeless pleasure and a valuable treasure. And not all things that you learn are taught to you, but many things that you learn you realize you have taught yourself.

Author: John Wooden
Quote: Don't let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.

Author: C.S. Lewis,  Prince Caspian
Quote: Aslan: You doubt your value. Don't run from who you are.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.

Author: Miguel Ruiz
Quote: I no longer agree to treat myself with disrespect. Every time a self-critical thought comes to mind, I will forgive the Judge and follow this comment with words of praise, self-acceptance, and love.

Author: Robert Macfarlane,  Mountains of the Mind: A History of a Fascination
Quote: Those who travel to mountain-tops are half in love with themselves, and half in love with oblivion.

Author: Vincent van Gogh
Quote: Only when I fall do I get up again.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: You look at yourself and you accept yourself for who you are, and once you accept yourself for who you are you become a better person.

Author: Christian Baloga
Quote: You say freak, I say unique.

Author: Nelson Mandela,  Long Walk to Freedom: The Autobiograpy of Nelson Mandela with Connections
Quote: Freedom is indivisible; the chains on any one of my people were the chains on all of them, the chains on all of my people were the chains on me.

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Quote: We carry about us the burden of what thousands of people have said and the memories of all our misfortunes. To abandon all that is to be alone, and the mind that is alone is not only innocent but young -- not in time or age, but young, innocent, alive at whatever age -- and only such a mind can see that which is truth and that which is not measurable by words.

Author: Robert Jordan,  The Dragon Reborn
Quote: Death comes to us all; we can only choose how to face it when it comes.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The most adventurous journey to embark on; is the journey to yourself, the most exciting thing to discover; is who you really are, the most treasured pieces that you can find; are all the pieces of you, the most special portrait you can recognize; is the portrait of your soul.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: There is no such thing as a problem without a gift for you in its hands. You seek problems because you need their gifts.

Author: Patti Smith
Quote: I refuse to believe that Hendrix had the last possessed hand,that Joplin had the last drunken throat,that Morrison had the last enlightened mind.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres
Quote: Things will get easier, people's minds will change, and you should be alive to see it.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: There is a road from the eye to the heart that does not go through the intellect.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Loneliness and the feeling of being unwanted is the most terrible poverty.

Author: Anatole France
Quote: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.

Author: Robin S. Sharma
Quote: If your life is worth thinking about,it is worth writing about.

Author: Janet Fitch,  White Oleander
Quote: Don't turn over the rocks if you don't want to see the pale creatures who live under them.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Grace is what picks me up and lifts my wings high above and I fly! Grace always conquers! Be graceful in everything; in anger, in sadness, in joy, in kindness, in unkindness, retain grace with you!

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: You may be the only person left who believes in you, but it's enough. It takes just one star to pierce a universe of darkness. Never give up.

Author: John O'Donohue,  Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
Quote: Inspiration is always a surprising visitor.

Author: Milton Berle
Quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.

Author: Matthew Prior
Quote: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Guilty Pleasures
Quote: It is a very natural human trait to destroy that which frightens us.

Author: Gertrude Stein
Quote: You will write if you will write without thinking of the result in terms of a result, but think of the writing in terms of discovery, which is to say that creation must take place between the pen and the paper, not before in a thought or afterwards in a recasting... It will come if it is there and if you will let it come.

Author: Erin Hunter,  Fire and Ice
Quote: [Fireheart]mewed,"It's not my place to judge you."Greystripe looked up as Fireheart went on."Greystripe, whatever you decide to do, I will always be your friend.

Author: Joshua Hartzell
Quote: Life is difficult for everyone. We all have stress and we all need someone in our lives that we can lean on. Never think that you cannot talk to someone because they have problems to or that your friend or loved one would be better off without you or your problems. You'll soon find out that they need you just as much as you need them.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story
Quote: So, have we solved the secret of happiness?"I believe so,"he saidAre you going to tell me?"Yes.Ready?"Ready."Be satisfied."That's it?"Be greatful."That's it?"For what you have.For the love you receive.And for what God has given you."That's it?He looked me in the eye.Then he sighed deeply."That's it.

Author: Charles F. Glassman,  Brain Drain The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life
Quote: Before you find your soul mate, you must first discover your soul.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: I don't regret my painful times, i bare my scars as if they were medals. I know that freedom has a high price, as high as that of slavery; the only difference is that you pay with pleasure and a smile, even when that that smile dimmed by tears

Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
Quote: Life consists of two days, one for you one against you. So when it's for you don't be proud or reckless, and when it's against you be patient, for both days are test for you.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Macbeth
Quote: Out, out brief candle, life is but a walking shadow...a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.

Author: David Rossi
Quote: Scars show us where we have been, they do not dictate where we are going.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Don't go on discussing what a good person should be. Just be one.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Hero of Ages
Quote: Somehow, we'll find it. The balance between whom we wish to be and whom we need to be. But for now, we simply have to be satisfied with who we are.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  Quintana of Charyn
Quote: What if she's all I give you in this life of ours, my love?"she asked quietly. "Then I'll shout at the goddess in fury,"he said fiercely. "I'll beg to know why I've been given so much when other men have so little.

Author: John Cage
Quote: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.

Author: Robert M. Drake
Quote: A tamed woman will never leave her mark in the world.

Author: Robert Browning
Quote: My sun sets to rise again.

Author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,  No Mercy
Quote: You can take my life, but you'll never break me. So bring me your worst...And I will definitely give you mine.

Author: Nikola Tesla
Quote: Life is and will ever remain an equation incapable of solution, but it contains certain known factors.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Life is like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: Life did not stop, and one had to live.

Author: Banana Yoshimoto,  NP
Quote: Everything that had happened was shockingly beautiful, enough to make you crazy.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: It is one of the beautiful compensations of life that no man can sincerely try to help another without helping himself.

Author: Tan Malaka
Quote: Idealisme adalah kemewahan terakhir yang hanya dimiliki oleh pemuda.

Author: Miguel de Unamuno
Quote: Only he who attempts the absurd is capable of achieving the impossible.

Author: Friedrich Schiller,  Fiesco; or, the Genoese Conspiracy
Quote: To save all we must risk all.

Author: Colette
Quote: What a wonderful life I’ve had! I only wish I’d realized it sooner.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You pretended those around you were deaf to your words? Let today be the day…You let your actions speak and communicate your feelings and intentions.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: In this country we have no place for hyphenated Americans.

Author: Andrea Hirata,  Sang Pemimpi
Quote: Pesimistik tidak lebih daripada sikap takbur mendahului nasib.

Author: Melissa de la Cruz,  Blue Bloods
Quote: But there's always a first time for everything

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: God is whispering in your heart, in the whole existence, just tune your ears.

Author: Kirk Cameron
Quote: There is nothing more important than your eternal salvation.

Author: Simone de Beauvoir
Quote: It is in the knowledge of the genuine conditions of our lives that we must draw our strength to live and our reasons for living.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: A child fish asks mother fish, 'Mother, why cannot we live on the Earth?' Mother fish replied, 'Dear… it is not the place for fish, it is the place for selfish

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I want to be the best version of myself for anyone who is going to someday walk into my life and need someone to love them beyond reason.

Author: Aristotle Onassis
Quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

Author: John Eldredge,  Captivating: Unveiling the Mystery of a Woman's Soul
Quote: We think you'll find that every woman in her heart of hearts longs for three things: to be romanced, to play an irreplaceable role in a great adventure, and to unveil beauty. That's what makes a woman come alive.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  The Portable Atheist: Essential Readings for the Nonbeliever
Quote: I have met some highly intelligent believers, but history has no record to say that [s]he knew or understood the mind of god. Yet this is precisely the qualification which the godly must claim—so modestly and so humbly—to possess. It is time to withdraw our 'respect' from such fantastic claims, all of them aimed at the exertion of power over other humans in the real and material world.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  Strength to Love
Quote: One day we will learn that the heart can never be totally right when the head is totally wrong

Author: Francesca Lia Block,  Violet & Claire
Quote: This was not a fearie tale. This was not the movies. This was life. It hurt more. It was excruciating. It was excruciatingly beautiful.

Author: Jordan Belfort,  The Wolf of Wall Street
Quote: Act as if! Act as if you're a wealthy man, rich already, and then you'll surely become rich. Act as if you have unmatched confidence and then people will surely have confidence in you. Act as if you have unmatched experience and then people will follow your advice. And act as if you are already a tremendous success, and as sure as I stand here today - you will become successful.

Author: Steve Harvey,  Act Like a Lady, Think Like a Man: What Men Really Think About Love, Relationships, Intimacy, and Commitment
Quote: Do not ignore you gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute BEST with the LEAST amount of effort."~Steve Harvey

Author: Michael Cunningham,  The Hours
Quote: Dead, we are revealed in our true dimensions, and they are surprisingly modest.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: When you are living the best version of yourself, you inspire others to live the best versions of themselves.

Author: Mark Andrus
Quote: I can tell you I love you as many times as you can stand to hear it, but all it does is remind us that love is not enough. Not even close.

Author: Jimmy Buffett
Quote: I'd rather die while I'm living than live while I'm dead.

Author: Mignon McLaughlin
Quote: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times -- always with the same person.

Author: Lori Wick,  Where the Wild Rose Blooms
Quote: the moment you don't feel like praying, get on your knees. And the moment you don't feel like reading your bible, you'd better get that Book open.

Author: Billie Joe Armstrong
Quote: It's okay to be a loser, it just depends on how good you are at being one.

Author: Edith Pattou,  East
Quote: That's the trouble with loving a wild thing: You're always left watching the door.

Author: John Green,  An Abundance of Katherines
Quote: I just want to do something that matters. Or be something that matters. I just want to matter.

Author: Dawna Markova,  I Will Not Die an Unlived Life: Reclaiming Purpose and Passion
Quote: I will not die an unlived life.I will not live in fearof falling or catching fire.I choose to inhabit my days,to allow my living to open me,to make me less afraid,more accessible;to loosen my heartuntil it becomes a wing, a torch, a promise.I choose to risk my significance,to live so that which came to me as seedgoes to the next as blossom,and that which came to me as blossom,goes on as fruit.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: When I pictured myself, it was always like just an outline in a colouring book, with the inside not yet completed.

Author: Daisaku Ikeda,  The Human Revolution
Quote: A great human revolution in just a single individual will help achieve a change in the destiny of a nation and, further, can even enable a change in the destiny of all humankind.

Author: Indira Gandhi
Quote: You can't shake hands with a clenched fist.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Lost Souls
Quote: It was stupid to hope, she knew. But sometimes hope was all you had.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: I don't regret the painful times; I bare my scars as if they were medals.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: You have to rise above the squabbling and chaos, and keep believing. You have to always keep your goals in mind.” -Hera, goddess of marriage

Author: Josh Groban
Quote: No matter who we are, no matter what our circumstances, our feelings and emotions are universal. And music has always been a great way to make people aware of that connection. It can help you open up a part of yourself and express feelings you didn't know you were feeling. It's risky to let that happen. But it's a risk you have to take-because only then will you find you're not alone.

Author: Connor Franta
Quote: I don’t want anyone to hold back who they are. It’s not okay… it’s not a good thing

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Difficulties increase the nearer we get to the goal.

Author: Alfred Brendel
Quote: The word 'listen' contains the same letters as the word 'silent'.

Author: Jim Elliot
Quote: God always gives his best to those who leave the choice with him

Author: Audrey Hepburn
Quote: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.

Author: عمر طاهر,  الكلاب لا تأكل الشيكولاتة
Quote: إن كان في حياتك تمّة شئٌ يستحقُ التأجيل ... فليكن التأجيلُ نفسُه

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: I have never felt that anything really mattered but knowing that you stood for the things in which you believed and had done the very best you could.

Author: Swami Vivekananda
Quote: They alone live, who live for others.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Do not fear the thorns in your path, for they draw only corrupt blood.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: Dead yesterdays and unborn tomorrows, why fret about it, if today be sweet.

Author: Sheryl Sandberg,  Lean In: Women, Work, and the Will to Lead
Quote: We cannot change what we are not aware of, and once we are aware, we cannot help but change.

Author: Taylor Swift,  Taylor Swift: Speak Now
Quote: I don't think you should wait. I think you should speak now.

Author: Maya Angelou,  Letter to My Daughter
Quote: Make every effort to change things you do not like. If you cannot make a change, change the way you have been thinking. You might find a new solution.

Author: Mary Anne Radmacher
Quote: living eulogy.she danced.she sang. she took.she gave.she loved.she created.she dissented. she enlivened.she saw. she grew. she sweated.she changed.she learned. she laughed.she shed her skin.she bled on the pages of her days,she walked through walls,she lived with intention.

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
Quote: the purpose of life is the life of purpose

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Veganism is not about giving anything up or losing anything; it is about gaining the peace within yourself that comes from embracing nonviolence and refusing to participate in the exploitation of the vulnerable

Author: William D. Brown
Quote: Failure is an event, never a person.

Author: Henry Ford
Quote: You say I started out with practically nothing, but that isn't correct. We all start with all there is, it's how we use it that makes things possible.

Author: Lillian Hellman
Quote: It's a sad day when you find out that it's not accident or time or fortune, but just yourself that kept things from you.

Author: Byron Katie
Quote: All I have is all I need and all I need is all I have in this moment.

Author: Lou Holtz
Quote: Life is 10 percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: Never give up. It's like breathing—once you quit, your flame dies letting total darkness extinguish every last gasp of hope. You can't do that. You must continue taking in even the shallowest of breaths, continue putting forth even the smallest of efforts to sustain your dreams. Don't ever, ever, ever give up.

Author: Dee Lestari,  Filosofi Kopi: Kumpulan Cerita dan Prosa Satu Dekade
Quote: Walau tak ada yang sempurna, hidup ini indah begini adanya. Filosofi Kopi

Author: Harvey Milk,  The Harvey Milk Interviews: In His Own Words
Quote: All men are created equal. Now matter how hard they try, they can never erase those words. That is what America is about.

Author: Edith Wharton
Quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Change of Heart
Quote: And I remembered something else that makes us human: faith, the only weapon in our arsenal to battle doubt.

Author: John Keats
Quote: Here lies one whose name was writ on water.

Author: Jim Rohn
Quote: Successful people have libraries. The rest have big screen TVs

Author: Amy Harmon,  Making Faces
Quote: I don't think we get answers to every question. We don't get all the whys. But I think when we look back to the end of our lives, if we do the best we can, and we will see that the things we begged God to take from us, the things we cursed him for, the things that made us turn our backs on him, are the things that were the biggest blessings, the biggest opportunities for growth.

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: You only get one life. Live it to the fullest. All your miseries will be forgiven when you will be dead.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: The day is ending. It's time for something that was beautiful to turn into something else that is beautiful. Now, Let go.

Author: Cheryl Lacey Donovan,  The Ministry of Motherhood
Quote: Mother is a verb. It's something you do. Not just who you are.

Author: Kevin Durant
Quote: Hard work beats talent when talent fails to work hard.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: Have love for your inner Self and everything else is done for you.

Author: Ian Somerhalder
Quote: The Futures Bright, Wear Your Sunglasses

Author: Crystal Woods,  Write like no one is reading
Quote: I know I'm not going to be in your head all the time. But once you know me, I'll be forever in your heart.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: We do not need to eat animals, wear animals, or use animals for entertainment purposes, and our only defense of these uses is our pleasure, amusement, and convenience.

Author: Rhonda Byrne
Quote: Life doesn't just happen to you; youreceive everything in your life based on what you've given.

Author: Keisha Keenleyside
Quote: May the fleas of a thousand camels invade the crotch of the person that ruins your day. And may their arms be to short too scratch

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I am not a victim. No matter what I have been through, I'm still here. I have a history of victory.

Author: Kelley Armstrong,  The Gathering
Quote: I want you to have big dreams, big goals. I want you to strive to achieve them. But I don't want to see you beating yourself up every time you make a mistake.

Author: Paramahansa Yogananda,  Where There is Light: Insight and Inspiration for Meeting Life's Challenges
Quote: Making others happy, through kindness of speech and sincerity of right advice, is a sign of true greatness. To hurt another soul by sarcastic words, looks, or suggestions, is despicable.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Quote: Have to? Of course you have to! But only because of you, Harry, won't rest until Voldemort is finished! Think now, for once, if you have never heard of the prophecy! What would you do?

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: I liked things better when I didn't understand them.

Author: Somaly Mam,  The Road of Lost Innocence: The True Story of a Cambodian Heroine
Quote: Sometimes you can learn, even from a bad experience. By coping you become stronger. The pain does not go away, but it becomes manageable.

Author: Erin Hunter,  Into the Wild
Quote: follow your heart! (sppotedleafs motto)

Author: Nikola Tesla,  My Inventions
Quote: We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Never waste any amount of time doing anything important when there is a sunset outside that you should be sitting under!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am not a little bit of many things; but I am the sufficient representation of many things. I am not an incompletion of all these races; but I am a masterpiece of the prolific. I am an entirety, I am not a lack of anything; rather I am a whole of many things. God did not see it needful to make me generic. He thinks I am better than that.

Author: C. JoyBell C.,  The Sun Is Snowing: Poetry & Prose by C. Joybell C
Quote: A clown on a throne is still a clown. A king in rags is still a king.

Author: Clarissa Pinkola Estés
Quote: Tears are a river that takes you somewhere…Tears lift your boat off the rocks, off dry ground, carrying it downriver to someplace better.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The potential of the average person is like a huge ocean unsailed, anew continent unexplored, a world of possibilities waiting to bereleased and channeled toward some great good.

Author: Jocelyn Soriano,  Mend My Broken Heart
Quote: It is our wounds that create in us a desire to reach for miracles. The fulfillment of such miracles depends on whether we let our wounds pull us down or lift us up towards our dreams.

Author: Rob Bell
Quote: Freedom is not having everything we crave, it's being able to go without the things we crave and being OK with it.

Author: Lauryn Hill
Quote: Now don't you understand man universal lawWhat you throw out comes back to you, starNever underestimate those who you scarCause karma, karma, karma comes back to you hard

Author: Oswald Chambers
Quote: Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Her love used to be my lighthouse, and now it feels like I'm treading water in the dark. I’ll bet as soon as I start swimming, the sun will rise and color the sky with the romance of rose.

Author: X. Williamson,  Distract My Hunger
Quote: I could recognise his soul in mine as much as he could find me in his. Our sole existences seemed to have been for this very moment when nothing else mattered.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Your attachment to unhealthy people and bad habits, which offer you no real control, is why you’re spiritually dying and living a life out of balance.

Author: Golda Poretsky
Quote: I think fitting in is highly overrated. I’d rather just fit out... Fitting out means being who you are, even when people insist that you have to change. Fitting out means taking up space, not apologizing for yourself, and not agreeing with those who seek to label you with stereotypes.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: I will take the Ring", he said, "though I do not know the way.

Author: Rita Mae Brown
Quote: A deadline is negative inspiration. Still, it's better than no inspiration at all.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Once your mindset changes, everything on the outside will change along with it.

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: Each man should frame life so that at some future hour fact and his dreaming meet.

Author: Anaïs Nin
Quote: Living never wore one so much as the effort not to live.

Author: Carlos Fuentes
Quote: You start by writing to live. You end by writing so as not to die.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Only when we give joyfully, without hesitation or thought of gain, can we truly know what love means.

Author: Obert Skye,  Leven Thumps and the Gateway to Foo
Quote: there is no moment more precious than the exact moment you are living now

Author: Barry Finlay,  Kilimanjaro and Beyond
Quote: Every mountain top is within reach if you just keep climbing.

Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die
Quote: We make patterns, we share moments. Sometimes, I think I'm the only one to see it.

Author: Winston S. Churchill,  My Early Life, 1874-1904
Quote: You will make all kinds of mistakes; but as long as you are generous and true and also fierce you cannot hurt the world or even seriously distress her. She was meant to be wooed and won by youth.

Author: Elizabeth Gaskell,  North and South
Quote: Loyalty and obedience to wisdom and justice are fine; but it is still finer to defy arbitrary power, unjustly and cruelly used--not on behalf of ourselves, but on behalf of others more helpless.

Author: Louise Philippe
Quote: When darkness is at its darkest, a star shines the brightest.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?

Author: Wendell Berry
Quote: What I stand for is what I stand on.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: In your own life it's important to know how spectacular you are.

Author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars
Quote: Maybe 'Okay' will be our 'always'...

Author: Thomas Merton
Quote: Peace demands the most heroic labor and the most difficult sacrifice. It demands greater heroism than war. It demands greater fidelity to the truth and a much more perfect purity of conscience.

Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
Quote: When the world pushes you to your knees, you're in the perfect position to pray

Author: David Livingstone
Quote: God, send me anywhere, only go with me. Lay any burden on me, only sustain me. And sever any tie in my heart except the tie that binds my heart to Yours.

Author: Stephen King,  The Dark Tower
Quote: He who speaks without an attentive ear is mute.

Author: Zora Neale Hurston
Quote: I have the nerve to walk my own way, however hard, in my search for reality, rather than climb upon the rattling wagon of wishful illusions.

Author: W.C. Fields
Quote: A thing worth having is a thing worth cheating for.

Author: Norman Vincent Peale
Quote: When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy

Author: Roopleen,  Words to inspire the winner in YOU
Quote: The world’s greatest achievers have been those who have always stayed focussed on their goals and have been consistent in their efforts.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: I am not an optimist, but a great believer of hope.

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.

Author: Mo Stegall,  Against All Odds I Can Be: 10 Steps to Revolutionize Your Destiny
Quote: IF YOU DON'T GO AFTER WHAT YOU WANT; YOU COULD SPEND YOUR ENTIRE LIFE SETTLING FOR WHAT YOU CAN GET

Author: Muhammad Ali
Quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Happiness is a state of mind, a choice, a way of living; it is not something to be achieved, it is something to be experienced.

Author: Melina Marchetta,  The Piper's Son
Quote: Don't let anyone take care of you. Can you maybe leave that for me to do? I mean, take care of you? Feel free to take care of me in return... because I think I'll need you to do that.

Author: Moira Young,  Blood Red Road
Quote: Don't give in to fear. Be strong, like i know you are. An never give up, d'you unnerstand, never. No matter what happens.I stare at him.I won't, I says. I ain't no quitter, Pa.That's my girl.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: It is when you lose sight of yourself, that you lose your way. To keep your truth in sight you must keep yourself in sight and the world to you should be a mirror to reflect to you your image; the world should be a mirror that you reflect upon.

Author: Donny Dhirgantoro
Quote: Setiap kamu punya mimpi atau keinginan atau cita-cita,kamu taruh di sini, di depan kening kamujangan menempel, biarkan diaMENGGANTUNG, MENGAMBANG5 cm di depan kening kamujadi dia nggak akan pernah lepas dari mata kamu

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: Read. Read anything. Read the things they say are good for you, and the things they claim are junk. You'll find what you need to find. Just read.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: At every given moment we are absolutely perfect for what is required for our journey.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Fifth Mountain
Quote: Stop thinking about life and choose to live it

Author: William Shakespeare,  Julius Caesar
Quote: His life was gentle; and the elementsSo mixed in him, that Nature might stand upAnd say to all the world, THIS WAS A MAN!

Author: Lauren Graham,  Someday, Someday, Maybe
Quote: I must work harder to achieve my goal of not seeking approval from those whose approval I'm not even sure is important to me.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: How would your life be different if…You didn’t allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the day…You stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.

Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
Quote: Every individual has a place to fill in the world and is important in some respect, whether he chooses to be so or not.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: Sometimes it falls upon a generation to be great, you can be that generation

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  Kidnapped
Quote: There are two things that men should never weary of, goodness and humility; we get none too much of them in this rough world among cold, proud people.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: We are constantly invited to be who we are.

Author: Nate Kenyon,  Sparrow Rock
Quote: Everyone you have ever loved in your life becomes a part of your soul. They never leave. They're always inside you, and you can bring them out whenever you want.

Author: Charles Manson
Quote: Total paranoia is just total awareness.

Author: J.R. Ward,  Lover Unbound
Quote: You would have made a fine warrior, you know that?"I am one. Death is my enemy."Yeah, it is, isn't it."God, it made such sense that he'd bonded with her. She was a fighter… like him. "Your scalpel's your dagger."Yup.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: There is no point in keeping vengeance or stubbornness. These things"-he sighed- "these things I so regret in my life. Pride. Vanity. Why do we do the things we do? Morrie Schwartz

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: Prayer is the mortar that holds our house together.

Author: Robin Williams
Quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: Don't be afraid of the shadows, that only means there's a light nearby.

Author: Miyamoto Musashi,  The Book of Five Rings
Quote: The primary thing when you take a sword in your hands is your intention to cut the enemy, whatever the means. Whenever you parry, hit, spring, strike or touch the enemy's cutting sword, you must cut the enemy in the same movement. It is essential to attain this. If you think only of hitting, springing, striking or touching the enemy, you will not be able actually to cut him.

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Leader Who Had No Title: A Modern Fable on Real Success in Business and in Life
Quote: Sometimes success isn't about making the right decision, it's more about making some decision.

Author: William Penn
Quote: In all debates, let truth be thy aim, not victory, or an unjust interest.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Holding a grudge & harboring anger/resentment is poison to the soul. Get even with people...but not those who have hurt us, forget them, instead get even with those who have helped us.

Author: Colleen Houck
Quote: I want you to learn the lesson of the lotus. This flower springs forth from muddy waters. It raises its delicate petals to the sun and perfumes the world while, at the same time, its roots cling to the elemental muck, the very essence of the mortal experience. Without that soil, the flower would wither and die.

Author: Robert F. Kennedy
Quote: Fear not the path of Truth for the lack of People walking on it.

Author: Chris Cleave,  Little Bee
Quote: I ask you right here please to agree with me that a scar is never ugly. That is what the scar makers want us to think. But you and I, we must make an agreement to defy them. We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, I survived.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: It is this belief in a power larger than myself and other than myself which allows me to venture into the unknown and even the unknowable.

Author: Marilyn Monroe
Quote: They will only care when you're gone.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: The night is just a part of the day

Author: Avi,  The True Confessions of Charlotte Doyle
Quote: A sailor chooses the wind that takes the ship from a safe port. Ah, yes, but once you're abroad, as you have seen, winds have a mind of their own. Be careful, Charlotte, careful of the wind you choose.

Author: Yoko Ono,  Grapefruit: A Book of Instructions and Drawings
Quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  Quote Me Everyday
Quote: By 20, you should be smart. By 30, you should be strong. By 40, you should be rich. By 50, you should be wise. But if you are smart, strong, rich and wise, you don't need any age limits.

Author: Lloyd Alexander,  The Black Cauldron
Quote: Indeed, the more we find to love, the more we add to the measure of our hearts.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: Imagine others complexly.

Author: Greg Kincaid
Quote: No matter how much falls on us, we keep plowing ahead. That's the only way to keep the roads clear.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Don't set your goals by what other people deem important.

Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix,  Among the Hidden
Quote: I want to Live! Not Die, Not Hide, LIVE!

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: All of the great empires of the future will be empires of the mind.

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: Be compassionate ... and take responsibility for each other. If we only learned those lessons, this world would be a better place.

Author: Vince Lombardi Jr.
Quote: I firmly believe that any man's finest hour, the greatest fulfillment of all that he holds dear, is that moment when he has worked his heart out in a good cause and lies exhausted on the field of battle - victorious."

Author: Martin Buber
Quote: The atheist staring from his attic window is often nearer to God than the believer caught up in his own false image of God.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: Reading the Bible will help you get to know the word, but it’s when you put it down and live your life that you get to know the author.

Author: Viktor E. Frankl,  Man's Search for Meaning
Quote: What is demanded of man is not, as some existential philosophers teach, to endure the meaninglessness of life, but rather to bear his incapacity to grasp its unconditional meaningfulness in rational terms.

Author: Karen Blixen
Quote: When you have a great and difficult task, something perhaps almost impossible, if you only work a little at a time, every day a little, suddenly the work will finish itself.

Author: T.S. Eliot
Quote: We had the experience but missed the meaning. And approach to the meaning restores the experience in a different form.

Author: Paul Gauguin
Quote: I shut my eyes in order to see.

Author: Phillip C. McGraw
Quote: Life's managed, not cured.

Author: Chris Colfer,  The Wishing Spell
Quote: Right now, we're living in an ugly chapter of our lives, but books always get better!

Author: Jeaniene Frost,  At Grave's End
Quote: We are not helpless...Many times in our lives we’ve been powerless, but not this night. Right now we have the power to choose the manner in which we die. If you have been a master of nothing else in all your days, you are now a master of this moment. And I for one am going to give such an answer to this insult that others will dearly regret not being by my side to see it!

Author: Corita Kent
Quote: Don't belittle yourself. Be BIG yourself.

Author: Robert Fanney
Quote: In my experience, nothing worthwhile has ever really been all that easy. But it certainly has been worthwhile regardless how difficult it seemed.

Author: Aesop
Quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: This is not the end, this is not even the beginning of the end, this is just perhaps the end of the beginning.

Author: Madeleine Albright,  Madam Secretary: A Memoir
Quote: I was taught to strive not because there were any guarantees of success but because the act of striving is in itself the only way to keep faith with life.

Author: Sylvia Plath
Quote: I wanted change and excitement and to shoot off in all directions myself, like the colored arrows from a Fourth of July rocket.

Author: George S. Patton Jr.
Quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed at some indefinite time in the future.

Author: Santosh Kalwar,  You Can
Quote: It is when things are at worst you will get the best.

Author: Cornelius Elmore Addison,  Tom Thorneval: Dream Merchant Extraordinaire
Quote: What is grander than a country and more valuable than gold? Strength of heart.

Author: Corrie ten Boom
Quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog -- the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: She is delightfully chaotic; a beautiful mess. Loving her is a splendid adventure.

Author: Richard P. Denney
Quote: Books have a way of finding their way into our lives, usually, right when we need them the most.

Author: Colleen Houck
Quote: Don’t allow yourself to become disheartened when the thread doesn’t suit or seems unsightly to you. Wait and watch. Be patient and devoted. As the threads twist and turn, you will begin to understand, and you will see the pattern finally materialize in all its splendor.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Your success and happiness lie in you.

Author: Babe Ruth
Quote: Never allow the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game!

Author: Pablo
Quote: No matter how many people believe or don’t believe in you, you must bethe ultimate believer in yourself!

Author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari: A Fable About Fulfilling Your Dreams & Reaching Your Destiny
Quote: Push yourself to do more and to experience more. Harness your energy to start expanding your dreams. Yes, expand your dreams. Don't accept a life of mediocrity when you hold such infinite potential within the fortress of your mind. Dare to tap into your greatness.

Author: Bob Ong
Quote: Nalaman kong habang lumalaki ka, maraming beses kang madadapa. Bumangon ka man ulit o hindi, magpapatuloy ang buhay, iikot ang mundo, at mauubos ang oras.

Author: Madonna
Quote: I am my own experiment. I am my own work of art.

Author: Joyce Meyer,  Any Minute
Quote: It is impossible to be both selfish and happy

Author: Chuck Palahniuk
Quote: Me with nothing left to lose, plotting my big revenge in the spotlight. Give me violent revenge fantasies as a coping mechanism.

Author: Jerry Spinelli,  Stargirl
Quote: She might be pointing to a doorway, or a person, or the sky. But such things were so common to my eyes, so undistinguished, that they would register as "nothing"I walked in a gray world of nothing.

Author: Gregory Maguire
Quote: Approval is overrated...Approval and disapproval alike satisfy those who deliver it more than those who receive it. I don't care for approval, and I don't mind doing without.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: a dog is not considered a good dog because he is a good barker. a man is not considered a good man because he is a good talker.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: You have been blessed with immeasurable power to make positive changes in your life.

Author: Annie Dillard,  Teaching a Stone to Talk: Expeditions and Encounters
Quote: You do not have to sit outside in the dark. If, however, you want to look at the stars, you will find that darkness is necessary. But the stars neither require nor demand it.

Author: Malala Yousafzai,  I Am Malala: The Girl Who Stood Up for Education and Was Shot by the Taliban
Quote: Let us pick up our books and our pens,” I said. “They are our most powerful weapons. One child, one teacher, one book and one pen can change the world.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: A very small percentage of the people in this world will actually experience and live today. So many people will be stuck on another day, another time that traumatized them and caused them to spiritually stutter so they miss out on this day.

Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
Quote: Woman is a delicate creature with strong emotions who has been created by the Almighty God to shoulder responsibility for educating society and moving toward perfection. God created woman as symbol of His own beauty and to give solace to her partner and her family.

Author: Rashi
Quote: Receive with simplicity everything that happens to you.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I am never alone wherever I am. The air itself supplies me with a century of love. When I breathe in, I am breathing in the laughter, tears, victories, passions, thoughts, memories, existence, joys, moments, and the hues of the sunlight on many tones of skin; I am breathing in the same air that was exhaled by many before me. The air that bore them life. And so how can I ever say that I am alone?

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  The Secret Life of Bees
Quote: Actually, you can be bad at something...but if you love doing it, that will be enough. - August Boatwright

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: Though my work may be menial, though my contribution may be small, I can perform it with dignity and offer it with unselfishness. My talents may not be great, but I can use them to bless the lives of others.... The goodness of the world in which we live is the accumulated goodness of many small and seemingly inconsequential acts.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Life is short. Kiss slowly, laugh insanely, love truly and forgive quickly

Author: Sivananda Saraswati
Quote: This world is your best teacher. There is a lesson in everything. There is a lesson in each experience. Learn it and become wise. Every failure is a stepping stone to success. Every difficulty or disappointment is a trial of your faith. Every unpleasant incident or temptation is a test of your inner strength. Therefore nil desperandum. March forward hero!

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: I prefer you to make mistakes in kindness than work miracles in unkindness.

Author: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints,  The Book of Mormon
Quote: Man is, that he may have Joy.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: The future doesn't belong to the light-hearted. It belongs to the brave.

Author: Jackson Pearce
Quote: Books didn’t make me wallow in darkness, darkness made me wallow in books.

Author: Anne Rice
Quote: I was good and bad, but never wicked.

Author: Gordon B. Hinckley
Quote: The major work of the world is not done by geniuses. It is done by ordinary people, with balance in their lives, who have learned to work in an extraordinary manner.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: Dancing in all its forms cannot be excluded from the curriculum of all noble education; dancing with the feet, with ideas, with words, and, need I add that one must also be able to dance with the pen?

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Every time I thought I was being rejected from something good, I was actually being re-directed to something better.

Author: Andrea Hirata,  Padang Bulan
Quote: Orang-orang itu telah melupakan bahwa belajar tidaklah melulu untuk mengejar dan membuktikan sesuatu, namun belajar itu sendiri, adalah perayaan dan penghargaan pada diri sendiri. (hlm. 197)

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.

Author: Philip Pullman,  Clockwork
Quote: You don't win races by wishing, you win them by running faster than everyone else does.

Author: Marianne Williamson,  A Return to Love: Reflections on the Principles of "A Course in Miracles"
Quote: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?

Author: Thomas Merton,  The Seven Storey Mountain
Quote: Souls are like athletes, that need opponents worthy of them, if they are to be tried and extended and pushed to the full use of their powers, and rewarded according to their capacity.

Author: Cameron Dokey,  Before Midnight: A Retelling of "Cinderella"
Quote: Love so joyfully and freely given can never be taken away. It is never truly gone.

Author: Pete Wentz
Quote: Everyones greatest fantasy is to walk away from the life (they think)you lead

Author: Alan Bradley,  The Weed That Strings the Hangman's Bag
Quote: If you remember nothing else, remember this: Inspiration from outside one's self is like the heat in an oven. It makes passable Bath buns. But inspiration from within is like a volcano: It changes the face of the world.

Author: Scott Lynch,  The Republic of Thieves
Quote: Quit being so hard on yourself. We are what we are; we love what we love. We don't need to justify it to anyone... not even to ourselves.

Author: Noam Chomsky
Quote: Do you train for passing tests or do you train for creative inquiry?

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: Painful as it may be, a significant emotional event can be the catalyst for choosing a direction that serves us - and those around us - more effectively. Look for the learning.

Author: Louis L'Amour,  Sackett's Land
Quote: I would not sit waiting for some vague tomorrow, nor for something to happen. One could wait a lifetime, and find nothing at the end of the waiting. I would begin here, I would make something happen.

Author: Raditya Dika,  The Journeys
Quote: Sesungguhnya, terlalu perhatiannya orangtua kita adalah gangguan terindah yang pernah bisa kita terima

Author: Michael Moorcock,  Elric: The Stealer of Souls
Quote: I think of myself as a bad writer with big ideas, but I'd rather be that than a big writer with bad ideas.

Author: Justina Chen,  North of Beautiful
Quote: When the creative impulse sweeps over you, grab it. You grab it and honor it and use it, because momentum is a rare gift.

Author: Ray A. Davis
Quote: A challenge only becomes an obstacle when you bow to it.

Author: Brenda Ueland
Quote: I learned...that inspiration does not come like a bolt, nor is it kinetic, energetic striving, but it comes into us slowly and quietly and all the time, though we must regularly and every day give it a little chance to start flowing, prime it with a little solitude and idleness.

Author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha
Quote: Watch for the thing that will show itself to you. Because that thing, when you find it, will be your future.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of Green Gables
Quote: I've done my best, and I begin to understand what is meant by 'the joy of strife'. Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: Sometimes the best of gods gift's arrive by the shattering of all the window panes.

Author: J. E. McCulloch
Quote: No other success can compensate for failure in the home.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: You have forgotten the Onewho doesn't care about ownership,who doesn't try to turn a profitfrom every human exchange.

Author: Seno Gumira Ajidarma,  Kitab Omong Kosong
Quote: Seberapa indah mimpi, jika tetap mimpi?

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: The strength of a man isn't seen in the power of his arms. It's seen in the love with which he EMBRACES you.

Author: Percy Bysshe Shelley,  A Defence of Poetry and Other Essays
Quote: A man, to be greatly good, must imagine intensely and comprehensively; he must put himself in the place of another and many others; the pains and pleasures of his species must become his own. The great instrument of moral good is the imagination.

Author: Steve Maraboli
Quote: You've been given the innate power to shape your life...but you cannot just speak change, you have to LIVE change. Intent paired with action builds the bridge to success. You can't just want it; you have to do it, live it...BE it! Success isn't something you have, it's something you DO!

Author: Virgil
Quote: Death twitches my ear;'Live,' he says... 'I'm coming.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: Every moment in life is an act of faith

Author: Casi McLean
Quote: The greatest thing about dreams is they don’t expire. They can lay dormant for years and when you pull them out and dust them off, they shine like new.

Author: Aristophanes
Quote: Open your mind before your mouth

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: All water has a perfect memory and is forever trying to get back to where it was.

Author: Dorianne Laux,  What We Carry
Quote: Maybe it's what we don't say/that saves us.

Author: Loretta Young
Quote: I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Brida
Quote: Do not try to explain feelings. Live everything intensely and treasure what you feel as a gift from God.

Author: Stormie Omartian,  The Power of a Praying Woman
Quote: It's not about finding ways to avoid God's judgment and feeling like a failure if you don't do everything perfectly. It's about fully experiencing God's love and letting it perfect you. It's not about being somebody you are not. It's about becoming who you really are.

Author: Ronald Reagan
Quote: America is too great for small dreams.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Notebook
Quote: The romantics would call this a love story, the cynics would call it a tragedy. In my mind it’s a little bit of both, and no matter how you choose to view it in the end, it does not change the fact that it involves a great deal of my life and the path I’ve chosen to follow.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Do your work, then step back. The only path to serenity.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: Sometimes you just have to jump out the window and grow wings on the way down.

Author: Pat Conroy,  The Lords of Discipline
Quote: I wanted to become the seeker, the aroused and passionate explorer, and it was better to go at it knowing nothing at all, always choosing the unmarked bottle, always choosing your own unproven method, armed with nothing but faith and a belief in astonishment.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Along for the Ride
Quote: It’s the things you fight for and struggle with before earning that have the greatest worth.

Author: Miguel Piñero
Quote: when you're cool for twenty,you get paid for twenty-one.

Author: Bernard M. Baruch
Quote: Never follow the crowd.

Author: Sanaya Roman,  Living with Joy: Keys to Personal Power and Spiritual Transformation
Quote: People who love themselves come across as very loving, generous and kind; they express their self-confidence through humility, forgiveness and inclusiveness.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: The More we value things, the less we value ourselves

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: If there is anything that links the human to the divine, it is the courage to stand by a principle when everybody else rejects it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free
Quote: When you find yourself in need of spiritual nourishment, it is in the opportunities to serve others that you will find the abundance you seek.

Author: Anne Lamott,  Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
Quote: ...most of the time, all you have is the moment, and the imperfect love of the people around you.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The greatest blessing granted to mankind come by way of madness, which is a divine gift.

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
Quote: Today is the oldest you've ever been, and the youngest you'll ever be again.

Author: Adolf Hitler
Quote: If freedom is short of weapons, we must compensate with willpower.

Author: Walter Mosley
Quote: If you want to be a writer, you have to write every day... You don't go to a well once but daily. You don't skip a child's breakfast or forget to wake up in the morning...

Author: Joseph Conrad
Quote: Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: A daily dose of daydreaming heals the heart, soothes the soul, and strengthens the imagination.

Author: Carolyn Crane
Quote: Most people think happiness is about gaining something, but it's not. It's all about getting rid of the darkness you accumulate.

Author: Desiderius Erasmus
Quote: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.

Author: Janette Rallison
Quote: I've pursued dreams and achieved them, but I don't think anybody should think their life is incomplete if they don't follow some dream. Happiness doesn't come from achievements, or money, or any sort of treasure. Happiness is a frame of mind, not a destination. It's appreciating what you've got and building relationships with those around you.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: The point of simple living, for me has got to be:A soft place to landA wide margin of errorRoom to breatheLots of places to find baseline happiness in each and every day

Author: Mitch Albom,  Have a Little Faith: a True Story
Quote: The story of my recent life.' I like that phrase. It makes more sense than 'the story of my life', because we get so many lives between birth and death. A life to be a child. A life to come of age. A life to wander, to settle, to fall in love, to parent, to test our promise, to realize our mortality- and in some lucky cases, to do something after that realization.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: YOU are the big drop of dew under the lotus leaf, I am the smaller one on its upper side,'said the dewdrop to the lake.

Author: Deborah Brodie
Quote: Temptation is not to be feared, but controlled.

Author: Mark Gorman
Quote: Leaders live by choice, not by accident.

Author: Nicholas Sparks,  The Last Song
Quote: I’ve been doing this a long time, and I’ve come to learn that predictions don’t mean much. Too much lies outside the realm of medical knowledge. A lot of what happens next comes down to you and your specific genetics, your attitude. No, there’s nothing we can do to stop the inevitable, but that’s not the point. The point is that you should try to make the most of the time you have left.

Author: Nelson Mandela
Quote: I AM THE MASTER OF MY FATE AND THE CAPTAIN OF MY DESTINY.

Author: R. Kelly
Quote: I belive I can fly, I believe I can touch the sky.

Author: Lady Gaga,  Lady Gaga: The Fame music book
Quote: just remember: i love you, and love yourselves. 'cause, little monsters, you were born that way baby.

Author: Jessica Spotswood,  Born Wicked
Quote: No matter how safe and beautiful it is, a cage is still a cage.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  The Worthing Chronicle
Quote: You’re not a human being until you value something more than the life of your body. And the greater the thing you live and die for the greater you are.

Author: Stephen Chbosky,  The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Quote: I feel infinite.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: And the only way to do great work is to love what you do.... Don't settle

Author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary
Quote: Hash, x. There is no definition for this word - nobody knows what hash is.Famous, adj. Conspicuously miserable.Dictionary, n. A malevolent literary device for cramping the growth of a language and making it hard and inelastic. This dictionary, however, is a most useful work.

Author: Abbie Hoffman
Quote: The only way to support a revolution is to make your own.

Author: Damien Rice
Quote: Inside, I've got a real purist desire and dream about the music. I like the idea of being able to carve out a kind of magical, colourful, artistic, inspirational life. And the reality just turns out to be quite different, working with the business to bring this thing you have created into the world.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The heart sees what the eyes do not, and the heart hears what the ears cannot. Sight and sound are vibrations, and so is love.

Author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett,  Friends 2 Lovers: The Unthinkable
Quote: It's better to have a few faithful friends than numerous shallow friendships.

Author: William Faulkner
Quote: Don't bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.

Author: Karen Blixen
Quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.

Author: David Mitchell,  number9dream
Quote: Dreams are shores where the ocean of spirit meets the land of matter. Dreams are beaches where the yet-to-be, the once-were, the will-never-be may walk awhile with the still are.

Author: Mary Shelley,  Frankenstein
Quote: The fallen angel becomes a malignant devil. Yet even that enemy of God and man had friends and associates in his desolation; I am alone.

Author: Neil Armstrong
Quote: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind

Author: Colum McCann,  Let the Great World Spin
Quote: Good days, they come around the oddest corners.

Author: Harvey Milk,  The Harvey Milk Interviews: In His Own Words
Quote: I know that you cannot live on hope alone, but without it, life is not worth living. And you...And you...And you...Gotta give em hope.

Author: Gregory Peck
Quote: Tough times don't last, tough people do, remember?

Author: Bruce Lee,  Striking Thoughts: Bruce Lee's Wisdom for Daily Living
Quote: The meaning of life is that it is to be lived, and it is not to be traded and conceptualized and squeezed into a patter of systems.

Author: Max DePree,  Leadership Is an Art
Quote: In the end, it is important to remember that we cannot become what we need to be, by remaining what we are.

Author: Stephen Cosgrove,  Buttermilk Bear
Quote: As you walk through forestsor the meadows of your mind,Stop and talk to those you fearGood friendships you may find

Author: Clare Boothe Luce
Quote: Because I am a woman, I must make unusual efforts to succeed. If I fail, no one will say, 'She doesn't have what it takes."~ ' They will say, 'Women don't have what it takes."-

Author: David Levithan,  Six Earlier Days
Quote: Some days are like this. And the only way to get through them is to remember that they are only one day, and that every day ends.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Compassion crowns the soul with its truest victory.

Author: Jhumpa Lahiri,  The Namesake
Quote: Pack a pillow and blanket and see as much of the world as you can.You will not regret it.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.

Author: Laura Lee Guhrke,  Guilty Pleasures
Quote: A woman could be as beautiful as she felt herself to be.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.

Author: Barbara Kingsolver,  The Poisonwood Bible
Quote: Sugar, it's no parade but you'll get down the street one way or another, so you'd just as well throw your shoulders back and pick up the pace.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: This first glance of a soul which does not yet know itself is like dawn in the heavens; it is the awakening of something radiant and unknown.

Author: Jenny Downham,  Before I Die
Quote: I've always wanted to be a cat. Warm and domesticated when you want to be, wild when you don't.

Author: Joanna R. Macy
Quote: If the world is to be healed through human efforts, I am convinced it will be by ordinary people, people whose love for this life is even greater than their fear.

Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of a Young Girl
Quote: In spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart. I simply can't build up my hopes on a foundation consisting of confusion, misery and death.

Author: Sarah Dessen
Quote: Too many locks, not enough keys.

Author: Ernesto Che Guevara,  Che Guevara Speaks
Quote: HASTA LA VICTORIA SIEMPRE

Author: Jean M. Auel
Quote: You learn to write by writing, and by reading and thinking about how writers have created their characters and invented their stories. If you are not a reader, don't even think about being a writer.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: Better to illuminate than merely to shine to deliver to others contemplated truths than merely to contemplate.

Author: Francesca Lia Block
Quote: Stories are like genies...They can carry us into and though our sorrows. Sometimes they burn, sometimes they dance, sometimes they weep, sometimes they sing. Like genies, everyone has one. Like genies, sometimes we forget that we do.Our stories can set us free...When we set them free.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Life itself is simple...it's just not easy.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: What affects one in a major way, affects all in a minor way.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: When someone is trying very hard to get something, they don't. And when they're running away from something as hard as they can, it usually catches up with them.

Author: Sarah Dessen,  Dreamland
Quote: Your mother won a special reward,"she told me, "because everyone had a head in her pictures. We all applauded.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: It is beautiful to discover our wings and learn how to fly; flight is a beautiful process. But then to rest on the wings of God as He flies: this is divine.

Author: Paramahansa Yogananda,  Autobiography of a Yogi
Quote: You have come to earth to entertain and to be entertained.

Author: Jessica Raine
Quote: I did an A Level in Theatre Studies and had a really inspirational teacher, and then I just went on to university.

Author: Joan F. Marques
Quote: When it rains it pours. Maybe the art of life is to convert tough times to great experiences: we can choose to hate the rain or dance in it.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: I am so grateful for my troubles. As I reflect back on my life, I have come to realize that my greatest triumphs have been born of my greatest troubles.

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  The Sun Also Rises
