Author: Richelle E. Goodrich,  Smile Anyway: Quotes, Verse, & Grumblings for Every Day of the Year
Quote: Just pick a goal and stick to it―no big complicated secret.

Author: Charles L. Whitfield,  Boundaires and Relationships, Knowing, Protecting and Enjoying the Self
Quote: By choosing recovery and risking to be real, we set the healthy boundaries that say, "I am in charge of my recovery and my life, and no one else on this Earth is.

Author: Joseph Campbell,  The Power of Myth
Quote: Follow your bliss and doors will open where there were no doors before.

Author: Alma Alexander
Quote: If you really want to be a writer, nobody can stop you -- and if you don't, nobody can help you.

Author: Quentin Tarantino
Quote: I was kind of excited to go to jail for the first time and I learnt some great dialogue.

Author: Geronimo Stilton,  The Haunted Castle
Quote: Loving means sharing what you have however big or small it may be!

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: A photograph shouldn't be just a picture, it should be a philosophy.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  Like the Flowing River
Quote: When something undesirable grows in my soul, I ask God to give me the courage to mercilessly pluck it out.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: If you wait for a cake to be given to you so you will be happy- then you will be happy when someone gives you a cake. But if you buy a cake (or bake one) for yourself so you will be happy, you have found the way of happiness.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Souls reconstructed with faith transform agony into peace.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: A genius is simply one who has taken full possession of his own mind and directed it toward objectives of his own choosing, without permitting outside influences to discourage or mislead him.

Author: Charles F. Stanley
Quote: Obey God and leave all the consequences to Him.

Author: Soe Hok Gie,  Catatan Seorang Demonstran
Quote: Bagiku ada sesuatu yang paling berharga dan hakiki dalam kehidupan: 'dapat mencintai, dapat iba hati, dapat merasai kedukaan'. Tanpa itu semua maka kita tidak lebih dari benda. Berbahagialah orang yang masih mempunyai rasa cinta, yang belum sampai kehilangan benda yang paling bernilai itu. Kalau kita telah kehilangan itu maka absurdlah hidup kita.

Author: Laurie A. Helgoe,  Introvert Power: Why Your Inner Life Is Your Hidden Strength
Quote: Reading is like travel, allowing you to exit your own life for a bit, and to come back with a renewed, even inspired, perspective.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Don't die without fulfilling your purpose.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Why are there trees I never walk under but large and melodious thoughts descend upon me?

Author: Christopher Logue,  New Numbers
Quote: Come to the edge.We might fall.Come to the edge.It's too high!COME TO THE EDGE!And they cameAnd he pushedAnd they flew.

Author: John Corey Whaley,  Noggin
Quote: Maybe we all just exist, all versions of us exist at times, and we have to figure out a way to get to each of them, to find each one and tell that version that it's okay, that it's all justthe way it works, a concept too powerful to ignore but too complicated to explain.

Author: Mary Kate
Quote: World peace starts with the Creator- Jesus!!

Author: Thomas Paine
Quote: We have it in our power to begin the world over again.

Author: Amit Ray,  Om Chanting & Meditation
Quote: AUM or Om is not related to any religion because Om was practiced before the birth of all the religions of the world.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: If an apology is followed by an excuse or a reason, it means they are going to commit same mistake again they just apologized for.

Author: Ram Dass
Quote: Prolong not the pastInvite not the futureDo not alter your innate wakefulnessFear not appearancesThere in nothing more than this

Author: Giacomo Leopardi,  Operette morali
Quote: Quella vita ch'è una cosa bella, non è la vita che si conosce, ma quella che non si conosce; non la vita passata, ma la futura. Coll'anno nuovo, il caso incomincerà a trattar bene voi e me e tutti gli altri, e si principierà la vita felice. Non è vero?

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Accept yourself: flaws, quirks, talents, secret thoughts, all of it, and experience true liberation.

Author: Tony Robbins
Quote: A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: Hating skin color is contempt for God's divine creative imagination. Honoring it is appreciation for conscious, beautiful-love-inspired diversity.

Author: Jincy Willett,  The Writing Class
Quote: ...(W)here there's drama, there's crap.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: When you are up against a wall, put down roots like a tree, until clarity comes from deeper sources to see over that wall and grow.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: there is one great truth on this planet: whoever you are, or whatever it is that you do, when you really want something, it's because that desire originated in the soul of the universe. It's your mission on earth.

Author: Somaly Mam,  The Road of Lost Innocence: The True Story of a Cambodian Heroine
Quote: What you have learned from experience is worth much more than gold. If you have a house it may burn down. Any kind of possession can be lost, but your experience is yours forever. Keep it and find a way to use it.

Author: Raymond I. Myers
Quote: If you seek creative ideas go walking.Angels whisper to a man when he goes fora walk.

Author: William Wilberforce
Quote: We have different forms assigned to us in the school of life, different gifts imparted. All is not attractive that is good. Iron is useful, though it does not sparkle like the diamond. Gold has not the fragrance of a flower. So different persons have various modes of excellence, and we must have an eye to all.

Author: Paul J. Meyer
Quote: Whatever you vividly imagine, ardently desire, sincerely believe, and enthusiastically act upon... must inevitably come to pass!

Author: John Lubbock,  Peace and Happiness
Quote: The whole value of solitude depends upon oneself; it may be a sanctuary or a prison, a haven of repose or a place of punishment, a heaven or a hell, as we ourselves make it.

Author: Kim Vogel Sawyer,  Courting Miss Amsel
Quote: The Bible that is falling apart usually belongs to someone who isn't.

Author: Jennifer O'Neill,  Inspirational Quotes
Quote: One of the biggest favors that you can do for yourself is to accept your loved ones for who they are, and not be constantly disappointed because they are not who you think they should be.

Author: Kimberly Novosel,  Loved
Quote: I told him I had once lost everything I had, too, and that I think that can be God’s way of building walls around us to force us to look up at Him.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: We must not be defined by what we do, but we must be what and who we are, then only happen to do what we do!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Friendship is so important. The goal of a good friendship should be for life! To keep it for life! If you find a friendship, and it gives you a joy inside, a peace, and a freedom; keep that friendship for life. Through it all, you stay together. So many friendships are toxic, but the good ones are really good! I always tell my son this, I always say, a friend is for life!

Author: Mitch Albom,  Tuesdays with Morrie
Quote: You can't substitute material things for love or for gentleness or for tenderness or for a sense of comradeship

Author: Jincy Willett,  The Writing Class
Quote: Just start the sentence...and see what happens. This is how we write.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Everything in creation has its appointed painter or poet and remains in bondage like the princess in the fairy tale 'til its appropriate liberator comes to set it free.

Author: Anthony Green
Quote: They say what doesn't kill the soul will make you stronger, but you can't be a stone-hearted man.

Author: Tom Wolfe
Quote: (W)hat I write when I force myself is generally just as good as what I write when I'm feeling inspired. It's mainly a matter of forcing yourself to write.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Any ideas, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought

Author: Socrates
Quote: For the poet is a light and winged and holy thing, and there is no invention in him until he has been inspired and is out of his senses, and the mind is no longer in him: when he has not attained to this state, he is powerless and is unable to utter his oracles.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Henry V
Quote: O for a Muse of fire, that would ascendThe brightest heaven of invention!

Author: Cassandra Duffy
Quote: It's hard not to be a fighter when you're constantly under siege.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: To assess the quality of thoughts of people, don't listen to their words, but watch their actions.

Author: Edwidge Danticat
Quote: Their Maker, she said, gives them the sky to carry because they are strong. These people do not know who they are, but if you see a lot of trouble in your life, it is because you were chosen to carry part of the sky on your head. -pg. 25

Author: Steve Martin,  Shopgirl
Quote: He gave her his phone number, in a peculiar reversal of dating procedure. She might have considered kissing him, even after the horrible first date, but he just didn’t seem to know what to do. However, Jeremy does have one outstanding quality. He likes her. And this quality in a person makes them infinitely interesting to the person who is being liked.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I think that fame removes true happiness. Because when you are famous, people know you for who they think you are and when you are happy, it's because people have met you and see you for who you really are. Of course, if you are not a great person, it's better to be famous. But if you have greatness, it's better to not be famous.

Author: Jerry B. Jenkins
Quote: You can't understand where someone's going unless you understand where they've been.

Author: Aung San Suu Kyi,  Freedom from Fear
Quote: If you're feeling helpless, help someone. ”― Aung San Suu Kyi (from Freedom from Fear)

Author: James Dashner
Quote: Just go with it', he thought. 'You won't figure out anything if you give in to fear'.

Author: Salim Akhukum Fillah
Quote: Ada banyak hal tampak yang bisa kita tertawakan. Tapi sungguh lebih berbilang hal tak kasat yang selayaknya kita tangisi.

Author: A.M. Hudson
Quote: When love dies, the heart's ashes do not leave on the wind—they rest on the mantelpiece of the soul, darkening the sunrise we once saw to be beautiful.

Author: Kristin Richter
Quote: If [you're asked] what you think, tell. If you have a preference, voice it. If you have a question, ask it. If you want to cry, bawl. If you need help, raise your hand and jump up and down.

Author: Austin Kleon,  Steal Like an Artist: 10 Things Nobody Told You About Being Creative
Quote: Read deeply. Stay open. Continue to wonder.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Who dares, win

Author: Alan Bennett,  The Uncommon Reader
Quote: [B]riefing is not reading. In fact it is the antithesis of reading. Briefing is terse, factual and to the point. Reading is untidy, discursive and perpetually inviting. Briefing closes down a subject, reading opens it up.

Author: فهد الحمود
Quote: سئل فولتر (1778م)عمن سيقود الجنس البشري؟ فأجاب:"الذين يعرفون كيف يقرأو

Author: Pope John XXIII
Quote: I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  An Apology for Idlers
Quote: There is no duty we so much underrate as the duty of being happy.

Author: Sukarno
Quote: Apabila dalam diri seseorang masih ada rasa malu dan takut untuk berbuat suatu kebaikan, maka jaminan bagi orang tersebut adalah tidak akan bertemunya ia dengan kemajuan selangkah pun

Author: Rhonda Byrne,  The Secret
Quote: we attract what is happening in our lives

Author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib
Quote: A wise man first thinks and then speaks and a fool speaks first and then thinks.

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
Quote: With my ninth mind I resurrect my firstand dance slow to the music of my soul made new.

Author: Lenore Wolfe
Quote: Sometimes the hardest one to see . . .is the one standing right before you.

Author: Patricia Briggs,  River Marked
Quote: I suppose we must work on being gracious and grateful until we can do for ourselves. Someday the wheel of fate will put us in a position to be of use to them, and we will remember how much easier it is to give help than it is to accept it.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Doubt not, O poet, but persist. Say 'It is in me, and shall out.' Stand there, balked and dumb, stuttering and stammering, hissed and hooted, stand and strive, until at last rage draw out of thee that dream-power which every night shows thee is thine own; a power transcending all limit and privacy, and by virtue of which a man is the conductor of the whole river of electricity.

Author: Justin Halpern,  I Suck at Girls
Quote: ... human beings fear the unknown. So, whatever's freaking you out, grab it by the balls and say hello.

Author: Nikos Kazantzakis
Quote: Every perfect traveler always creates the country where he travels.

Author: Brendan Francis Brown
Quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements; they demand immediate marriage to action.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: We can no more justify using nonhumans as human resources than we can justify human slavery. Animal use and slavery have at least one important point in common: both institutions treat sentient beings exclusively as resources of others. That cannot be justified with respect to humans; it cannot be justified with respect to nonhumans—however “humanely” we treat them.

Author: Molly Friedenfeld
Quote: Focus on faith and grow your roots strong and deep so no one can make you believe in something that is not good for your soul.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: Above all, never think you're not good enough. Never think that. In life people will take you at your own reckoning.

Author: Jenny B. Jones,  There You'll Find Me
Quote: I believe God spoke to you at cliffs. Her hand came to rest on the top of my head. But perhaps you weren't truly listening

Author: Deborah Brodie
Quote: Seeing a miracle will inspire you, but knowing you are a miracle will change you.

Author: William Feather
Quote: Success seems to be largely a matterof hanging on after others have let go.

Author: Susanna Kearsley,  The Winter Sea
Quote: Ye'll never best your fears until ye face them

Author: Simone Weil
Quote: In struggling against anguish one never produces serenity; the struggle against anguish only produces new forms of anguish.

Author: David Sedaris,  Me Talk Pretty One Day
Quote: but I have no mind for business and considered staying awake to be enough of an accomplishment.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: YOU are your love of a lifetime.

Author: Nāgārjuna
Quote: Just as it is knownThat an image of one's face is seenDepending on a mirrorBut does not really exist as a face,So the conception of "I"existsDependent on mind and body,But like the image of a faceThe "I"does not at all exist as its own reality.

Author: Wolfgang Riebe,  100 Quotes to Make You Think!
Quote: Make your life like toilet paper. Long and usefull.

Author: Muriel Barbery,  The Elegance of the Hedgehog
Quote: We can be friends. We can be anything we want to be.

Author: Cressida Cowell,  How to Twist a Dragon's Tale
Quote: And now that its ruby eyes are set into the gold, you cannot see their tear-shape, so they seem to be laughing rather than crying. It is a constant reminder to me of the human ability to create something beautiful even when things are at the darkest.

Author: Lea Michele
Quote: Uniqueness is what makes you the most beautiful.

Author: David Richo
Quote: When we feel unsafe with someone and still stay with him, we damage our ability to discern trustworthiness in those we will meet in the future.

Author: Muriel Rukeyser
Quote: The universe is made up of stories, not atoms.

Author: J.D. Stroube,  Caged in Darkness
Quote: If the town were a black hole, I was the helpless star being sucked into oblivion. It was an oblivion I craved.

Author: Frances Mayes,  In Tuscany
Quote: Five tender apricots in a blue bowl, a brief and exact promise of things to come.

Author: Wallis Simpson
Quote: For a gallant spirit there can never be defeat.

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: People will always notice something about you. It might be the way you walk or the way you talk, or just simply your personality. Live each day in the way you want to be remembered. Live in such a way that people will be inspired by those unique qualities that you have and strive to live better lives for themselves.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I really believe that there is an invisible red thread tied between him and me, and that it has stretched and tangled for years — across oceans and lifetimes. I know that it won’t break because our souls are tied.

Author: Mother Teresa
Quote: I have found the paradox that if I love until it hurts, then there is no hurt, but only more love.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Where are you?"he asked. "I'm right here"she said. "I know, but it feels like one percent of you is somewhere else, where is that one percent?"he said. "I don't know....I think I'm always like that..."she answered. "I like that.""You do?""Yes, because that way, I have to always look for the one percent to find it.

Author: Stuart Aken
Quote: Inspiration fires you up; motivation keeps you burning.

Author: Robert Louis Stevenson,  An Apology for Idlers
Quote: An intelligent person, looking out of his eyes and hearkening in his ears, with a smile on his face all the time, will get more true education than many another in a life of heroic vigils".

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu
Quote: Men love women who are courageous for it means they can go all the way with him in his pursuit of his good dreams and intentions.

Author: Adi Alsaid,  Let's Get Lost
Quote: Then that's what the Northern Lights are. All the lives that we're not living.

Author: Plutarch
Quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.

Author: Lorna Byrne,  Angels In My Hair
Quote: Your guardian angel never, ever stops communicating with you.  I feel that at times they should be frustrated with us but they seem to have endless patience and they never ever give up on us.

Author: Ellen DeGeneres,  Seriously... I'm Kidding
Quote: I enjoy growing older and wiser and learning from my mistakes every single day.

Author: Patrick Ness
Quote: ... a good idea always attracts other good ideas.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: What if it becomes less about how we look and more about how much we care? What if it becomes less about how much money we earn and more about how much we share our good fortune? Imagine a world where who we are in our hearts is the ultimate status symbol.

Author: Roman Payne,  Rooftop Soliloquy
Quote: Fueled by my inspiration, I ran across the room to steal the cup of coffee the bookshelf had taken prisoner. Lapping the black watery brew like a hyena, I tossed the empty cup aside. I then returned to the chair to continue my divine act of creation. Hot blood swished in my head as my mighty pen stole across the page.

Author: Tim O'Reilly
Quote: Money is like gasoline during a road trip. You don’t want to run out of gas on your trip, but you’re not doing a tour of gas stations.

Author: Hugh MacLeod,  Ignore Everybody: and 39 Other Keys to Creativity
Quote: You have to find your own shtick. A Picasso always looks like Picasso painted it. Hemingway always sounds like Hemingway. A Beethoven symphony always sounds like a Beethoven symphony. Part of being a master is learning how to sing in nobody else's voice but your own.

Author: John Pfeiffer
Quote: Man is a slow, sloppy, and brilliant thinker; computers are fast, accurate, and stupid.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: To realize one's destiny is a person's only real obligation and when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

Author: Bernard Kelvin Clive,  Your Dreams Will Not Die
Quote: I’m not out to compete with any one, I’m here to complete, by encouraging and inspiring souls through a text at a time

Author: Charlotte Eriksson
Quote: Do you wait for things to happen, or do you make them happen yourself? I believe in writing your own story.

Author: Roopleen
Quote: To turn your dreams into reality, all your resources, efforts and concentration should be aligned in the same direction.

Author: Morihei Ueshiba
Quote: Create each day anew.

Author: Rick Warren,  The Purpose Driven Life: What on Earth Am I Here for?
Quote: As long as you do things for God, you are a Hall of Famer in heaven's list.

Author: Cormac McCarthy
Quote: I never had any doubts about my abilities. I knew I could write. I just had to figure out how to eat while doing this.[Cormac McCarthy's Venomous Fiction, New York Times, April 19, 1992]

Author: Felix Y. Siauw,  Beyond The Inspiration
Quote: there's only one truth!

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  Prayers: A Communion with Our Creator
Quote: Love for yourself is the key to loving other. Love begins with you.

Author: Heather Schuck,  The Working Mom Manifesto
Quote: Taking personal accountability is a beautiful thing because it gives us complete control of our destinies.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Dare to be different. Represent your maker well and you will forever abide in the beautiful embrace of his loving arms.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: God is never tired of bringing the sun out every morning, taking it in the evenings and bringing out the moon.

Author: Marilyn Suttle
Quote: When you give appreciation IN ORDER TO get something– it's manipulation and people can sense it. Appreciate genuinely.

Author: Kelley Armstrong,  Living with the Dead
Quote: So consider your options, make your choice and call me home.

Author: Marilyn Suttle
Quote: Notice the difference between being in control and needing control.

Author: Bob Proctor
Quote: Be like a postage stamp. Stick to it until you get there

Author: E.B. White,  The Elements of Style
Quote: The mind travels faster than the pen; consequently, writing becomes a question of learning to make occasional wing shots, bringing down the bird of thought as it flashes by. A writer is a gunner, sometimes waiting in the blind for something to come in, sometimes roaming the countryside hoping to scare something up.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: When you are lonely for a while don't get restless, if you had born alone, you are going to die alone then for sometime you can certainly live alone.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I could watch him do this until morning — never asking questions and never interrupting his work. I worship quietly — his intense focus and attention to detail and then, out of no where, I realize the inconvenient, inappropriate truth: ‘I love this man… and it has swallowed me.

Author: William James
Quote: Belief creates the actual fact.

Author: Karen Hackel,  The Whisper of Your Soul
Quote: You need to trustTo surrenderTo ask for guidanceGo within for the answersThey're within youYou have the answersAll you need do is ask

Author: James Baldwin
Quote: The world is before you, and you need not take it or leave it as it was when you came in.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The problem with thinking that you are the absolute best, is that it leaves no room for you to become any better and while you live life thinking that you're the best, truth is a lot of people around you are already better and becoming even more better.

Author: Donna Quesada,  Buddha in the Classroom: Zen Wisdom to Inspire Teachers
Quote: What we can change is our perceptions, which have the effect of changing everything.

Author: Richard Bach
Quote: Don’t believe what your eyes are telling you. All they show is limitation. Look with your understanding.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Any serious social, political, and economic change must include veganism.

Author: Clive Ollies
Quote: Life is a mystery to be lived not a problem to be solved

Author: Teresa Mummert
Quote: Someone is always going to try to knock you down and take your place. It is up to you to fight for what you want.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Your words are powerful so what you say goes a long way to either establish or destroy you; this is why you should say things that God has said concerning you, not things that situations or circumstances say.

Author: Plato
Quote: Calligraphy is a geometry of the soul which manifests itself physically.

Author: Allan Lokos,  Pocket Peace: Effective Practices for Enlightened Living
Quote: When we are aware of our weaknesses or negative tendencies, we open the opportunity to work on them.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu,  The Prince and the Pauper
Quote: Have you realized that today is the tomorrow you talked about yesterday? It is your responsibility to change your life for the better.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: Not even waste/is inviolate./The day misspent,/the love misplaced,/has inside it/the seed of redemption./Nothing is exempt from resurrection.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Starting over can be the scariest thing in the entire world, whether it’s leaving a lover, a school, a team, a friend or anything else that feels like a core part of our identity but when your gut is telling you that something here isn’t right or feels unsafe, I really want you to listen and trust in that voice.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Every game is winnable if you change your mind about what the prize should be and your perspective about the players at the table.

Author: Arthur C. Clarke
Quote: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.

Author: Nelson M. Lubao
Quote: Why sadness was created?So we could rest from laughing.

Author: Aberjhani,  I Made My Boy Out of Poetry
Quote: Just above our terror, the stars painted this storyin perfect silver calligraphy. And our souls, too oftenabused by ignorance, covered our eyes with mercy.

Author: Hannah Senesh
Quote: To die,so young to die.No, no, not I,I love the warm sunny skies,light, song, shining eyes,I want no war, no battle cry,No, no, not I.

Author: Danielle Pierre
Quote: Your life is a reflection of your thoughts. Think well.

Author: Richard Bach,  Jonathan Livingston Seagull
Quote: Like everything else, Fletcher. Practice.

Author: Confucius
Quote: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.

Author: Johnathan Jena
Quote: Beauty exists not in what is seen and remembered, but in what is felt and never forgotten.

Author: Tere Liye,  Eliana
Quote: Tidak semua yang kita inginkan harus terjadi seketika. Kita tidak hidup di dunia dongeng.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Let us each take up our flaming torches and mount as the blazing fireballs of light that we are and let's burn the skies and leave it with deep scars and let them be our signatures upon eternity as we go forth!

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: It dawns on you one day... how precious your life is and how not okay it is for anyone, ever, to cause you any amount of suffering, ever. Then the next time you step out the door you look at everyone and you’re thinking, “My life is precious and you’re not allowed to hurt me.

Author: Penelope Douglas,  Rival
Quote: Sometimes I wore smiles but didn’t feel them. Sometimes I felt them and didn’t wear them. I didn’t want her to know how much I craved this. I bit my bottom lip.

Author: Douglas Adams
Quote: So, the world is fine. We don’t have to save the world—the world is big enough to look after itself. What we have to be concerned about, is whether or not the world we live in, will be capable of sustaining us in it. That’s what we need to think about.

Author: Jim Bouchard,  Think Like a Black Belt
Quote: Perfection is not a destination; it's a never-ending process...Enjoy!

Author: Mary Renault,  The Persian Boy
Quote: It is better to believe in men too rashly, and regret, than believe too meanly. Men could be more than they are, if they would try for it. He has shown them that.

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.

Author: R.N. Prasher
Quote: The restless spirit never loses its wings. If sometimes it cannot fly, it is because during those moments the sky vanishes.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: I had always felt life first as a story: and if there is a story there is a story-teller

Author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
Quote: To find what you seek in the road of life, the best proverb of all is that which says:"Leave no stone unturned.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I swear, the best things come to me by accident! Or should I say, effortless destiny?

Author: David Gemmell,  Lord of the Silver Bow
Quote: Fear is an aid to the warrior. It is a small fire burning. It heats the muscles, making us stronger. Panic comes when the fire is out of control, consuming all courage and pride.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: One woman filled with self love and self acceptance is a model more super than any cover girl.

Author: Tom Hiddleston
Quote: The dream is to keep surprising yourself, never mind the audience.

Author: Alejandro Jodorowsky
Quote: For a true artist, difficulties become opportunities and clouds become solid present.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: Action creates/a taste/for itself.

Author: Andre Gide
Quote: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Ethical veganism represents a commitment to nonviolence.

Author: Jean-Yves Leloup,  Compassion and Meditation: The Spiritual Dynamic between Buddhism and Christianity
Quote: If you are a Buddhist, inspire yourself by thinking of the bodhisattva. If you are a Christian, think of the Christ, who came not to be served by others but to serve them in joy, in peace, and in generosity. For these things, these are not mere words, but acts, which go all the way, right up to their last breath. Even their death is a gift, and resurrection is born from this kind of death. (157)

Author: Mark Batterson,  In a Pit with a Lion on a Snowy Day: How to Survive and Thrive When Opportunity Roars
Quote: As I look back on my own life, I recognize this simple truth: The greatest opportunities were the scariest lions. Part of me has wanted to play it safe, but I’ve learned that taking no risks is the greatest risk of all.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Facts? What are facts? I only know imagination!

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: Marmee: Oh, Jo. Jo, you have so many extraordinary gifts; how can you expect to lead an ordinary life? You’re ready to go out and – and find a good use for your talent. Tho’ I don’t know what I shall do without my Jo. Go, and embrace your liberty. And see what wonderful things come of it.

Author: Gregory J. Boyle,  Tattoos on the Heart: The Power of Boundless Compassion
Quote: Compassion isn't just about feeling the pain of others; it's about bringing them in toward yourself. If we love what God loves, then, in compassion, margins get erased. 'Be compassionate as God is compassionate,' means the dismantling of barriers that exclude.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Dig deep and empower yourself today. Stand in your inner strength. Be uniquely you.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Happiness is a choice. Peace is a state of mind. Both are free!

Author: Khaled Hosseini
Quote: It's often a matter of sitting in front of the computer and worrying. It's what writing comes down to--worrying that things aren't going to work out.

Author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
Quote: What is lovely never dies, but passes into other loveliness, Star-dust, or sea-foam, flower or winged air.

Author: Howard Zinn,  You Can't Be Neutral on a Moving Train: A Personal History of Our Times
Quote: There is a power that can be created out of pent-up indignation, courage, and the inspiration of a common cause, and that if enough people put their minds and bodies into that cause, they can win. It is a phenomenon recorded again and against in the history of popular movements against injustice all over the world.

Author: Sue Monk Kidd,  Traveling With Pomegranates: A Mother-Daughter Story
Quote: The words were unexpected, but so incisively true. So much of prayer is like that - an encounter with a truth that has sunk to the bottom of the heart, that wants to be found, wants to be spoken, wants to be elevated into the realm of sacredness.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham
Quote: I write only when inspiration strikes. Fortunately it strikes every morning at nine o'clock sharp.

Author: عبد الوهاب المسيري,  اللغة والمجاز بين التوحيد ووحدة الوجود
Quote: نجد أن الفن الحداثي يزداد ابهاما وتعقيدا حتى اصبح فنا نخبويا رغم ثورته على البرجوازية

Author: Deborah Barnes
Quote: True beauty radiates not from outer cosmetics, but from the simple joy of making a difference for those that need your voice, passion, and time without expecting or wanting anything in return...

Author: Saadi
Quote: Roam abroad in the world, and take thy fill of its enjoyments before the day shall come when thou must quit it for good.

Author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
Quote: Recognize that throughout this beautiful day,you have an incredible amount of opportunities to move your life into the direction you want it to go.

Author: Aberjhani,  Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love
Quote: And now we step to the rhythm of miracles.--from The Light, That Never Dies

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: The youth gets together his materials to build a bridge to the moon, or, perchance, a palace or temple on the earth, and, at length, the middle-aged man concludes to build a woodshed with them.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Veganism is an act of nonviolent defiance. It is our statement that we reject the notion that animals are things and that we regard sentient nonhumans as moral persons with the fundamental moral right not to be treated as the property or resources of humans.

Author: Melodie Ramone
Quote: I'm pretty much looking for beauty all the time. It just seems like some days the light is better to see it.

Author: Rob Bell,  What We Talk about When We Talk about God
Quote: Take faith, for example. For many people in our world, the opposite of faith is doubt. The goal, then, within this understanding, is to eliminate doubt. But faith and doubt aren't opposites. Doubt is often a sign that your faith has a pulse, that it's alive and well and exploring and searching. Faith and doubt aren't opposites, they are, it turns out, excellent dance partners.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Feet sandaled with dreams tread paths of vision leading to wisdom’s sharp peaks.

Author: Aberjhani,  Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
Quote: In honor of Oprah Winfrey: Even greater than the ability to inspire others with hope is the power to motivate them to give as much to the lives of others as they would give to their own; and to empower them to confront the worst in themselves in order to discover and claim the best in themselves.

Author: Sue Nelson Buckley
Quote: It's not whether your glass is empty or full, it's what you do with it that really matters.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: Someone needs to fight,someone needs to sacrifice, someone needs to inspire, someone needs to be a hero.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: A birth-date is a reminder to celebrate the life as well as to update the life.

Author: Ray Bradbury
Quote: It takes writing a billion bad words before you get to the good ones.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Many things that don't really mean so much of anything, are wonderful.

Author: Patrick Ness
Quote: Librarians are tour-guides for all of knowledge.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Unconditional love is the greatest gift we can ever give.

Author: Joel Osteen,  It's Your Time: Activate Your Faith, Accomplish Your Dreams, and Increase in God's Favor
Quote: Rewards await you if you stay steadfast in your faith.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Your dreams are worth it. Persevere. Your focus is your power. Harness it.

Author: Horton Foote
Quote: Writing is the thing that props me up.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: whatever you dobe gentle with yourself.you don’t just livein this worldor your homeor your skin.you also livein someone’s eyes.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham,  The Summing Up
Quote: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.

Author: Toba Beta,  My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut
Quote: At dawn of man, many words of inspiration.At the end, there will be words of revelation.

Author: Liza M. Wiemer
Quote: Perseverance is the act of true role models and heroes.

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: Optimists enrich the present, enhance the future,challenge the improbable and attain the impossible

Author: Bernhard Schlink
Quote: We make our own truths and lies....Truths are often lies and lies truths...

Author: Susan Branch
Quote: The tension between what is, and what we dream of, is important. Not to discount what we have, but to hold onto that middle ground, because it's in there that the magic happens.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: La vie est une aventure audacieuse ou alors elle n'est rien.

Author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
Quote: I am writing in the garden. To write as one should of a garden one must write not outside it or merely somewhere near it, but in the garden.

Author: Queen Latifah,  Put on Your Crown: Life-Changing Moments on the Path to Queendom
Quote: I didn't know I had it in me. There's more to all of us than we realize. Life is so much bigger, grander, higher, and wider than we allow ourselves to think. We're capable of so much more than we allow ourselves to believe.

Author: Robert Fulghum
Quote: I believe it is in my nature to dance by virtue of the beat of my heart, the pulse of my blood and the music in my mind.

Author: Bano Qudsiyah,  Hasil Ghat
Quote: Muhabbat apni marzi se khulay pinjray main totay ki tarha bethnay ki salaahiyat hai. Muhabbat is ghulami ka toq hai jo insaan khud apnay ekhtyar se galay main dalta hai

Author: Doug Dillon
Quote: Treat everyone you meet as if they were you.

Author: Malcolm Forbes
Quote: To live long and achieve happiness, cultivate the art of radiating happiness.

Author: Nirav Sanchaniya
Quote: I Am In Love With Myself, With My Heart.

Author: Steve Pavlina
Quote: Your environment will eat your goals and plans for breakfast.

Author: Unknown 21
Quote: There will be haters, there will be doubters, there will be non-believers, and then there will be you proving them wrong.

Author: L. Frank Baum,  The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
Quote: ...and remember my sentimental friend that a heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.

Author: Margaret Cho
Quote: I’m not going to die because I failed as someone else. I’m going to succeed as myself.

Author: Victoria Addino
Quote: Don't step backward toward nothing, step forward toward something, better awkward steps forward, than coward steps backward.

Author: Cressida Cowell,  How to Break a Dragon's Heart
Quote: I NAME THIS LAND TOMORROW, FOR IT SHALL LAST FOREVERMORE!

Author: Doug Dillon
Quote: Coincidences give you opportunities to look more deeply into your existence.

Author: Lori Nelson Spielman,  The Life List
Quote: There will be another sky, my love, just you wait

Author: Adele
Quote: I make music for ears, not eyes

Author: Jonny Depp
Quote: You can close your eyes to the things you don't want to see, but you can't close your heart to the things you don't want to feel.

Author: Stephanie Lennox
Quote: All you have to do is put one word after another, and remember how great it feels to be a writer.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: I couldn't tell fact from fiction,Or if the dream was trueMy only sure predictionIn this world was you.I'd touch your features inchly. Beard love and dared the cost, The sented spiel reeled me unreal And I found my senses lost.

Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Mereka Yang Dilumpuhkan
Quote: Binatang itu bicara, makan -- tapi tak mengerti dirinya sendiri. Dan aku begitu juga.

Author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms
Quote: Bad luck with women is a determined man's road to success. For every affliction, he makes, out of indignation, yet another advancement in order to exceed the man that the woman chose over him. This goes to show that great men are made great because they once learned how to fight the feeling of rejection.

Author: Harold Bloom
Quote: Everyone wants a prodigy to fail; it makes our mediocrity more bearable.

Author: Gene Kranz
Quote: To recognize that the greatest error is not to have tried and failed, but that in trying, we did not give it our best effort

Author: Amelia Barr
Quote: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: Before this generation lose the wisdom, one advice - read books.

Author: Odille Rault,  Beyond the Magic Pill: A Collection of the Insights of Illusions
Quote: Darkness cannot survive in light, but a light can shine in the dark!

Author: Joanne Crisner,  Brightest
Quote: Long before we even lose our lives, we lose our souls. Tragic but true. Some carry on—willing to make the sacrifices, putting what is perceived as important before anything else. Some tread into the dark—wasting moments of grace, letting themselves suffer from their own decisions or the other’s domination. Some continue to love, give too much, and not leave even a little love for themselves.

Author: William James
Quote: It is only by risking our persons from one hour to another that we live at all.

Author: Dorothy Day
Quote: As Dostoevski said: 'Love in action is a harsh and dreadful thing compared with love in dreams.

Author: Sharon Salzberg,  Real Happiness: The Power of Meditation
Quote: Mindfulness, also called wise attention, helps us see what we’re adding to our experiences, not only during meditation sessions but also elsewhere.

Author: Napoleon Hill,  Success Through A Positive Mental Attitude
Quote: You become what you think about

Author: Eduardo Galeano
Quote: The ball laughs, radiant, in the air. He brings her down, puts her to sleep, showers her with compliments, dances with her, and seeing such things never before seen his admirers pity their unborn grandchildren who will never see them.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: Gaps don't/just happen./There is a/generative element/inside them,/a welling motion/as when cold/waters shoulder/up through/warmer oceans./And where gaps/choose to widen,/coordinates warp,/even in places/constant since/the oldest maps.

Author: Michael Faudet
Quote: I could taste the salt on her lips, each kiss like a summer wave breaking on an empty beach.

Author: Marilyn Suttle
Quote: When you depersonalize abrasive behavior and see it as a call for help you become a catalyst for the best kind of change.

Author: Raquel Cepeda
Quote: Support and encouragement are found in the most unlikely places.

Author: Eduardo Galeano
Quote: And one fine day the goddess of the wind kisses the foot of man, that mistreated, scorned foot, and from that kiss the soccer idol is born. He is born in a straw crib in a tin-roofed shack and he enters the world clinging to a ball.

Author: Ron Koertge
Quote: I'm not a big fan of inspiration. I'm too old to sit and wait for the muse to give me a little kiss... I write a lot, and I'm not afraid to make mistakes or to write badly. I can alsways fix something weak and dull. But I can't fix a blank page.

Author: Amelia Barr
Quote: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: In presence of the Moon nobody sees stars.

Author: Eddie Johnson
Quote: Fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge. Only Fools despise wisdom and discipline."Proverbs 1:7 NLT

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Everything hurts right now and nothing is helping because as the pain is getting worse — so is the love.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: Does our purpose on Earth directly link to the people whom we end up meeting? Are our relationships and experiences actually the required dots that connect and then lead us to our ultimate destinies?

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I fantasize the night sky to be like a cosmic blue print of my life as I close my eyes and unbutton my heart…. just in case anyone up there is listening.

Author: Peter E. Gillquist,  Becoming Orthodox: A Journey to the Ancient Christian Faith
Quote: It's time we capture our imaginations for Christ

Author: Jacqueline Carey
Quote: Those that yield are not always weak

Author: Denzel Washington,  A Hand to Guide Me
Quote: So you never know who you touch. You never know how or when you'll have an impact, or how important your example can be to someone else"(20).

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Celebrate true friends. They are a part of you that always sparkles.

Author: Fadi Hattendorf
Quote: Love, as life, is a journey. Finding true love for the ever after is an amazing achievement.

Author: Allan Lokos,  Pocket Peace: Effective Practices for Enlightened Living
Quote: One doesn't have to be religious to lead a moral life or attain wisdom.

Author: Allan Lokos,  Pocket Peace: Effective Practices for Enlightened Living
Quote: Patience is the direct antithesis of anger.

Author: Virginia Woolf
Quote: No sooner have you feasted on beauty with your eyes than your mind tells you that beauty is vain and beauty passes

Author: Thomas Fuller
Quote: Great hopes make great men.

Author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
Quote: God is not interested in your art but, your heart.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I’ve grown up defined by this desperate, undeniable, ‘can’t breathe’ kind of space inside of myself and I’m afraid that the diagnosis is fatal.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  1Q84
Quote: But hell, you've gotta work with what you've got.

Author: Lucas Remmerswaal,  The A-Z of 13 Habits: Inspired by Warren Buffett
Quote: Just do it! First you make your habits, then your habits make you!

Author: Caroline Gerardo,  Toxic Assets
Quote: Being ready is everything.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: An empowered heart is one filled with self love.

Author: William S. Burroughs
Quote: Cheat your landlord if you can and must, but do not try to shortchange the Muse. It cannot be done. You can't fake quality any more than you can fake a good meal.

Author: L.A. Jones
Quote: If everyone could be a successful and rich author, there would be no point in working so hard. Where is the fun in that?

Author: Allan Frewin Jones,  The Lost Queen
Quote: we are not leaving anyone behind we have to stick togheter in order to stay safe.

Author: Maria Robinson,  From Birth to One
Quote: Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending."i love it so much

Author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib
Quote: A fool's mind is at the mercy of his tongue and a wise man's tongue is under the control ofhis mind.

Author: Michelle Sutton,  Never Without Hope
Quote: Well if God wanted a broken spirit out of me, He would get Hiswish. At this point in my life the only thing I could do was look up.

Author: Albert Pinkham Ryder
Quote: Imitation is not inspiration, and inspiration only can give birth to a work of art. The least of man's original emanation is better than the best of borrowed thought.

Author: Christina Westover,  Poisoning Sylvie
Quote: Inhale when I inhale. Exhale when I exhale. Breathe with me,for two beating hearts breathing one breath together become one.

Author: Jim Jarmusch
Quote: Steal from anywhere that resonates with inspiration or fuels your imagination. Devour old films, new film, music, books, paintings, photographs, poems, dreams, random conversations, architecture, bridges, street signs, trees, clouds, bodies of water, light and shadows. Select only things to steal from that speak directly to your soul.

Author: Raymond Carver
Quote: My circumstances of unrelieved responsibility and permanent distraction necessitated the short story form.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: A too closely watched flower/blossoms the wrong color./Excess attention to the jonquil/turns it gentian. Flowers/need it tranquil to get/their hues right. Some/only open at midnight.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Children of the Mind
Quote: Someday stars will wind down or blow up. Someday death will cover us all like the water of a lake and perhaps nothing will ever come to the surface to show that we were ever there. But we WERE there, and during the time we lived, we were alive. That's the truth - what is, what was, what will be - not what could be, what should have been, what never can be.

Author: David Richo
Quote: The opposite of interpersonal trust is not mistrust. It is despair. This is because we have given up on believing that trustworthiness and fulfillment are possible from others. We have lost our hope in our fellow humans.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: The most dangerous irony is, people are angry with others because of their own incompetence.

Author: Chidi Okonkwo
Quote: Knowledge is like an endless resource; a well of water that satisfies the innate thirst of the growing human soul. Therefore never stop learning... because the day you do, you will also stop maturing.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I know that this process of ‘me changing my life’ doesn’t just end once I set fire to this list of things I hate about myself. Tonight isn’t as much of a new beginning as it is a violent end and I know the real work hasn’t even started yet.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth,  Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
Quote: I’m going to follow this invisible red thread until I find myself again… until I finally figure out… who I’m meant to be.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: It's time that I stop referring to myself, thinking about myself, planning for myself, according to the gridlines and the timelines and the guidelines of people. I will expand in this universe, I will not stay on the lines nor within the lines written by this world.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Having the life of your dreams is simple: make conscious choices.

Author: عباس محمود العقاد,  أنا
Quote: غــِـناك َ فى نفسـِـكَ ، و قيمَتـِك فى عمــَلـِـك ، و بواعثـُك أحرى بالعناية من غاياتك ، و لا تنتظر من الناس كثيرا ً

Author: Francine Rivers
Quote: God would light the way. Faith would keep them on the right path.

Author: Randy Alcorn,  Deadline
Quote: Am I getting braver, or just getting accustomed to being terrified?

Author: Charlaine Harris
Quote: You think that it’s not magic that keeps you alive? Just ‘cause you understand the mechanics of how something works, doesn’t make it any less of a miracle. Which is just another word for magic. We’re all kept alive by magic, Sookie. My magic’s just a little different from yours, that’s all.

Author: Mike Meyer
Quote: Laughter is good for both the body and the soul.

Author: Alex Morritt,  Impromptu Scribe
Quote: New Year - a new chapter, new verse, or just the same old story ? Ultimately we write it. The choice is ours.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: You cannot live a nonviolent life as long as you are consuming violence. Please consider going vegan.

Author: Thomas S. Monson
Quote: The storm stops at the door. Love reigns, peace dwells.

Author: Rodolfo Costa,  Advice My Parents Gave Me: and Other Lessons I Learned from My Mistakes
Quote: Do not empower your negative thoughts by giving them “legs” so they can run around your mind, creating worries,frustrations, and anxiety in your life.

Author: Gordon MacKenzie
Quote: You have a masterpiece inside you, you know. One unlike any that has ever been created, or ever will be. If you go to your grave without painting your masterpiece, it will not get painted. No one else can paint it. Only you.

Author: Norman Vincent Peale,  Norman Vincent Peale: Three Complete Books: The Power of Positive Thinking; The Positive Principle Today; Enthusiasm Makes the Difference
Quote: Imagination is the true magic carpet.

Author: Paulina Christensen
Quote: If I don't eat junk, I don't gain weight.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: You can dramatize your ideas in business or in any other aspect of your life. It’s easy

Author: Paul Lockhart,  A Mathematician's Lament: How School Cheats Us Out of Our Most Fascinating and Imaginative Art Form
Quote: The thing I want you especially to understand is this feeling of divine revelation. I feel that this structure was "out there"all along I just couldn't see it. And now I can! This is really what keeps me in the math game-- the chance that I might glimpse some kind of secret underlying truth, some sort of message from the gods.

Author: Marilyn Suttle
Quote: People who work in an environment where doing their best is recognized have a better chance of feeling good about their work.

Author: Thomas Moore
Quote: There's nothing half so sweet in life as love's young dream.

Author: Lisa Washington
Quote: GIVING - Applied tithing is so rewarding. When you give away your time, talent, and treasures you create a huge shift in your prosperity consciousness. So start where you are as you reach for where it is you want to be.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: I called the world of phenomena an illusion, I called my eyes and my tongue and accident, valueless phenomena. No, that is all over; I have awakened, I have really awakened and have just been born today.

Author: Tom Stoppard
Quote: Hotel rooms inhabit a separate moral universe.

Author: Robert Frost
Quote: But yield who will to their separation, My object in living is to uniteMy avocation and my vocationAs my two eyes make one in sight.

Author: Leonard Cohen
Quote: Be With Me In The Phases Of My Work Because My Brain Feels Like It Has Been Whipped And I Yearn To Make A Small Perfect Thing Which Will Live In Your Morning Like Curious Static Through A President's Elegy Or A Nude Hunchback Acquiring A Tan On The Crowded Oily Beach.

Author: Charles Kohlhase
Quote: Rise early and seize each day, learn much and use this knowledge well, spend time with those you love, never abuse your pets, use logic to fight the irrational (for it is everywhere), defend the environment and its wildlife as a knight would protect King Arthur, meld mind and heart for greatest creativity, follow your dreams, and become all that you can be.

Author: James Rouse
Quote: Whatever ought to be, can be.

Author: Daniel Delgado F
Quote: Freedom is an absolute state, there is no such thing as being half-free.

Author: Thomas Mann,  Death in Venice and Other Tales
Quote: Forbearance in the face of fate, beauty constant under torture, are not merely passive. They are a positive achievement, an explicit triumph.

Author: Jennifer Donnelly,  Revolution
Quote: The greenest of pastures are right here on earth.

Author: Lola Jaye,  By The Time You Read This
Quote: Remember this, - where there is life there is hope. You're alive. Embrace this, because YOU CAN DO ANYTHING while there is breath in your body.

Author: Thérèse de Lisieux,  The Story Of A Soul: The Autobiography Of St. Therese Of Lisieux
Quote: I am convinced that one should tell one's spiritual director if one has a great desire for Communion, for Our Lord does not come from Heaven every day to stay in a golden ciborium; He comes to find another heaven, the heaven of our soul in which He loves to dwell.

Author: Nakia R. Laushaul,  The Truth as I See It: In Poetry & Prose
Quote: The truth is .. I'm okay with people not liking me. I'm not okay with them pretending that they do. Keep it real. Everybody ain't for everybody.

Author: Randy Pausch,  The Last Lecture
Quote: There's a lot of talk these days about giving children self-esteem. It's not something you can give; it's something they have to build.

Author: Richelle E. Goodrich
Quote: I love words. I crave descriptions that overwhelm my imagination with vivid detail. I dwell on phrases that make my heart thrum. I cherish expressions that pierce my emotions and force the tears to spill over. In essence, I long for a writer's soul sealed in ink on the page.

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية
Quote: Hendaknya kita mengukur ilmu bukan dari tumpukan buku yang kita habiskan. Bukan dari tumpukan naskah yang kita hasilkan. Bukan juga dari penatnya mulut dalam diskusi tak putus yang kita jalani. Tapi…dari amal (action) yang keluar dari setiap desah nafas kita

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: To say that a being who is sentient has no interest in continuing to live is like saying that a being with eyes has no interest in continuing to see. Death—however “humane”—is a harm for humans and nonhumans alike.

Author: Rick Riordan
Quote: Nothing lasts forever. But the thing is, you can reuse some. Use your mind. - Leo's Mother, The Lost Hero

Author: Tahir M Khan
Quote: Bring up the past only if it will help to build the future, otherwise its best to be left to sleep

Author: John Ruskin,  The Works of John Ruskin: Library Edition. 39 vols.
Quote: To be taught to read—what is the use of that, if you know not whether what you read is false or true? To be taught to write or to speak—but what is the use of speaking, if you have nothing to say? To be taught to think—nay, what is the use of being able to think, if you have nothing to think of? But to be taught to see is to gain word and thought at once, and both true.

Author: Allan Lokos,  Patience: The Art of Peaceful Living
Quote: That's why it's called a practice. We have to practice a practice if it is to be of value.

Author: Ai Yazawa
Quote: Getting carried away is stupid, it won't get me anywhere.-Nana Komatsu

Author: Kingsley Amis,  Lucky Jim
Quote: Doing what you wanted to do was the only training, and the only preliminary, needed for doing more of what you wanted to do.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: I take thee at thy word:Call me but love, and I'll be new baptized;Henceforth I never will be Romeo.

Author: Martin Sheen
Quote: You do it for yourself. You don’t expect to change the world. You don’t even expect to influence your family or your friends. You do it because you can’t not do it and be who you are. Or who you’re meant to be.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu
Quote: An intelligent woman is a goldmine! She has the ability to learn, reason and understand things better and faster than her contemporaries. She is competent, alert and can reason out stuffs easily.

Author: Christopher Vogler,  The Writer's Journey: Mythic Structure for Writers
Quote: I realized that the good stories were affecting the organs of my body in various ways, and the really good ones were stimulating more than one organ. An effective story grabs your gut, tightens your throat, makes your heart race and your lungs pump, brings tears to your eyes or an explosion of laughter to your lips.

Author: Elmore Leonard
Quote: I started out of course with Hemingway when I learned how to write. Until I realized Hemingway doesn't have a sense of humor. He never has anything funny in his stories.

Author: Kelly Long,  Sarah's Garden
Quote: Every mother has to take care of her family.

Author: Anthony Rapp
Quote: There is only one you for all time. Fearlessly be yourself.

Author: Noel DeJesus
Quote: There is no tomorrow and there was no yesterday; if you truly want to accomplish your goals you must engulf yourself in today.

Author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu
Quote: An average man is egoistic, proud and has strong self esteem. They always require partners who massage their ego not those who will drag their ego to the mud.

Author: William Blake,  William Blake
Quote: excuse my enthusiasm or rather madness, for I am really drunk with intellectual vision whenever I take a pencil or graver into my hand.

Author: Donald Cargill
Quote: And now, this is the sweetest and most glorious day that ever my eyes did see.

Author: Aberjhani,  The American Poet Who Went Home Again
Quote: Peace is not so much a political mandate as it is a shared state of consciousness that remains elevated and intact only to the degree that those who value it volunteer their existence as living examples of the same... Peace ends with the unraveling of individual hope and the emergence of the will to worship violence as a healer of private and social dis-ease.

Author: Thisuri Wanniarachchi
Quote: The thing about life is, you’ve got to somehow make it through the day. Don’t wait for the beautiful evening. Go on with your life. Of course, the beautiful evening will come. In fact, she’s on her way. And she’s coming to you as fast as she can. And dude, she’s beautiful.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: The conception of each star was at the point of no return; of a desperate soul struggling to master the winds!

Author: Christopher Robinson
Quote: Never allow others to create your world because if you do, they will always make it too small.

Author: Laurent Gounelle,  L'homme qui voulait être heureux
Quote: Plus on évolue dans sa vie, plus on se débarrasse des croyances quinous limitent, et plus on a de choix. Et le choix, c'est la liberté.

Author: Elizabeth Parker,  Bark Out Loud! Motivational Quotes Inspired by Dogs
Quote: The only thing wrong with trying to please everyone is that there's always at least one person who will remain unhappy. You.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Share, care, hug like a bear.

Author: أحمد زويل,  عصر العلم
Quote: على الرغم من اننى مازلت اتذكر التعصب فى حادثة جامعة برنستون, فغايتى ان استمر فى عملى بجد و عزيمة و اخلاص لأحقق هدفى فى نهاية الأمر.. و ربما استطيع بذلك تغيير رأى هؤلاء الناس بمرور الزمن, و أما اذا وقفت مكتوف الايدى متذمرا, او اندب حظى و أرثى لحالى فعندئذ لن احقق شيئا و لن اتقدم خطوة الى الأمام.

Author: John R. Gouin
Quote: There are many rivers that we cross in our lifetime, unfortunately some of those rivers just don't have bridges.

Author: Joshua Hartzell
Quote: Failure is when you give up. A real winner is someone that doesn't give up, even when it feels like they are losing.

Author: William Goldman,  The Princess Bride
Quote: Life is pain. Anyone who says otherwise is selling something.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Sing You Home
Quote: Into the silence rips a sound that makes me let go of Max's hand and cover my ears. It is like the strafe of a bullet, nails on a chalkboard, promises being broken. It's a note I have never heard - this chord of pure pain - and it takes a moment to realize it is coming from me.

Author: Neil Gaiman
Quote: And life is a good thing for a writer. It's where we get our raw material, for a start. We quite like to stop and watch it.

Author: Ray Bradbury,  A Sound of Thunder and Other Stories
Quote: Time was a film run backward. Suns fled and ten million moons fled after them.

Author: Confucius
Quote: To study and constantly, is this not a pleasure? To have friends come from far away places, is this not a joy? If people do not recognize your worth, but this does not worry you, are you not a true gentleman?

Author: Mark Burnett,  Jump In!: Even If You Don't Know How to Swim
Quote: Facing your fears robs them of their power

Author: Michael Scott,  The Enchantress
Quote: No man is ever just one thing.

Author: Cameron Conaway,  Caged: Memoirs of a Cage-Fighting Poet
Quote: If pain is a pot of boiling water, humor can be the rising steam.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: If the thought inspires you, and it feels good and right...it is yours, alone, to exercise. So get right on it!

Author: Bertice Berry,  Jim and Louella's Homemade Heart-fix Remedy
Quote: I learned long ago that when change comes, you gotta slow down and take note of it. In the midst of that change is all the possibility in the world.

Author: Charles Dickens
Quote: An idea, like a ghost, must be spoken to a little before it will explain itself.

Author: Christopher Stocking
Quote: Nothing makes a person desire improvement like failure

Author: John C. Maxwell,  The 15 Invaluable Laws of Growth: Live Them and Reach Your Potential
Quote: Life is now in session. Are you present?

Author: Diana Rose Morcilla
Quote: Wherever you may go; Life is a beautiful thing. Life is like a passing season. It comes and go. Whatever may come, it's better to enjoy the changing seasons.

Author: Muriel Barbery
Quote: ...we have to surpass ourselves every day, make every day undying. Climb our own personal Everest and do it in such a way that every step is a little bit of eternity. That's what the future is for: to build the present, with real plans, made by living people.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Music is the beat of a drum that keeps time with our emotions.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: Forgetting takes space./Forgotten matters displace/as much anything else as/anything else. We must/skirt unlabeled crates/as thought it made sense/and take them when we go/to other states.

Author: Kay Ryan
Quote: If we have not struggled/as hard as we can/at our strongest/how will we sense/the shape of our losses/or know what sustains/us longest or name/what change costs us,/saying how strange/it is that one sector/of the self can step in/for another in trouble,/how loss activates/a latent double, how/we can feed/as upon nectar/upon need?

Author: Susan Jane Gilman
Quote: Every woman should see herself looking uniquely breathtaking, in something tailored to celebrate her body, so that she is better able to appreciate her own beauty and better equipped to withstand the ideals of our narrow-waisted, narrow- minded culture.

Author: Nicolaus Copernicus
Quote: Of all things visible, the highest is the heaven of the fixed stars.

Author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
Quote: Separate yourself from those who hinder your vision. Make a choice to walk away from the trap set to ensnare you. Realize when someone is pulling you backwards every time you take a step forward. Separate from them and the result of your action will be a life of success.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: Something, somewhere, knows what’s best for me and promises to keep sending me people and experiences to light my way as long as I live in gratitude and keep paying attention to the signs.

Author: Eleesha
Quote: We cannot face up to what lies ahead, without facing up to what lies within.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I hope I don't write TOO many books! When I look at authors who have written too many books, I wonder to myself "When did they live?"I certainly want to write BECAUSE I live! I know I don't want to write in order to live! My writing is an overflow of the wine glass of my life, not a basin in which I wash out my ideals and expectations.

Author: Solange nicole
Quote: It doesn't matter where your journey begins, so long as you begin it...

Author: E.S. Ito,  Negara Kelima
Quote: Anak muda adalah kegelisahan derap langkahnya adalah perubahan.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: I'd rather be interesting, original, & unique then follow the pack. Revel in who you truly are & be liberated!

Author: Todd Stocker
Quote: I wanted to figure out why I was so busy, but I couldn't find the time to do it.

Author: Leila Summers
Quote: Sometimes the only reason for us to be somewhere else is to see things from a different perspective.

Author: Richard Paul Evans
Quote: Everyone who got to where they are had to begin where they were.

Author: Earl Nightingale
Quote: Our attitude toward life determines life's attitude towards us.

Author: Teresa R. Funke,  Doing My Part
Quote: The only difference between a grown-up's mistake and a child's is the size of the consequence.

Author: Patton Oswalt,  Zombie Spaceship Wasteland
Quote: People will find transformation and transcendence in a McDonald's hash brown if it's all they've got.

Author: Sidney Knight
Quote: Don’t hide what you have just because people tell you it’s not normal. I have known normal people…and guess what? They are as boring as hell...

Author: Susan E. Isaacs,  Angry Conversations with God: A Snarky but Authentic Spiritual Memoir
Quote: If I never got to make a living doing what I loved, I'd still do it--for fun and for free.

Author: Yvonne Pierre,  The Day My Soul Cried: A Memoir
Quote: Stop worrying about someone taking your spot. God already have it reserved. Do the work to get there and fill it!

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: One more thing...

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: Birth, life, and death― each took place on the hidden side of a leaf.

Author: Suzanne Selfors,  Saving Juliet
Quote: Our doubts are traitors and make uslose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt. In other words, awish is a good place to start but then you have to get off your butt and make ithappen. You have to pick up a quill and write your own damn story. (Mimi Wallingford)

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: All humanity is one undivided and indivisible family. I cannot detach myself from the wickedest soul.

Author: Shaun Hick
Quote: Cancer gave me an understanding of the point of all this. To survive. Most of our lives it is easy but for the moments when it becomes difficult, when accident or sickness or sadness strikes, it's just about remembering one thing. You must simply survive.

Author: Doug Dillon
Quote: You don’t have to stay trapped in your thoughts just because you think them.

Author: Antony Johnston
Quote: File under "Hard Truths": the creative muse is fiction. If you sit around waiting for the right moment to create, you will die waiting.

Author: Doug Dillon
Quote: Pay attention to the intricate patterns of your existence that you take for granted.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
Quote: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.

Author: Simon Zingerman,  We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
Quote: Using your talent, hobby or profession in a way that makes you contribute with something good to this world is truly the way to go.

Author: Jennifer Elisabeth
Quote: I just want your voice aimed at me again. I want to absorb the direction of your eyes…

Author: John F. Kennedy
Quote: To those peoples in the huts and villages of half the globe struggling to break the bonds of mass misery, we pledge our best efforts to help them help themselves, for whatever period is required - not because the Communists may be doing it, not because we seek their votes, but because it is right. If a free society cannot help the many who are poor, it cannot save the few who are rich.

Author: Michelle Horst,  Visions and Shadows
Quote: ~ Faith lightens the path your shadowed mind has to walk ~

Author: L.M. Fields
Quote: It doesn't matter where you've been, only where you are going.

Author: Sujit Lalwani,  Life Simplified!
Quote: Time is too short in this one life, to be able to do everything, but it definitely is long enough at least to be able to develop the will to do anything & everything...

Author: Sujit Lalwani,  Life Simplified!
Quote: Do not do what you cannot continue to deliver.For, remember, the world wants to see a continuity of delivery of set standards...!

Author: Kevin Ngo,  Let's Do This! 100 Powerful Messages to Help You Take Action
Quote: If you don't make the time to work on creating the life you want, you're eventually going to be forced to spend a LOT of time dealing with a life you don't want.

Author: G. Norman Lippert,  James Potter and the Hall of Elders' Crossing
Quote: a hero is just somebody who does the right thing when it would be far, far easier to do nothing.”-Cedric Diggory-

Author: Ferdinand de Saussure,  Course in General Linguistics
Quote: Time changes all things; there is no reason why language should escape this universal law

Author: Toni Sorenson
Quote: If you have a painting in you, paint. If you have a song to sing, sing. Don’t judge your creation. Just create it. Banish doubt and fear and step out of your own way if you have to. Write if you’re a writer and invent if you’re an inventor. Do what you were born to do. Only then will you know a remarkable life.

Author: G.F. Smith
Quote: What is more precious: a thousand answers derived from one question? Or, one answer…from a thousand questions?

Author: Laura Dave,  The Divorce Party
Quote: Belief isn't supposed to make sense, at least not all the time. In that, it finds its power. It gets to creep up on you and carry you forward. Until you can carry yourself again.

Author: Franz Kafka
Quote: Evil does not exist; once you have crossed the threshold, all is good. Once in another world, you must hold your tongue.

Author: Ken Burns
Quote: There is no communication in this world except between equals.

Author: Irving Stone,  The Agony and the Ecstasy
Quote: An artist without ideas is a mendicant; barren, he goes begging among the hours.

Author: Vera Nazarian,  The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration
Quote: Some women seem so voluptuous in every sense, richly bountiful and fertile with generous gifts of plenty, sensual and confident in their female strength that they are called "earth mothers."That’s how some days feel—when they are bountiful and fertile with the power of our imagination.

Author: Toni Morrison
Quote: I'm interested in the way in which the past affects the present and I think that if we understand a good deal more about history, we automatically understand a great more about contemporary life.

Author: Ogwo David Emenike
Quote: Where would we have been without the discoveries of our predecessors, and where are we going without your discoveries?

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Goals are dreams with a deadline.

Author: Lucille Ball
Quote: Luck? I don’t know anything about luck. I’ve never banked on it and I’m afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: hard work - and realizing what opportunity is and what isn’t."— Lucille Ball

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Diggers
Quote: That’s what being alive is, Thing! It’s being badly prepared for everything! Because you only get one chance, Thing!

Author: Tim Minchin
Quote: I am no nihilist. I am not even a cynic. I am, actually, rather romantic. And here’s my idea of romance: You will soon be dead. Life will sometimes seem long and tough and, god, it’s tiring. And you will sometimes be happy and sometimes sad. And then you’ll beold. And then you’ll be dead.

Author: Rob Liano
Quote: Nothing is born into this world without labor.

Author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
Quote: First of all, let me assert my firm belief that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself - nameless, unreasoning, unjustified terror which paralyzes needed efforts to convert retreat into advance.

Author: Sharon Salzberg,  Real Happiness: The Power of Meditation
Quote: Because the development of inner calm & energy happens completely within & isn’t dependent on another person or a particular situation, we begin to feel a resourcefulness and independence that is quite beautiful—and a huge relief.

Author: Sharon Salzberg,  The Force of Kindness: Change Your Life with Love & Compassion
Quote: We are all too often told by someone that we are too old, too young, too different, too much the same, and those comments can be devastating.

Author: Khalil Gibran
Quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.

Author: John Berry
Quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.

Author: Pablo
Quote: Did you have a rough month? I did :( but, you know what? There’s no time to dwell on a missed opportunity or worry about what I should’ve done or said, beating myself up & making myself miserable about my mistakes. That doesn’t work. So will take notes from that, put it behind me, move on & finish the year STRONG

Author: Joseph M. Hanneman,  The Journey Home: My Father's Story of Cancer, Faith and Life-Changing Miracles
Quote: This is the story of how Dad lived with his lung cancer. But it is much more. Through his illness and the miracles we experienced, I came to see that Dad's was not just a journey. It was a journey home. Home to God.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Create your best life with your consciously chosen thoughts, words, and actions.

Author: Amy Leigh Mercree
Quote: Daily love and kindness are the path to a happy life.

Author: Terry Fox
Quote: I believe in miracles.... I have to.

Author: Orison Swett Marden
Quote: Opportunities? They are all around us ... There is power lying latent everywhere waiting for the observant eye to discover it.

Author: Sujit Lalwani,  Life Simplified!
Quote: It Hurts...It Kills...It Teaches...It Thrills...“IT” Is LIFE...!

Author: Tonny K. Brown
Quote: The greatest thing you will ever give to the world is your committment to leave what you find in better condition than the way you found it. Leave a single light in a place where there was once darkness so those coming behind you may see further and begin where you left.

Author: Marilyn Suttle,  Who's Your Gladys?: How to Turn Even the Most Difficult Customer Into Your Biggest Fan
Quote: For every dilemma, find at least three or four possible solutions. The creative process leads to better results.

Author: David Gemmell
Quote: We make choices every day, some of them good, some of them bad. And if we are strong enough, we live with the consequences.

Author: Qaisar Iqbal Janjua
Quote: Hatred is a louder exhibition of inability.

Author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib
Quote: Generosity is to help a deserving person without his request, and if you help him after hisrequest, then it is either out of self-respect or to avoid rebuke.

Author: Anonymous,  The Poetic Edda
Quote: Men brave and generous live the best lives, seldom will they sorrow; then there are fools, afraid of everything, who grumble instead of giving.

Author: Luci Anneu Sèneca
Quote: When you enter a grove peopled with ancient trees, higher than the ordinary, and shutting out the sky with their thickly inter-twined branches, do not the stately shadows of the wood, the stillness of the place, and the awful gloom of this doomed cavern then strike you with the presence of a deity?

Author: Alice Fulton
Quote: Anguish is the universal language

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: Even after the stormiest weather, a true warrior will still reflect the brilliant rays of the magnificent sun through both his or her eyes. You may get hit by sudden lighting or take severe beatings from the cruel wind, but you will always get back up and stand strong on your feet again, soak in the sunlight, and be prepared to get hit by even the most merciless hail - time and time again.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The power of hope! Even a lack of ambition can, for a time, pay off as a necessary facet, as long as hope outweighs it.

Author: Robertson Davies,  What's Bred in the Bone
